loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Rodulfo is providing motorcycle or "habal-habal" services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Rodulfo has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rodulfo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Sandaglham

texts.en:
Sandaglham is a widowed woman who lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her two kids are college students. She started her retail business by opening a grocery shop in 1996. 

In recent years, many buildings have been built and her shop's income is increasing rapidly. Due to a lack of supplies, though, growth has been slow. 

Her daily income is 350,000 MNT and it has potential to increase. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says " I have a two college kids and it is hard to pay two fees but I will not rest until my two kids are educated". 

She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more grocery products.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Maria Herminia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Herminia es viuda, tiene 52 años de edad, es maestra de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos 2 de los cuales estudian, lleva varios años de ser maestra.

Solicita un prestamos para poder comprar productos para tienda, ya que ella atiende vendiendo productos de consumo, el dinero lo utilizara para la compra de productos como aguas gaseosa, jugos, golosinas, azúcar, etc. espera ver su negocio en el futuro prospero.
texts.en:
Maria Herminia is a widow. She is 52 years old and is an elementary school teacher. She has two children, who are students. She has been a teacher for several years.

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase products for her store. She sells consumer goods. She will use the money to purchase products such as soft drinks, juices, sweets, sugar, etc. She hopes her business will have a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase products for her store

loans.name: Flor Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. Flor es socia del banco comunal Más que Vencedoras, vive en la hermosa ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que se caracteriza por la belleza de sus iglesias, paisajes, la cultura y tradiciones de su gente quienes son personas amables, gentiles y cálidas. 

La Señora. Flor tiene 39 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 19, 17, 10 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio, su segunda hija es casada vive independiente y sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico y labora en un taller propio, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Flor se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Herbalife, en esta actividad se encuentra 8 años, trabaja sin un horario fijo y de domingo a domingo. También le ayuda a su esposo a trabajar en el taller.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y su crédito lo va a invertir una parte para comprar repuestos automotrices para el taller de su esposo y  otra para comprar productos  Herbalife para la venta.
 
Su meta es tener más capital de trabajo para crecer  en la venta de sus productos y en el taller de su esposo.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the communal bank Más que Vencedoras (More than Conquerors). She lives in the beautiful city of Azogues, a city which is known for its beautiful churches, streets, culture, and traditions of its inhabitants who are kind, gentle, and warm. 

Flor is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children aged 19, 17, 10, and 8 years old. Her first daughter studies in college, her second daughter is married and lives on her own, and her last two children study at a school in the city. Her husband is a mechanic and works at his own shop. They don’t have their own home, and for that reason they rent. 

Flor sells Herbalife brand natural products. She’s been doing this work for 8 years. She doesn’t have set hours, and she works from Sunday to Sunday. She also helps her husband at the auto shop. 

She’s been a member of the communal bank for 6 years. She will invest one part of her loan into the purchase of auto parts for the shop, and she will invest the other part into the purchase of Herbalife products to sell. 

Her goal is to get more working capital to expand her product sales and her husband’s auto shop.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife brand natural products and auto parts.

loans.name: Riverside Group

texts.en:
Truphenah is the facilitator of the Riverside group. Truphenah and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Truphenah  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Truphenah joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Truphenah had a very good maize yield, harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Truphenah was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Truphenah will invest in livestock rearing and hence educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Riverside group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Truphenah with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn is 43 years old and has three children working for others in grinding maize for fees. For more than ten years, she has been growing maize as her main income source to feed her children. Sometimes she works for others to raise additional income. 

Yorn leads a group of four female members applying for their first loan while her group members have been with VisionFund for one to two years. Now requesting a loan, she will use it to buy agricultural tools i.e. hoes, plows, etc for her farming. This loan will enable her to have sufficient tools to increase her business and she also hopes to make a good profit from this business in order to better feed her children.

loans.use: To buy agricultural tools for her farming.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La alcancía Comunal “Las Hormiguitas” es un grupo unido que está conformado por 09 socios entre hombres y mujeres la cual lleva trabajando 08 Meses  con Edaprospo. 
La Sra. Julia tiene 50 años de edad es casada y tiene 04 hijos la cual sigue apoyando a 01 de ellos, ya que está en etapa escolar, en la fotografía se ubicada a lado derecho, ella viste una blusa color fucsia y tiene el cabello corto, esta al costado de la señora que viste un polo negro y pantalón rojo. 
Hace más de 25 años que la Sra. Julia se dedica a la venta de comida, en un local alquilado, gracias a su negocio la Sra. Julia ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida.
Con el fin de mejorar su negocio solicito el crédito para la compra de mesas, cubiertos y un horno microonda y de esta manera brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes.
La Sra. Rosa no pudo estar presente en el desembolso por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
The community bank "Las Hormiguitas" ("The Little Ants") is a united group made up of nine members, both men and women, who have been working with the Programa Prosperidad ("Prosperity Program") for eight months. Julia is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom she continues to support, as he is stil in school. In the photo she is on the right hand side in a fuschia blouse and with short hair; she is at the side of the woman in the black shirt and red pants. 

For more than 25 years, Julia has worked selling food from a rented spaces. Thanks to her business, Julia has been able to improve her living space, and she is now buying her own property. Julia's wish is to finish the construction of her home. WIth the goal of improving her business, she is applying for a loan to buy tables, silverware, and a microwave, and in this way, provide her customers with a better experience. The "Las Hormiguitas" community bank are thankful for and dedicated to their working relationship with the Programa Prosperidad. For work-related reasons, Rosa, one member of the group, was not able to be present for the initial distribution of capital (when the photo was taken).

loans.use: para la compra de mesas, cubiertos y un horno microonda.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.fr:
Cliente de 48 ans, celibataire sans enfant, elle se lance dans la vente des vivres frais, il y a bientôt 10 ans,quand elle divorce avec son mari, Avec un  peu d'argent,  elle avait commence a vendre au marche  sur un étalage.
 Elle a deja beneficiee de 3 cycles de prêts a Hope, au premier prêt , elle achète des cartons de viande de bœuf des cotes de porcs , et a l'heure actuelle avec ce nouveau prêt , elle a encore doublée son stock de vivres frais en ajoutant 10 cartons de cuisses de poulets, 10 cartons de cotes de porc, 5 cartons de tripes et 5 cartons de viande de bœuf, elle a une capacité de vente de 15 a 25 cartons par jour  
Elle est une bonne cliente, elle a toujours bien remboursée et a fait des épargnes considérables .
Elle a des très bonnes  ambitions et  elle a pour  projet d'acheter son propre chambre froide  et devenir une grossiste
texts.en:
This customer, who is 48 years old, single and has no children, began selling fresh food almost ten years ago, when she got divorced from her husband. With a little money she began selling on a stall in the market. She has already had three loans from Hope: with the first loan she bought cartons of beef and pork ribs and with this new loan she has again doubled her stock of fresh food buy adding ten cartons of chicken legs, ten cartons of pork ribs, five cartons of tripe and five cartons of beef. She has the capacity to sell between 15 and 25 cartons a day.

She is a good customer and has always repaid her loans and made considerable savings. She has a lot of ambition and her plan is to buy her own cold room and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy cartons of ribs, tripe and chicken legs

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a married woman. She has 2 children, ages ranging from 5 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be honest and a God-fearing person. She operates a beauty salon where she provides services of plaiting, blowdrying and selling braids. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at a busy and viable area and her primary customers are nearby residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be customers' tardiness. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a hair dryer and beauty products. Her business goal is to run a bigger salon within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and beauty products.

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en:
This is 53 year old Abdul.  He is married and has four children ages, 4, 7,18 and 26 years old.  He has one additional dependent, who lives with him helping him with the house chores.  In 2008, Abdul established his used bag business.  He began his business just to be self-reliant after coming from working in the mines. 

His business is located in city centre and his main customers are adults.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 899,313 every month from this business.  He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000.  Abdul requires a loan in order to buy school bags and traveling bags.  He hopes that this loan can increase his stock and expand the business.  In the future, Abdul plans to improve the business and expand to other areas of the town.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing to resell, including jeans, shirts, and t-shirts

loans.name: Mahukpehu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEHU composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même maison. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la sixième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Célestine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 54 ans. Célestine est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Sévérin. Le couple a quatre enfants, scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Célestine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Célestine vend des perles, des colliers et des bijoux de façon ambulante ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants. Célestine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Célestine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHUKPEHU, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des perles, des bijoux et des colliers.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Amina, who is 52 years of age. She is a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Kipsaina, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and has six children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland.

Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets, and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Janepher's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Janepher, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 9 farmers in Chwele District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to 4 children, known by her community as a very reliable person.

Initially, Janepher joined One Acre Fund in 2008 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has been able to consistently feed her family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Janepher plans to rent more land to cultivate in.

Between the 9 farmers in Janepher's Group, a total of 5.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther would like to buy an ox

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 34 years and a single mother of 3 children. She had education up to the vocational level and specialised in textile works. Currently she runs her own sewing notions shop in a busy suburb of the city. Items for sale include colour designs, zips, thread, and calico.

Having gone through the 'TEACH' sessions of KRABAN, she is poised to add other items that are in demand as well. She hopes the KIVA loan would make this expansion a reality.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her vegetable kiosk

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir A. is a 57-year-old married man who has his own petrol station. Zakir lives with his wife and four children in the southern Azerbaijan region near Imishli, in the village of Boshallar. He rented his small petrol station in 1998, repaired the place and opened his business. He and his son work together and over the years they have earned constant customers. Since 2005 the price for petrol in Azerbaijan has increased by 50 percent. To keep his clients he is applying for $1,000 to keep buying the same amount of petrol he was selling before the price increased.

loans.use: To purchase more petrol

loans.name: Srey Nein

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Srey Nein has been married since 1991 and has 2 children. She learned to weave from her aunt in 1995, and started her own silk-weaving business that same year. Her husband is a policeman in the Prek Ampil commune.     

Mrs. P. is requesting a loan of US$1,000. It is the first time she is borrowing from MAXIMA. Of the US$1,000, she will use US$300 to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom, while the remaining US$700 will be spent on repairing her house.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Sr. Rubén S. is 34 years old with three young children. He has been providing for his family from a very young age and was forced to end his studies early due to economic problems.

Rubén has been the owner of a small convenience store since 2002. He was able to open this store through the money he saved while working in a factory that made gloves. His time working in this factory generated enough income to support his family and allowed him to save a little money. With this money and a small loan he was able to open his store which provides daily necessities to his community.

With the help of his wife, who works as the clerk and handles administrative tasks, Rubén´s store is well liked by those in the area. They have many loyal customers. Rubén´s goal is to provide a higher standard of living for himself and his children. He hopes that by providing them with the education he was not able to have they will move forward and become professionals.

The money Rubén has borrowed will allow him to buy fruits and vegetables augmenting his inventory.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Francisca Del Rosari

texts.es:
Francisca del Rosario has a small home in the Hialeah neighborhood in Managua. Her home is very small and the majority is made of zinc laminate. Ms. Francisca is a seamstress, a business with which she maintains her 4 children that still economically depend on her. One of her biggest objectives is to give a better quality of life to her family. She needs the money to construct concrete walls and from there to continue advancing in the total improvement of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca del Rosario tiene una pequeña vivienda en el barrio Hialeah de Managua. Su vivienda es muy pequeña y está hecha en gran parte por láminas de zinc. Doña Francisca es costurera, negocio con el cual otorga el sustento a 4 hijos que todavía dependen económicamente de ella. Uno de sus grandes objetivos es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Necesita el dinero para construir las paredes del cuarto de concreto, y así poder ir avanzando en el mejoramiento total de su vivienda.

loans.use: Construction of walls in a room of a house

loans.name: Corina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs Corian is 36 years old and married. She has 3 children, aged 8, 10 and 11 years, who all study in primary school. They live in Sabana Grande, a region a little ways away from the city of Managua. Mrs Corina and her husband have a butane distribution business, which generates the income for their family. The husband of Mrs Corina is responsible for distributing the gas to residences using a motorcycle. The space where they have the gas is rented, since they do not have sufficient space in their home. This product is in very high demand among their neighbors and that is why they need the loan; to be able to buy more canisters of gas and thus to be able to rotate them and always have them available.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Corian tiene 36 años de edad, es casada. Tiene 3 hijos uno de 8, 10 y 11 años, todos estudian la educación primaria. Habitan en Sabana Grande, una comarca un poco alejada de la ciudad de Managua. Doña Corina y su esposo tienen un negocio de distribución de Gas Butano, el cual les genera los ingresos a su familia. El esposo de Doña Corina es el encargado de distribuir el gas a domicilio en una motocicleta.El espacio donde ellos tienen el gas es alquilado ya que en su hogar no cuentan con el espacio suficiente. Este producto es muy demandado entre sus vecinos es por eso que necesitan el préstamo, para poder comprar más unidades de gas y así poder rotarlos y tener siempre en existencia.

loans.use: To purchase more canisters of gas for her business.

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en: Modupe O. is a married woman with 3 children. She is 53 years old. She sells drinks. She has been in business since 1987. She needs a loan in the amount of $450 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
My name is Zarina M., and I am married and a mother of two boys. My elder son is five years old and attends kindergarten, while the younger son is four years old also attends kindergarten. My husband is a carpenter and he buys and sells wood in a nearby big city.

I would like to share this loan with a few other women who have joined me in this loan group, and they are: Zarina M., who is borrowing for her wholesale business; Rani A. S., who will use the loan to improve their fruit business; Balqees I., who will also improve her business; and Riffat B., who wants to buy wood. All of these women dream of a comfortable, and sound economic, life.

loans.use: Expand wood business

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora is 46 years old and is a single woman with two children, ages 16 and 13. She also takes care of one other person, aged 75.

Debora owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2001. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items such as weaving and hair treatment for her salon.

loans.use: To buy more items for her salon.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha A.  is a trader who sells clothing materials. She is a single parent with three children. Martha's business is growing and she would like to use the proceeds from her loan to purchase more inventory for resale. This will increase sales and improve her income.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing materials for resale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 39 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2002. Her family income is mostly used in agriculturing and breeding animals. Since joining the Fund, she used the borrowed money in breeding pigs and planting vegetables. These activities help improving her family economy. She furnishes her house, improves her living conditions. She has 6 children and all of them are going to school. Her family realizes that investing in breeding pigs and planting vegetables is very effective. Therefore, she wants to borrow 550 USD this time to invest in the same project. Her average income is approximately 150 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị L. 39 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2002, nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị chủ yếu chông vào nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi, khi tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và chồng mầu, từ việc kinh doanh này kinh tế gia đình chị đã thay đổi theo hàng năm, gia đình chị đã mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình, đời sống hàng ngày được cải thiện, chị có 6 người con va các con chị đều được chị đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ. Gia đình chị nhận thấy việc đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn và chồng hoa mầu là hiệu quả nên vòng vốn này chị xin vay 9.000.000đ vẫn đầu tư vào dự án trên. Thu nhập bình quân.2.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: breeding pigs and planting vegetables

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon P. is a farmer in Snam Pok Village in Kampong Speu Province. During the rainy season she cultivates rice, and in the dry season she grows vegetables. Since her business activity cannot support her family well, Mrs. Phon P. wants to start a grocery business. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy grocery goods to start this business.

Mrs. Phon P. is a 37-year-old widow with five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory. The other three are studying at state school. Previously, Mrs. Phon P. had obtained a loan to buy watermelon seeds for cultivating and she succeeded in paying off this loan.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to start her new business to improve living conditions.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en: Rizwana Tabassum Baji is the wife of A. B.. He is a driver by profession. Rizwana baji is a house wife and prefers to do household work. She lives with her family in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a four rooms brick house. She is a mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder sons run a cosmetics shop. Rizwana is applying for a loan to buy material (lipsticks, nail polish, various type of creams) for her sons' shop.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Asha's Mungu Muweza Group

texts.en:
Asha is married and has 7 children, all between 20 and 30 years old. Since year 2000, Asha has been earning income as a bites seller. She works every day and can earn a monthly profit of about US$40 from the sales.

Currently, Asha needs a loan to improve her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, who have businesses dealing with bread and juice sales.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua la señora Angelina C. se dedica desde hace 12 años a su negocio de pulpería el cual atiende muy amablemente con el propósito de mantener su hogar.

Hoy en día el motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar su mercadería para comercializarla. Es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y así suplir su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión. Son sus sueños seguir con su negocio para así continuar mejorando su situación económica.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in Managua city, Mrs. Angelina C. has had her convenience store business for more than 12 years which she amiably runs with the goal of supporting her home. Today she has approached Ceprodel for a loan to buy merchandise to sell. For this reason she approached Ceprodel and in this way she can supply her business but she requires an investment to do so. Her dreams are to keep on with her business and in this way continue improving her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza N. is 19 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Shahnoza is a market vendor. She sells women's clothing in the local market. After finishing the school she started her own business because she needed money to help her parents pay for household and personal expenses. Shahnoza has been in this business for 4 years already. In these years she has managed to make her business stable and profitable, generating a steady income for her family and allowing her to support her parents. Now Shahnoza is planning to expand her business, and in order to do so, she’ll need to increase her working capital to purchase new autumn clothing for sale. With this purpose, Shahnoza requests 2500 Somoni ($750) for a term of 9 months. She promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting her.

loans.use: To buy new fall clothes for sale

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate O. is 40 years old and is married with six children. All of her children are in school. Kate sells provisions and drinks. She also sells firewood. Kate makes the most profit from the sale of provisions and drinks.

Kate needs a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She would like to express her gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long S. is a 37 year old resident of Pursat Province. She sells groceries and cakes for children from her house. She started her business in 2000, and currently earns a net profit of $2 each day. She is married with four children, all of whom are single and attend school.

Her husband, Mr. So Rin, 38, is a local cultivator. He grows rice and vegetable crops. Crops are the main way for him to earn a living. He now works hard on growing his crops and hopes to enlarge his business, thus after discussion with his wife, they decided to request a loan to buy an extra plot of farmland for growing crops. (Long S.'s husband is pictured, because she was not available that day.)

loans.use: To buy extra a plot of farmland for growing crops.

loans.name: Sakin

texts.en: Mrs. Sakin E. is 50 years old, single, and now lives in Preak Svay village, Kandal province, Cambodia. She sells desserts in addition to cultivating rice on her small piece of land. She does not have enough money to buy fertilizer and hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan for these purposes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire a laborer with two oxen.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina sells fruit and vegetables at “Covered Market” in Belaya Tserkov, central Ukraine. She currently has a vending location at a huge outdoor market where hundreds of vendors sell all sorts of different items. Valentina started her business about 6 years ago. She has an entrepreneurial mind and has worked hard to develop her business. Some of Valentina’s personal goals are: fix the roof in her kitchen and generate sufficient income to pay college fee for her kids. 

Valentina has requested a loan of 5,000 Ukrainian Grivnas to purchase additional merchandise for her vending kiosk. With assorted inventory, she will be able to increase her sales and continue working to make a better life for her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахнозе 26 лет. Она не замужем, нигде не работает. Вместе со своей матерью Шахноза торгует на местном рынке, и ассортимент ее товаров включает в себя мелкие товары. Доход от торговли весомо пополняет семейный бюджет Шахнозы и ее родителей. Недавно она приобрела новый киоск, который является одновременно и камерой хранения для ее товаров. Оборотные средства ее бизнеса уменьшились и поэтому Шахноза решила получить займ. Новый займ собирается погасить в течении 2 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is 26 years old. She is unmarried and is self-employed. She sells an assortment of products, including small novelties, at the local market with her mother. The income from sales is a weighty part of Shahnoza and her parent's household budget. Recently she obtained a new stall which also serves as locked storage for her goods. The business's working capital declined, so Shahnoza decided to request a loan. The loan will be repaid over 2 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Teofilo Elio

texts.es:
Teofilo F. es un caballero muy esforzado el cual labora arduamente con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia por medio del mejoramiento de su vivienda por lo que ha iniciado la remodelación de su casa de habitación.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta manera dar por finalizado su reconstrucción de su vivienda y así junto con su familia tener un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Teofilo F. is a hard-working man who struggles every day to bring home enough money to support his family. He's started a project to remodel his house so that he can make their lives more comfortable. He's approached Ceprodel to apply for a loan so that he can buy construction materials which he will use to finish the remodeling, a project that will help him give his family a decent place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: Consolata Obaren

texts.en: Consolata Obaren Ngong’a is a 38-year-old mother of 3 children aged 20, 14 and 13. She lives and works in Nymasaria township where she runs a small hotel (restaurant) and sells chapatti, beans, rice and ugali. Consolata recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase food stock for a restaurant.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Mr. O. James is 28 years old and is married with a four-year-old kid. He lives with six dependents and he has been in his business, a Mutembe pride enterprise, for over six years. He will use the loan to purchase items for his shop, such as clothes, bags, buckets, belts, flow carpets, plastic chairs, flasks, lamps, and television sets.

He is a hardworking man, open-minded and encouraging. His dream is to complete his commercial house.

loans.use: To purchase items for his shop such as clothes, bags, buckets, and belts.

loans.name: Vilma Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Vilma C. posee su propio tramo en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua donde se dedica a su actividad de venta de bisuterías como lo son alcancías, cepillos, coladores, perchas, pastes, panas plásticas, entre otros ofertados todos los días en su localidad.

Ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de las bisuterías ya que requiere adquirirlas para ofertarlas y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio y continuar manteniendo su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Señora Vilma C. has her own plot in the major market of the city of Managua, where she works at the activity of selling costume jewellery and things like piggy banks, brushes, colanders, coat hangers, dish clothes, among other offerings every day in her neighbourhood. She is asking for a loan from CEPRODEL in order to buy her wares as she needs to get them in order to sell them, and by this manner move ahead in her business and to continue maintaining her nuclear family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wares

loans.name: Razia Allah Ditta Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji wants a loan to buy decorative pieces to sell.

Rashda baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Sugran baji wants a loan to buy material (clothes, colored thread and beads) for her decorative embroidery business.

Irshad baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

Razia baji is the group leader of these ladies listed above. They all live in Lahore, Pakistan. Razia baji is a very hardworking lady. She runs a clothes selling business in the community. She buys clothes from the city of Multan at cheap prices and sells to the clothing shops and her community. Razia baji does this work to support her family and to have an independent life. Her husband runs a business selling artificial jewelry. He sells jewelry sets to the jewelry shops of the main markets of Lahore, Ichra and AnarkA.. Razia baji is applying for a loan to buy jewelry sets to expand her husband’s business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy artificial jewelry sets to sell

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас 41 год. Она замужем и мать 3-х детей. Мукаддас занимается пошивом женской одежды на заказ. Она училась у хорошей швеи пол года. Теперь почти 7 лет она самостоятельно берет заказы и шьет разную женскую одежду, в том числе национальные платья, юбки, сорочки, брюки и т.д. Мукаддас берет кредит в нашей организации в первые. Она хочет приобрести импортную машину "Аверлог" для своего дела. Мукаддас надеется, что кредит поможет ей расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Mukaddas is 41 years old, married and has 3 children. Mukaddas is involved in sewing women’s clothing to-order. She learned from a good seamstress for half a year. Since then, she has been taking orders on her own for almost 7 years. She sews various women’s clothing, including traditional dresses, skirts, shirts, pants, etc. This is Mukaddas’s first time requesting a loan at our organization. She wants to purchase an imported sewing machine Averlog for her business. Mukaddas hopes that this loan will help her expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of the Averlog sewing machine

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Mỹ Nguyễn Thị (622981132) is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has two infant children.

Mỹ owns and operates a manufacturing business, manufacturing and selling iron products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month.

In 2004, Mỹ joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

Mỹ is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mankah

texts.en: P. is a 56-year-old mother of three. She has been a GHAPE member since the very beginning of the organization and is now looking to take out her 9th loan from the organization. With this last loan, she is looking to expand her provision store, and she is hoping that she will be able to sell fruit and other foodstuffs in addition to the regular things to be found in a provision store, such as candles, soap, drinks, and dried goods. P. is sure that this expansion will be a success not only because of the larger selection of things that she will be able to offer to her customers, but also because of the loyal base of customers that she has as well as the experience that she has in running such a business. Because of this experience, she has been able to pick out a good business location, and has also been able to see that there is a much larger profit margin in selling fruit, as compared to other produce items. This growth will benefit the community in that people will be able to have access to more nutritious food at any time that they would want to purchase it, and also because of the practices that P. has learned over time that aid in building her business. With the profits of this venture, P. will be able to afford the drugs that she needs to stay healthy, and she will also be able to pay her grandchildren’s school fees. In addition to this, she will be able to pay her rent and reinvest in expanding her business. Patrica originally came to GHAPE because of the long term repayment, lack of collateral and low rents. But since that time, she has found use in their training programs for business development, and also because of the follow up that GHAPE credit assistants and community members make to be able to be sure that people’s businesses are succeeding and that they are getting all the help that they need to be able to stay successful into the future. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To expand her provision store

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family.

Afia is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey in the daytime by the roadside. Kenkey is a Ghanaian dish which is prepared from fermented corn dough that is cooked and wrapped in the corn husk and eaten with hot pepper. She buys her raw material such as maize and other ingredient from Techiman which she claims is cost-effective. Afia has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize to expand her business

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es:
Ana Bertha H. tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente, con 3 hijos, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en Horacio zevallos distrito de Ate departamento de Lima.
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad desde hace 3 años, Actualmente asume el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía comunal “Las Violetas” integrada por  10 socios quienes realizan  actividades de servicio y comercio.
Ana se dedica a la venta  de productos de belleza desde hace 3 años,  también hace trabajos manuales como el pegado de lentejuelas desde hace un año. Con su nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de maderas  y palos para apoyar  a su esposo en su trabajo ya  que él es maestro albañil (las maderas y palos se utiliza como soporte para realizar los techados de las casas y cuando no se cuenta con lo necesario se tiene que alquilarlos y por lo tanto reduce su ganancia).
Ana hasta el momento ha  logrado construir  las paredes  de su casa con material de concreto, anhelando en el futuro poder techar su casita, ya que con la ayuda de su esposo ambos cooperan para que sus sueños se hagan realidad.
texts.en:
Ana Bertha H., 42, lives with her common law husband and 3 children in the Horacio Zevallos area, district of Ate, department of Lima. She has worked with EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad for 3 years and currently occupies the role of president of the village bank "Las Violetas", made up of 10 partners who work in service and trade activities. Ana has worked in the sale of beauty products for 3 years, also doing handi-work like gluing sequins for the past year. With the new loan, she will invest in buying wood and poles to support her husband in his work as a chief bricklayer (he uses the wood and poles as support for roofs of houses and when he doesn't know whether they will be needed, he rents them which reduces his profit).

Until now, Ana has been able to build the walls of their house with concrete but in the future she would like to be able to roof their house, and with the help of her husband they can work together to make their dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and poles to support her husband in his work as chief bricklayer (he uses the wood and poles as support for roofs of houses and when he doesn't know whether they will be needed, he rents them which reduces his profit).

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La microempresaria Maria Luisa M. Jarquín tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 5 hijos y desde hace 4 años se dedica a viajar a las comunidades para vender ropas, principalmente pantalones de hombres y mujeres, blusas, faldas, shorts entre otras prendas de vestir.

Por su situación de madre soltera le ha tocado mantener a todos sus hijos a ella sola y por tal razón es que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le deja un poco ganancia, sin embargo por la situación del desempleo no tiene muchas alternativas. Hay que señalar que parte del producto que lleva lo obtiene al crédito y solamente le  dan de plazo un mes para regresar la plata y en ocasiones ella da crédito a sus clientes sin contar con el apoyo económico.

Por lo planteado esta solicitando se le financie para comprar los siguientes productos:

10 unidades de Pantalones de hombre a US 12 compra cada unidad, 10 unidades de pantalón de mujer estilo pescador a US 10 cada unidad, 12 unidades de  blusas a US 8 cada unidad, 12 unidades de faldas a US 8 cada unidad y 11 unidades de short de varón a US 8 cada unidad.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa M. Jarquín is a 41 year old entrepreneur. She is a single mother with five children. For four years she has traveled to other communities to sell clothes. She primarily sells men’s and women’s pants, blouses, skirts, and shorts among other articles of clothing. Being a single mother, it falls to her alone to support all of her children. That is why she works selling clothes, which gives her a little income. Nevertheless, with the unemployment situation she has few alternatives. She gets part of the products she sells with credit. They only give her one month to repay the money. She is left without operating funds because she sometimes extends credit to her strapped customers She is asking for a loan to buy the following products: 10 pairs of men’s pants @ $12 per pair, 10 pairs of women’s capri pants @ $10 per pair, 12 blouses @ $8 per blouse, 12 skirts @ $8 per skirt, and 11 pairs of men’s shorts at $8 per pair.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy men's pants, capri pants, blouses, skirts, and men's shorts

loans.name: Merida

texts.es:
Mérida vive con su esposo y sus hijos  en una casa alquilada. Hace 6 meses decidió iniciar un negocio D. venta D. ropa D. segundo uso, la cual adquiere en la ciudad capital (Lima) y en otras ocasiones en su misma ciudad. Mérida sale todas la mañanas para ofrecer sus prendas, las cuales tienen muy buen aspecto y están en óptimas condiciones, lo cual le que permiten una venta segura, ya que las ofrece a precios muy bajos. Para ella es muy gratificante ver que tienen buenas ganancias y pueD. trabajar junto a su esposo, quien la ayuda con la compra D. la mercadería, por tal motivo Mérida trabajará arduamente para incrementar su capital y obtener mejores ganancias para su familia.
Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser una persona puntual en sus pagos y digna D. confianza. El dinero que ahora solicita estará destinado a la compra D. más ropa D. segundo uso, en grandes cantidades, para que pueda asegurarse mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Merida lives with her husband and children in a rented house. 6 months ago she decided to start a business in the sale of second-hand clothing, which she acquires in the capital (Lima), and on other occasions in her own city. Merida leaves every morning to sell her clothing that is appealing and in optimal conditions, which secures her sales given that she offers them at very low prices. For Merida it is very gratifying to make good profits and she can also work with her husband who helps her purchase merchandise, because of this Merida will work arduously to increase her work capital and to obtain better earnings for her family.

This is the third opportunity that she has been able to acquire a loan through MFP; during this time she has shown herself to be punctual in her payments and a trustworthy person. The money that she is currently requesting will be used to purchase more second-hand clothing in large quantities to ensure higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise (second-hand clothing).

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions. She is 36 years old and married with four children. She has been in her business for a long time, and she is happy because this is the high season for her business. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 naira to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La joven Maria A. de 21 años de edad, casada y con un hijo de 2 añitos, su esposo trabaja de mensajero en una farmacia, peligroso por que anda en una moto en todas los barrio de la capital dejando el medicamento que el cliente pide a domicilio. Ella se desempeña como atención al cliente  en pollo tip top desde hace dos años y su niña se la cuida  su mama, este es su segundo matrimonio ya que su esposo anterior murió en un accidente el cual marco una tristeza grande en su vida, y es por eso que vive con temor. Con el crédito anterior compro materiales para hacer un cuarto pero no pudo terminarlo es por eso que comprara mas piedra, zinc, cemento y otros para terminar la construcción ya que codo esta caro esta difícil construir en estos tiempos hay que esforzarse mucho para lograr lo deseado. da las gracias ala institución por el apoyo con el financiamiento ya que ha logrado tener un techo para su hija y privacidad en mi vida.
texts.en:
21 year old Maria A.,is married and has a two year old child, her husband works as a deliveryman for a pharmacy, this is a dangerous job because he is on a motor bike in all the neighborhoods of the city to drop off the medicine clients request for delivery. She has worked for two years in customer service for “pollo tip”; her mom takes care of her daughter. This is her second marriage because her first husband died in an accident; this was very sad for her and is the reason why she lives with fear. With the previous loan she bought materials to build a room but she couldn’t finish it because she needs to buy more stone, zinc, concrete and other materials to finish the construction because everything is expensive and it’s hard to build, nowadays one has to work really hard to achieve what one wants. She thanks the institution for the support with the loan because she now has a roof for her daughter and privacy in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stone, concrete and zinc to finish building a room

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana I. is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Auala 2. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ana owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Ana has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Ana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, de 31 años, es un padre muy responsable y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su familia y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.

Su taller de mecánica es uno de los más concurridos de la ciudad, ya que los autos salen muy bien reparados después de los rigurosos arreglos que les brinda. Desde muy joven aprendió esta labor, puesto que ha trabajado en muchos talleres anteriormente, lo cual ha hecho que sea muy hábil reparando autos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dejar los carros como nuevos, ya que se esmera mucho en repararlos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cargar los pesados repuestos que tiene que colocar en algunos carros. 
Para más adelante, espera abrir un taller en una zona más céntrica de su ciudad, ya que actualmente está muy alejado.

Este es el primer préstamo de Roberto con MFP y quiere pagarlo a tiempo y sin demora, ya que desea acceder a más créditos posteriormente. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos repuestos para arreglar mejor los autos.
texts.en:
Roberto, 31, is a very responsible, hard-working father. He lives in a rented house with his family and his greatest desire is to get ahead in life. His auto mechanic shop is one of the busiest in town because the cars come out well repaired after the rigorous repairs he provides. He learned this skill at an early age because he has worked in other shops before which has made him highly skilled in car repair. What he likes the most about his work is making the cars be like new since he puts in a lot of effort to repair them. He has been in this line of work for 10 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be lugging the heavy replacement parts that he has to place in some cars. For later on, he hopes to open a shop in a more centrally-located site in the city because his current shop is far. This is Roberto's first loan with MFP and he wants to repay it without delay because he wants to have access to future loans. With the fifteen-hundred new soles requested he will buy new replacement parts to better repair cars.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en: Pinky I. is from the town of Ilagan. She is 26 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Pinky owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables and cooked foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Pinky joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is single and has three children. She has received no formal education. Comfort bakes and sells bread at Ataabazi near Elmina, which she has been doing since 1990. Comfort uses her income to pay for her children's school fees and other expenses. 

Comfort will use the loan to purchase more flour, margarine, sugar and other ingredients needed to bake her bread. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to reinvest in the business to increase her capital base.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for baking bread

loans.name: Radjabali

texts.ru: Сайфидинов Раджабали проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 33 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Сайфидинов Раджабали имеет собственную торговую точку на рынке. В области торговли работает 5 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Radjabali S. lives in the Vahdat district. He is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. Radjabali has his own retail outlet at a market. He has been working in the retail sales field for 5 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena C. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 22 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nena owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2010, Nena joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mrs. Ny Koem  Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has nine people who live in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. Mrs. Ny K. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will each use a loan for a different purpose. She and her husband, Mr. Chork Phorn, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow crops to sell, supporting their family living. They have some problems because their field is infertile soil and it is far from any irrigation system. Thus, in order to improve crops and make them more productive, Mrs. Ny K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel, and the rest of the loan she would like to use to hire a farm laborer. She is the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, another is too small to go to school or work, and the others are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, fuel

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Elizabeth junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, Además Elizabeth siembra verduras que vende en el M. de abastos.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
Los sueños de Elizabeth son construir su casa y trabajar para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the "Solución" ("Solution") communal bank. She is 29 years old and has a live-in partner and 3 children. Together with her partner, she works making handmade bricks in the community of Compañía. Elizabeth also grows vegetables, which she sells at the wholesale market. Elizabeth needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in buying clay. Elizabeth's dreams are to build her own home and keep working to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clay soil to make bricks

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa K. is a single parent who is staying with her four children. She had a commercial system of education where she was taught how to make tie and dye clothing. (In tie and dye, designs are first tied or stitched into the cloth, using cotton or raffia threads.) Adwoa sells cloth in Jukwa, which she has been doing for some time now. 

Adowa uses her income to pay for her rent and other expenditures. Adwoa will use the loan to purchase more cloths for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, Adwoa plans to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for sale

loans.name: Vladimir Ramon

texts.es: El señor Vladimir es un hombre dedicado al negocio, de edad de 50 años vive junto con su mama, desde hace varios años logro poner una venta de fritanga en su casa, pues para el no ha sido difícil ya que su mama le enseño a cocinar los ricos platillos, con los años logro poner un pequeño local en donde siempre vende comida. Lo que desea comprar con este préstamo es una cocina nueva ya que la que tiene le da problemas, así como sillas y mesas nuevas para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Hay días en los cuales las ventas son bajas y se gana poco, pero también hay días en donde se vende todo la comida. Con este financiamiento ha logrado invertir más en sus ventas, lo que ha dejado mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Vladimir is a businessman. He is 50 years old and lives with his mother. Several years ago he set up a business selling home cooked meals (fritanga) from his home. It was not difficult for him since his mother taught him to cook delicious meals, and over the years he was able to set up a small shop where he always sells meals. With this loan, he would like to purchase a new stove, since the one he has is giving him problems, as well as new tables and chairs to provide better service to his customers. There are days in which sales are bad and he doesn't earn much, but there are also days in which he sells all of the food. With this loan he is able to invest more in his sales, which has given him better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new stove, tables and plastic chairs to provide better service each day

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry Y., 43 years old, started his piggery business last month. He was inspired by other clients of Community Economic Ventures Inc. who succeeded in their business. Aside from raising pigs, he also sells meat. He goes door-to-door to sell the meat.

The income, Jerry gets from his business goes towards the needs of his family. He has five children and all are studying. His eldest child is 15. He is working very hard to be able to provide all the needs of his family. 

Jerry is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy piglets and feed.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité la Esperanza esta en su segundo ciclo y se encuentran trabajando cada una en su actividad.
Una de las integrantes es la señora  Marylín quien posee  una mercería en su domicilio ella atiende su negocio entre  las labores de la casa .
Ella se encuentra muy satisfecha con su trabajo ya le puede ayudar a  su marido quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos de forma ambulante y no posee  un ingreso suficiente.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de shampoos, lencería, termos para  agua caliente, cremas  para la piel, y otros.
Agradece por la ayuda  que la Fundación con Kiva están brindado a la gente con escasos  recursos.
texts.en:
The Esperanza Group is in its second loan cycle and each member continues to work in her respective job. One of the members, Marylin, has a haberdashery in her home where she attends to customers in between undertaking her household chores. Marylin is very pleased with her business as it helps to generate income and therefore helps her husband, who has a mobile shoe selling business but whose income is not sufficient. Marylin is requesting the loan in order to buy shampoo, underwear, thermal drinking flasks, skin creams, amongst other items. She is thankful for the help the Kiva Foundation provides to people who have few financial means.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, shampoo, underwear, thermal drinking flasks, skin creams, etc.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos en etapa escolar. Residen en la comunidad de Sirenachayocc, ubicada en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su propio casa. Claudia sabe muy bien para emprender cualquier actividad dependerá de las cosas que hagas y el esfuerzo que le ponga. Es por ello que se dedica de lleno a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo y comercialización de cacao y la hoja de coca y esto gracias a las enseñanzas que le dieron sus padres. Su éxito se debe a la calidad de su producto como la atención que da hacia sus clientes. Por lo general sus productos los vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad a precio competitivo, esto le da mucha satisfacción por el trabajo que ha logrado hasta el momento. Su prioridad es ampliar su cultivo en otras zonas estratégicas con la necesidad de minimizar costo y tiempo, ya así tendrá buenos resultados económicos. Por lo general recibe la ayuda de su esposo y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, además siempre tratan de mejorar nuevas técnicas de cuidado para sus plantaciones, dedicándose desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago de manera oportuna, además se siente fortalecido y seguro con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita le servirá para comprar una pequeña parcela de terreno y pueda sembrar semillas de cacao.
texts.en:
Claudia is 44 years old, married and has 2 school-age children. They live in the community of Sirenachayocc, which is located in the beautiful forests of Cusco where they have their own house. Claudia knows very well that carrying out any activity depends on the work you do and the efforts you put in. That is why she puts all her time into agriculture, specifically the cultivation and commercialization of cacao and the coca leaf, thanks to the lessons her parents taught her. Her success is due to the quality of her product and the attention she gives to her clients. Generally, her products are sold in the market centers of her community, at competitive prices. This gives her much satisfaction for the work she has accomplished so far. Her priority is to expand her crops to other strategic areas to minimize cost and time. That way she will have good economic results. Generally, she receives help from her husband and together they make a good working team. Also, they are always trying to improve new techniques to care for their plantations, working from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening. This is their second loan from MFP, for which she promises to comply faithfully with the payment obligations in a timely manner. She also feels strengthened and more secure with her communal group. With the requested loan, she will buy a small parcel of land to plant cacao seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a parcel of land to grow cacao.

loans.name: Claudia Guissel

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Guissel T. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, desde hace 11 años y se desempeña como operaria de limpieza, solo barre por las madrugadas y en la tarde se dedica a un negocio de venta de tajadas, es casada y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolares, su esposo también trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chinandega, ambos son bien trabajadores y emprendedores para sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Lleva ya 7 créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha pagado muy bien  y siempre que han adquirido crédito lo han sabido administrar y han ido mejorando su vivienda poco a poco.
texts.en:
Sra. Claudia Guissel T. has been employed by the City of Chinandega for eleven years. She is a janitor and works by herself in the early morning hours. In the afternoon, she runs a business selling sliced plantains. Claudia is married and has two children in school. Her husband also works for the City of Chinandega. Both of them are excellent workers and entrepreneurs who want to move their children forward.

Claudia has already had seven loans with CEPRODEL and all of them have been repaid on time. With the loans she has acquired, she always knows how to manage the funds and use them to gradually make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (zinc, nails, and window frames)

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita D. is from the village of Midallo. She is 53 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Benita owns and operates a business venture in the construction sector. The main source of income for the business comes from the selling of timber and lumber in the local community. Benita has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2005, Benita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Benita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Benita from PMPC. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expansion for the business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian A. sells foodstuffs in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs in her restaurant. Lilian is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has three children, who are all in school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

loans.use: Buy more foodstuffs in her restaurant

loans.name: Denya

texts.en: Denya S. is currently in the business of selling bread, groundnut paste and ice cream at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell. Denya is 36 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: extend the cultivated area and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov N. is a 44-year-old widow and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Tom Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Nov N. has four children. Three of her children are employed and provide their income to help the family, and the other one is going to school. Nov N.’s employed children travel to work by taxi several days. She hopes to cut down the cost of hiring taxis through using a loan she has requested to buy a secondhand modern motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand modern motorcycle.

loans.name: Julia Estela

texts.es:
Doña Julia, es una señora de 63 años de edad, reside en El Transito Departamento de San Miguel,  es madre soltera de cuatro hijos y vive junto a una hija, Ella tiene este negocio desde hace 10 años donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad como frijoles, Azúcar, arroz entre otros productos que le son demandados por los clientes, ella atiende todos los días y durante todo el día pero cuando Doña Julia esta indispuesta por algún malestar es su hija la que se encarga de controlar las ventas.
Ella quiere mejorar su tienda e invertir en mas víveres para ofrecer,  es por eso que solicita un préstamo que ayude a impulsar mas su negocio y a reforzar sus inventarios para mejorar su atención a los clientes y satisfacer las necesidades de estos.
Su principal objetivo es mantener buena relación con la institución pagando puntual y de esta manera ella cree que contara con el apoyo para superar su negocio y mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Julia is 63 years old and lives in El Transito, in the Department of San Miguel. She is the single mother of four children, and she lives with one of her daughters. She has operated this business for 10 years, offering basic products such as beans, sugar and rice, along with other items that are in demand among her customers. She works all day, every day, in her store, but when Julia is indisposed with some kind of illness, her daughter takes charge of overseeing sales. 

She would like to improve her store and invest in more groceries to offer. For this reason, she is requesting a loan which will help give her business a boost and strengthen her inventory, so she can improve the service she provides to her customers and satisfy their needs. 

Her main objective is to maintain a good relationship with the institution by making her payments punctually, and thus she believes that she will have support in advancing her business and improving her economic stability.

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar and beans for her business

loans.name: Sema

texts.en: Sema A.  is currently in the business of selling fish, rice, simsim (sesame seeds), and is requesting a loan to increase her stock. Sema is 49 years old and married to a farmer. She has four children, two of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to continue growing her business.

loans.use: increase her stock

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man with eleven children, two of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, medical fees, and school fees for his children.

For over twenty years, he has operated his snake park business from home for local people and foreigners. He faces the challenge of seasonality; during holiday season (June to December) there are a number of tourists at the park while during the months of January to May, he experiences low visitor turn-out. Jackson hopes to educate the community on the importance of conserving animals in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase materials to renovate his snake park roof. He decided to join Yehu to save and get financial services.

loans.use: To purchase materials to renovate his snake park roof.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo Agüero Rodríguez, tiene la edad de 30 años, es soltero. El quiere comprar una vaca para la explotación de esta en el campo de la producción de leche. Además, su finca es apta para el mantenimiento de estos animales y su buena explotación. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer como un  productor de leche de la zona. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no ha tenido problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de que sea una finca productiva. El no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El tiene como meta llegar a generar ganancias para su bienestar en el futuro y seguir creciendo en el negocio de la producción de leche.
texts.en:
30-year old Domingo Agüero Rodríguez is single. He wishes to buy a cow so he will have milk to sell. The land he owns is very suitable for cows and milk production. Domingo has been a farmer for several years and wishes to expand into dairy farming.

This is his first loan from Kiva partner FUDECOSUR. He has no problems with his property but does want it to become a productive farm. He has not had loans with other banks. FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with easier terms and a much lower interest rate.

Domingo’s goal is to generate more income to support himself in the future and to continue expanding the milk production business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Edwin Ernesto

texts.es:
Edwin, quien es de Santa Elena departamento de Usulután, tiene 32 años de edad, es empleado,  el es casado y vive con su esposa y una hija, lleva ya 6 años de trabajar en un taller de General de Cajas; por el momento enfrenta problemas con el vehículo y necesita llevarlo al mecánico, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la reparación del vehículo y dejarlo en buenas condiciones, este préstamo ayudara a que Edwin, solventes sus problemas y pueda viajar seguro en su automóvil.
Su objetivo es reparar su vehículo, tenerlo en condiciones adecuadas para viajar con su familia, también cuidar de su empleo y velar por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin, who is from Santa Elena in the Department of Usulután, is 32 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and their daughter, and has been working for 6 years in a workshop. 

At the moment he is facing problems with his car and he needs to take it to a mechanic. This is why he is asking for a loan to pay for car repairs and get his vehicle into good running condition. This loan will help Edwin resolve his car problems and travel safely.

Edwin's goal is to repair the vehicle and have it in good condition so that he can travel with his family, keep his job and look out for his family's well-being.

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa N. lives in the Busega neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 5 children, four of whom are in school. Kasifa   has a business of a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Kasifa sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.
