Kasifa has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil, and boxes of exercise books and pens. The main business challenges for Kasifa include seasonality and thieves.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale only. Kasifa lives in a home that she rents and she has access to electricity and doesn’t have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, exercise books and pens.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr:
Cliente de 49 ans, célibataire et mère de 6 enfants , elle se lance dans la vente des produits pharmaceutiques pour prendre soin de sa famille , elle ouvre un étalage des produits pharmaceutiques dans le marche qui est non loin de son habitation,.Elle avait bénéficié d’un premier prêt  qu’elle a gérer avec succès.

Elle avait renforcé son activité en achetant beaucoup des produits en gros  tels que : les antitussifs, antibiotiques, des solutions salées /sucrées et autres dont les demandes sont fortes.

Le deuxième prêt, contribuera aussi à remonter son commerce qui selon elle s’est stabilisé avec son nouveau système de gestion. Elle a maitrisée le journal de caisse et la gestion de stock, elle compte épargner plus pour pouvoir bénéficier  des prêts plus important afin de réaliser ses objectifs : Ouvrir une pharmacie de ventes des produits en gros.
 
Elle fait suffisamment des bénéfices maintenant qu'elle aide a payer les frais d'écolage de ses enfants et épargne pour atteindre ses projets d'avenir, aider son mari a construire une maison pour toute la famille.
texts.en:
A 49-year old client, single and the mother of six, she launched a business selling pharmaceutical products in order to support her family. She opened a stall with pharmaceutical products at a market near her home. She already had a prior loan and managed it successfully. 

She bolstered her business purchasing many products wholesale, such as cough medicine, antibiotics, saline and sugar solutions and other products in high demand.

The second loan will also contribute to the growth of her business. According to her, the new management system. She has learned how to keep a ledger and better manage her stock. She plans to save more in order to be able to obtain bigger loans and achiever her goal of opening  a wholesale pharmacy. She makes enough now to be able to pay for her children’s schooling. She is also putting many away for future projects, to help her husband build a house for the entire family.

loans.use: Purchasing pharmaceutical products: rubber alcohol,  Betadine, Betazol, Paracetamol, Chloramphenicol etc

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora se  llama Margarita González E. tiene 44 años, estudio hasta la secundaria tiene su certificado, ella vive en le localidad de Ahuehueyo, municipio de Ciudad Ayala en el estado de Morelos, México. La señora Margarita tiene un negocio  de venta  de ropa  y regalos, además de vender perfumería por catalogo (jafra) y artículos de plástico. El préstamo lo va a utilizar principalmente para surtir su negocio de mercancías como son: Ropa para dama y caballero, invertir en un pedido de perfumería (Jafra), monederos, bolsas de piel y va a surtirse de juguetes para el dia de Reyes.
La señora Margarita se entero de los prestamos de KIVA,  a traves de una amiga que la invito a participar en un grupo y decidió solicitar el apoyo para poner su propio negocio, ya que ella anteriormente trabajaba como empleada. Desde hace 25 años tiene su negocio comenzó vendiendo casa por casa y poco a poco fue ganando clientela hasta que decidió poner un puesto en su localidad, ella comenzó vendiendo perfumería por catalogo (jafra), y después bolsas de piel que su hermana le traía de Toluca además le traía zapatos, porque allá son más baratos. Además algo que le favorece en su negocio es que paga una renta muy baja su negocio esta en el mercado de Ahuehueyo además de que su esposo la apoya económicamente. De su casa a su negocio ella camina muy poco ya que este se encuentra  a dos cuadras por lo que se traslada caminando a su negocio. Para ella es muy importante su negocio pues es de ahí de donde obtiene ganancias  para sus necesidades y por eso trata de sacarle el máximo provecho. A ella le gustan las ventas y normalmente trabaja hasta las tres de la tarde todos los días y eso le da orgullo tener muchos clientes de todas las edades a los que vende de contado y en pagos. Sus ganancias normalmente las vuelve a invertir  en comprar más mercancías; desea ampliar su negocio comprando otras dos vitrinas para poder exhibir mas mercancía y tener mejores ingresos.
La señora Margarita es casada, su esposo es albañil y no tienen niños. Ocasionalmente recibe ayuda de su papá que está enfermo de la vista. Comenta que le gusta mucho su localidad porque es tranquilo y normalmente no suceden cosas malas y el paisaje es muy verde.la señora Margarita nos menciona que los apoyos de kiva son muy buenos y menciona que es bueno que nos sigan prestando y que va pagar puntualmente su préstamo.
texts.en:
Margarita González E. is 44 years old.  She studied up to high school level and has her high school diploma.  She lives in Ahuehueyo, in the town of Ciudad Ayala, in the State of Morelos, in Mexico.

Margarita has a business selling clothes and gifts.  She also sells (Jafra) perfume through catalogs and plastic products.  She will use her loan mainly to stock her business with merchandise such as men's and women's clothes.  She will invest in a (Jafra) perfume order, purses, leather bags and will also stock her business with toys for 'Kings Day' (January 6th - when children receive gifts from the Wise Men).

Margarita found out about Kiva loans through a friend who invited her to take part in a group and decided to request support to set up her own business since she used to work as an employee.  Margarita has had her business for 25 years.  She started selling door to door and gradually attracted more and more customers until she decided to set up a sales location in her town.  She started out selling (Jafra) perfumes through a catalog and then leather bags that her sister brought her from Toluca.  She also brought shoes because they are cheaper there.

Something else that favors Margarita's business is the fact that she pays a very low rent on her business which is in Ahuehueyo market.  Her husband also supports her financially.  Margarita doesn't have far to travel from her home to her business since it is only two blocks away.  This means that she can walk.  Margarita's business is very important to her as it makes her the money she needs to cover her needs and, for that reason, she tries to benefit from it as much as possible.  Margarita likes selling and she normally works until 3.00pm every day.  It makes her very proud to have many customers of all ages who she sells to for cash and on credit.  She normally re-invests her profits in buying more merchandise.  She would like to expand her business, buying another two display cases so that she can display more merchandise and make better profits.

Margarita is married.  Her husband is a construction worker and they don't have any children.  She occasionally receives help from her dad who has medical problems with his vision.  She comments that she likes her neighborhood a lot because it is very quiet.  Bad things don't normally happen there and the landscape is very green.  Margarita tells us that Kiva loans are very good and she mentions "it is good that they keep lending to us".  She will make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy clothes, blouses, Jafra perfumes, bags and leather purses.

loans.name: Ashietu

texts.en:
Ashietu W. sells porridge at Abura. She is married and has seven dependants. Her husband is a chainsaw operator. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

At the time of visit, Ashietu had finished selling the porridge for the day. She has in her hand the corn dough she uses for the porridge.

loans.use: To buy more maize to expand her business.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng C. has been in the farming business for a long time. To earn a living, she cultivates rice, both rainy season and dry season crops, on the farmland that came to her from her grandparents in 1990. She has only two children, and they are enrolled in the local school. His husband makes a daily income as a construction worker. This family usually generates an average income of $3.5 per day. 

Chheng C. is not comfortable because her house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es: El Joven José se dedica a trabajar en el comercio de equipos eléctricos ( equipos de sonido, dvd´s, hometeather´s, licuadoras y otros ), se dedica a esta actividad desde hace dos años, trae la mercadería desde la localidad de desaguadero y entrega la mercadería a dos cuotas, motivo por el cual solicita el crédito ya que quiere comprar mas equipos electricos ya que tiene que trabajar con dos capitales, José es soltero y vive en domicilio de propiedad de sus padres a quienes colabora con los gastos del hogar, sus papas se sienten orgullosos de el de que les apoye es un joven muy trabajador y responsable, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José is a young man who works at an electronics store selling sound equipment, DVD players, home theaters, blenders, and other items. He has been in this business for two years. The merchandise is brought in from the town of Desaguadero and sent in two shipments.

The reason for his loan request is to purchase more electronics equipment since he must make deliveries to the two capitals (Sucre and La Paz). José is single and lives at the home of his parents, who cover the household expenses. His parents are proud of him and support him since he is a hardworking and responsible young man. José is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Purchase electronics equipment

loans.name: Hope To God 1V Group

texts.en:
Mabinty K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mabinty was born in the village of Foredugu. She is married to a driver and the couple has two children. Mabinty has had many years of experience in selling cooked rice. 

This is the first loan that she and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mabinty will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her cooked rice business. She will buy cooking materials like rice, palm-oil, onions, tomatoes, etc. in large quantities.

(Also included on the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan to the borrowers).

loans.use: To buy rice, palm-oil, onions, tomatoes, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: El señor Rogelio, con el dinero del préstamo construirá una nueva habitación en su vivienda; su principal fuente de ingreso es de elaboración de joyas en oro y plata en su taller familiar. Rogelio vive en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en la zona de Llojeta de La Paz. Rogelio está casado y tiene 2 hijos.
texts.en: Rogelio will use the money from the loan to build a new bedroom in his home.  His main source of income is making gold and silver jewelry in his family workshop.  Rogelio lives in his own home which is located in the zone of Llojeta in La Paz.  Rogelio is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: to construct a bedroom in his home

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
MwanaJ. is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For over one year, she has operated a tailoring business and also sells clothes from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

MwanaJ. faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase materials for her tailoring business. She dreams of expanding, and supplying clothes in large scale to meet her customers' needs. MwanaJ. decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento Alegria  esta conformado por nueve personas 7 mujeres y 2 varones,  la mayoría de las señoras viven el zona Tembladerani, y se dedican a la artesanía de mantillas también un porcentaje son ambulantes que venden de feria en feria con productos de temporada  el cual se conocen muy bien en el grupo ya están en su tercer ciclo  también están los  varones que viven también el la misma zona. La presidenta se llama Janeth que tiene  su salón de belleza y también vende productos de belleza por catalogo y es muy exigente y cumplida por eso sus compañeras la eligieron presidenta, con el dinero del crédito comprara material para su salón de belleza como también Champo cremas para peinar, tintes, etc. y así de esta forma ofrecer mejor servicio  a sus clientas ya que es muy conocida por el buen trabajo que realiza y de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank "Alegría" is comprised of nine people, seven women and two men.  Most of the women live in the Tembladerani area and make artisan lace scarves for a living.  Some of them sell their work at fairs along with other seasonal products.  They know each other well and this is their third loan cycle.  The men also live in the area.

The president of the group is Janeth, the owner of a beauty salon.  She also sells beauty products by catalogue and is very meticulous and responsible, the reason for which she was elected president.

She plans to use the loan to buy beauty salon supplies such as shampoo, hair conditioner, hair color, etc. in order to offer better service to her customers.  She is well known for the good work she does.  Janeth hopes to increase her earnings and is grateful to the institution for the support she has received.

loans.use: To buy beauty salon supplies such as shampoo and hair conditioner

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is 35 years old and married with an 11-year-old child. He runs a store at Grassfield in Sierra Leone.

Issa has been in this business for 10 years and sells rice, beans and flour at his store. He also earns income from renting a house. He says that the main challenges to his business are weather and prince control.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more goods. Issa says that the extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his child. In the future, he would like to develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans and flour.

loans.name: Los Cedritos Group

texts.es:
Angelina tiene 49 años, comenta que ella no estudio pero que sabe leer y escribir ya ella sola se enseño viendo, también comenta que le gusta mas el trabajo y la realización de artesanías de barro. A ella le enseñaron a realizar las figuras y ollas sus papas ya que también era artesanos, desde hace 25 años ella y su esposo el señor Ausencio empezaron su negocio propio de la artesanía en la temporada de diciembre es cuando más vende las mariposas y las pinta como las monarca ya que cerca de su localidad esta en santuario de la mariposa monarca, también vende las ollas para hacer las piñatas en la temporada decembrina. Ellos tiene un puesto cerca de  central de autobuses de Zitacuaro, desde hace 15 años y que ahí vende sus diferentes artesanías, ellos empezaron vendiendo en la ciudad de México pero debido a que ya no dejaron poner puestos ambulantes decidieron regresarse a su localidad a vender las artesanías, ellos tienen 3 hijos de nombres Raquel que trabaja y les ayuda con los gastos del hogar, Esther de 15 años y estudia secundaria y Elsi que tiene 13 años estudiante de primaria. Comenta doña Angelina que ahorita gracias a dios le está yendo muy bien en su negocio, que si necesita el crédito para invertir y comprar lo que les hace falta para seguir vendiendo sus artesanías como pinturas de diferentes colores para decorar las artesanías, tierra, leña, barnices etc. La meta que tiene para su negocio es pedirle al gobierno municipal que le rente otro lugar de suelo donde pueda vender sus artesanías ya que donde tiene el puesto esta pequeño y ella quiere exponer más de sus artesanías.
Los otros 6 integrantes se llaman Araceli, Leticia, Maria Fernanda, Fernando, Anayeli, Ana Velia ellos invertirán el préstamo que están solicitando para la compra de insumos para elaborar artesanías de barro y en la compra de frutas y verduras para su venta.
texts.en:
Angelina, 49, comments that she never went to school but she does know how to read and write because she taught herself by watching.  She also comments that she likes work more and making crafts.  Her parents taught her how to make figures and pots since they too were artisans.  For the last 25 years she and her husband, Ausencio, started their own crafts business during the December season which is when most of the butterflies are sold; she paints them like Monarchs since the Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary is nearby.  She also sells pots to make piñatas for the December season.

They have had a stand near the Zitácuaro bus terminal for the last 15 years.  She sells her various crafts there.  They started out selling in Mexico City but when street vending stalls were banned they decided to return home to sell their crafts.  They have three children: Raquel who works and helps with household expenses, Esther, 15, who is in middle school and Elsi, 13, who is in elementary school.

Angelina comments that now, thanks be to God, she’s doing very well in her business but needs the loan to be able to invest and buy what they need to continue selling crafts like different colored paints to decorate them, clay, firewood, varnish, etc.  The goal she has for her business is to ask the municipal government to rent her a space where she can sell her crafts because the space she currently uses to sell her items is very small and she wants to display more of her crafts.

The other six group members are: Araceli, Leticia, María Fernanda, Fernando, Anayeli, and Ana Velia.  They will use the loan they are requesting to buy raw materials to make clay crafts and to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy crafts making supplies.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 50 year-old dairy farmer. She is married and has six children between 22 and 33 years old. Besides dairy farming, she grows crops, on a small-scale. Nancy has been farming for eleven years.  

Nancy joined Faulu Kenya after being introduced by a friend. So far, she has learned how to manage her business finances by saving her money. Her dream is to own pedigree cows in her farm for more production. She has requested for 20,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Richard Francisco

texts.es: El joven Richard  es soltero, tiene 25 años de edad,  Richard estudia Administración industrial  en un instituto de prestigio, Richard eligió esta profesión porque  es su vocación, ademas es una persona responsable,puntual y trabaja en equipo, también sabe que le generara mejores ingresos económicos, hoy en día Richard trabaja los fines de semana como albañil, pero Richard sabe que todo esfuerzo es recompensado, Su sueño de es brindarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y de alguna forma devolverle a ellos todo lo que hicieron por él, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar su matrícula y prácticas profesionales. Sabemos que Richard   cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Richard is 25 years old and single.  He is studying Industrial Administration in a prestigious institute.  Richard chose this profession because it is his vocation.  He is a responsible, punctual person who is a good team player and he knows that this will make him better income.  Currently, Richard is working as a construction worker on weekends but he knows that all effort has its rewards.

Richard's dream is to provide his parents with a better quality of life and, in some way, to pay them back for everything they have done for him.  With the goal of continuing to grow, he has requested a new loan to pay his registration fees and for his internship.  We know that Richard will achieve his goals with a lot of work and effort and that Edaprospo's loans will help him.

loans.use: to pay his registration fees and for his internship

loans.name: Leilyn

texts.en:
Leilyn is 30 years old and is a married woman with a 3-year-old child. She is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. Her husband is the one who mainly manages their farm.  She helps him grow their rice crops and keep the farm free of weeds and pests.  Leilyn also raises pigs in their small backyard piggery. She does her best to help provide for the needs of their family.

This loan will be used to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor. In the future, Leilyn hopes to have a good life and a happy family.

loans.use: buy pig feed, fertilizer and fuel for the tractor

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza is a 36-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in her own house in Kamwenge, Uganda.
Specioza has been operating a bar for three years now and and this has helped her to provide for her family as she is the sole provider. She has challenges in breakage of bottles that cause her losses. Her business dream is to own a big bar. Specioza is requesting a loan to buy crates of beers for resale. Her dream is to ensure she secures enough savings to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer for resale.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maritza, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de  14 y 10 años las mismas que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo tienen un bar en un colegio de la localidad el cual administran juntos, allí venden muchos bocadillos y bebidas, en su bar los estudiantes pueden encontrar empanadas, sanduches, corviches, sodas, jugos naturales entre otras cosas, además de esto los fines de semana ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y estas ventas las realiza puerta a puerta, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que sus clientes le hacen muchos pedidos ya que les da a muy buen precio y con comodidades de pago. Lleva 7 años dedicada a esta actividad y 5 años en el bar.
 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo y productos como sodas, jugos, empanadas, golosinas, etc. para surtir el bar. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta la ayuda que le dan en el mismo.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local para vender sus productos y un restaurante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Madres Para Un Futuro Mejor” (Mothers for a Better Future) meets every 15 days in the May 24th canton in Manabí Province. This area is known for its beautiful landscapes, its forests, the variety of animal life, and the friendly and hardworking people who make their living through agriculture and livestock breeding.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Maritza. She is 32 years old, married, and has two daughters (ages 14 and 10) who are in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Maritza and her husband manage a snack bar at a high school in their town. There they sell many foods and beverages. At their snack bar, students can order empanadas, sandwiches, “corviches” (fish fritters), sodas, natural juices, and other items. In addition, Maritza sells all types of clothes on the weekends and generates her sales by going door-to-door. She says that her customers place many orders with her because she offers them a good price and convenient payment options. Maritza has been selling clothes for seven years and has managed her snack bar for five years.

This loan will be used to buy all types of clothing and product such as sodas, juices, empanadas, candy, and other items to restock her snack bar. Maritza has been with the Communal Bank for five years and enjoys the assistance that has been given to her. Her dreams are to have a shop where she can sell clothes and to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, juices, empanadas, candy, and other items to restock her snack bar and to acquire clothing to sell on the weekends.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, es casada, administra una venta D. ropa, este negocio surgió por su propia iniciativa y con la ayuda D. su esposo, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
Ella, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. pantalones, camisas, ropa para niños y más mercadería para su negocio, esta compra la ayudara para ampliar el negocio y tener más mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar su vivienda, además que la experiencia con el negocio le ayuD. para continuar en el comercio.
texts.en:
Candelaria lives with her husband and two children. She is married and manages a clothing sales business. She got into the business by her own initiative and with the help of her husband. She has no fixed schedule for tending to her customers. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase pants, shirts, children's clothing and other merchandise for her business. This purchase will help her expand her business and have more merchandise to offer her customers. 

Her greatest dream is to make improvements to her living quarters, and that her experience with the enterprise would help her so she may continue on in the business.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga was born in 1971 and lives in Nghia Lai-Uy No –Dong Anh. She is married and has one young child. Nga's husband is a soldier and she is a farmer. Nga has operated a restaurant, selling rice, noodles, etc. for many years. She earns a monthly income of about 5,500,000 VND.

Nga has participated in SEDA since 2005 and has repaid her loans punctually. She would now like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to invest in her restaurant by buying more chairs, tables, etc. in order to earn more money.

loans.use: to buy more chairs, tables, etc.

loans.name: Santiago De Los Santos

texts.es:
Santiago, vive con su esposa y su hijo, él se dedica a la reparación de bicicletas y venta de repuestos, inicio a brindar el servicio hace 20 años aproximadamente.
Actualmente necesita comprar repuestos para las bicicletas, por eso a través de un préstamo quiere superarse en el negocio, logrando mantener todo lo necesario para las bicicletas, atendiendo la demanda de los clientes, y generando más ingresos para dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Santiago lives with his wife and child. He repairs bicycles and sells spare parts. He has provided this service for about 20 years.
 
Currently he needs to buy spare parts for bicycles. That is why with a loan he wants to improve his business, by managing to stock everything neceessary for the bicycles, meeting the demands of his customers and generating more income to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles (pedals, chains, rims).

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
This is Lyra, 36, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Renato, a garbage truck collector, and a mother to her four children. - two of whom are already in college. She, along with her husband and children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her children’s schooling.
 
Lyra operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which has groceries, toiletries, and beverages which are sold piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them piece-by-piece. Aside from this she also sells electronic cell phone loads and raises pigs in their compound.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products that she needs for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Lyra dreams of growing her business in the coming years, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Kashi

texts.en: Kashi has been able to repay her first Kiva loan fully and she is taking a bigger loan of 50,000 KES to expand to another business. With the loan, she wants to start another business selling charcoal and coconuts, by purchasing sacks of charcoal and coconuts for resale.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is married and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aida is 36 years old and has one child who is in school.

Aida has a shell-crafting business in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like screen, wire and nylon for her business.

Aida has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Aida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like screen, wire and nylon for her shell crafts.

loans.name: Jacqueline Marisol

texts.es:
Jacqueline es un ejemplo de superación, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su abuela de 65 años de edad en casa de un familiar. Desde que tiene 6 años de edad viven juntas, ya que sus padres se divorciaron y cada uno decidió formar un nuevo hogar.

Ella trabaja como empleada domestica desde hace 6 años, con una familia que viven en la misma colonia donde ella vive. Durante todo este tiempo a tenido que estudiar por las noches en un centro educativo de la ciudad, actualmente ella esta por terminar su bachillerato por lo que esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para cancelar los gastos de graduación como lo son: el comprarse una ropa adecuada para la ocasión, pagar las fotografías, pago de derecho de graduación y de la celebración, pago del diploma. Con esto ella podrá sentirse satisfecha y muy contenta de haber logrado una etapa más en su vida de superación y celebración de su triunfo.

Jacqueline tiene muchas expectativas hoy que será bachiller, ya que tendrá la posibilidad de trabajar como vendedora de mostrador en una farmacia, ya que tendrá más tiempo disponible y con el nuevo empleo podrá tener acceso a las prestaciones sociales y mejorar su nivel de vida. Cuando no había terminado aun el bachillerato fue a una entrevista en esa empresa, pero los horarios no se ajustaban a su horario de escuela, pero hoy que termina el bachillerato podrá trabajar en esa empresa, en la cual puede tener la oportunidad de asistir a la universidad y superarse cada día más.
texts.en: Jacqueline is an example of excellence, she is 23 years old, unmarried and lives with her grandmother, who is 65 years old, in a relative's home. Since she was 6 years old they have been living together, since her parents divorced and each decided to form a new home.  For 6 years she has been working as a domestic employee with a family living in the same neighborhood where she lives. During this time she had to study at night in a city school, she is currently completing her high school diploma and is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo, to cancel graduation expenses, such as: buying appropriate clothing for the occasion, to pay for the photographs, fees and graduation celebration payment and the diploma. With this she will be able to feel satisfied and very happy having reached another stage in life of excellence and celebration of her triumph. Today Jacqueline has high expectations that she will be a graduate since she will have the opportunity to work as a saleswoman at a pharmacy counter as she will have more time available and with the new job she will have access to social benefits and improve her standard of living. When she was not even finished with high school she went to an interview at the company but the schedule did not fit her school schedule.  Now that has her diploma she can work in that company and she has the opportunity to attend college and succeed every day.

loans.use: to pay for graduation expenses such as: purchasing appropriate clothing, paying for photographs, paying for graduation fees, etc

loans.name: Nsene

texts.en:
Nsene is a married woman with three school going children. Her husband who is employed also contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Nsene has operated a clothes selling business for the past three years; she sells her products at the market and her potential clients are the people at the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where people buy clothes mostly during the festive season. She dreams of expanding her business into a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it offers good financial services to its clients.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma, a 33-year-old married mother of three children, lives in the Philippines where she has a shop that sells vegetables such as squash, eggplants and string beans. In business for five years and a member of HSPFI since 2010, Gemma is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: make vehicle repairs to keep working as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Manufaa Shg Group

texts.en:
Andrew is the facilitator of the Manufaa SHG group. Andrew and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Andrew takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Andrew had a good maize yield harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Andrew was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Andrew and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Andrew will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Manufaa SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Andrew is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Paul Musembi

texts.en:
Paul is married and has three children ranging from 14 to 22 years old. He describes himself as an honest man. 

Paul has been selling beans, peas, maize flour and rice for the last five years. His business faces a challenge with financial constraints, which makes it hard for him to be able to add to the stock of cereals. He will be using the loan Kes 20,000 to buy more rice and beans.

Paul hopes in the future to start a new maize milling business and to own a cereal house where he will be distributing all types of flour.

loans.use: To purchase rice and beans.

loans.name: Los Alamos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ALAMOS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Gabriela. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: elaboración de chompas, tejido y venta de chompas, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos.

La señora Gabriela,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de sus padres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la tienda distribuidora  y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
The “Los Alamos” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima focal center.  It has 6 members led by a governing board headed by Gabriela.  The members of the communal bank are engaged in a variety of businesses among which we have: sweater making, weaving and selling sweaters, clothes sales and cosmetics sales.

Gabriela indicates that this is the first time she’s worked in Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution thanks to an invitation from a promotion.  She currently works making sweaters, a business she’s had for years having learned it from her parents.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her capital.  She will buy wool from the distributor and once her items are made will sell them based on prior orders.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Lissex Cecilia

texts.es:
Lissex es una mujer de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pequeño bebé recién nacido, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante junto con su pequeño; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Lissex no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, pero gracias a su esfuerzo pudo estudiar una pequeña carrera técnica de Costura.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Lissex trabaja como operario en una empresa textil de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Lissex se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una máquina de coser, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder iniciar su pequeño negocio de refacción y costura de prendas de vestir, de esta manera Lissex podrá contar con más ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su propio taller de costura.
texts.en:
Lissex is a 22 year old woman. She lives in the city of Chincha with her newborn baby. She is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all her efforts to providing for her child. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Lissex couldn't go to school to study Business, but, because of her hard work, she was able to study to become a seamstress.

With a lot of hard work, drive and dedication, Lissex works as an operator in a textile business in her city. She works everyday, 10 hours a day, and believes that things are going well because of her good performance and because of the friendly way she treats others. 

Lissex is very grateful for the Kiva micro loans because they will help her buy a sewing machine which will help her, in the near future, open her own seamstress shop and increase her income.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jackelina

texts.en: Jackelina is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Jackelina has a store that sells hardware items like saws, hammers, masking tape, and glue guns and more. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy more items to sell. Jackelina has been  a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Jackelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her hardware store

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Isatu.  She is married with three children who are 24, 18 and 15 years old. 

In 2011, Isatu established a business selling footwear. She wanted to assist her husband in providing for the home because his salary was not high enough. 

Located in the city center, her business is open 6 days a week and 11 hours a day. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000 to buy a greater range of stock. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her profits and thus increase her standard of living. She says the biggest challenge to her business these days is inflation, which leads to higher transportation costs.

In the future, Isatu plans to establish another outlet and perhaps to become an agent for a well-established kitchenware factory in Guinea. She describes herself as very honest and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of slippers

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.en:
Sherlyn is 45 years old and married with six children.

Sherlyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Sherlyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Sherlyn has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Sherlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 24 years old lives in Salheye, she is studying History. She is from a simple family with low income and her father ‎cannot cover her semester fees because of that she decided to apply for an education loan to help her cover her semester ‎fees and complete her education.‎

loans.use: To pay for her university fees

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.en:
Sylvain T. is a very energetic and friendly man. His wife is a retailer, and they have married three children. His mother and his kids are additions to his responsibilities. Seeing that his profits from selling fuel oil is insufficient to provide for them, he began tutoring some of the neighborhood children for extra income. That was how he was able to pay off his initial loan without a problem.

Mr. T. is always short of fuel oil because of insufficient resource capital to meet the demands of the market. So, to develop his business which he calls «Papa Petro» and derive a higher profit margin for the benefit of his family, he is requesting a second loan, amounting to $850, which would allow him to construct a bigger supply tank. He could then have a substantial supply of fuel oil to satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur T. Sylvain est un homme très dynamique et ouvert. Marié à une revendeuse, il est père de trois (03) enfants. Sa mère et ses petits ont alourdi ses charges. S’apercevant que les bénéfices de la vente du pétrole ne suffisent pas à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, il y associe les cours de répétition à quelques enfants de son quartier. Ce qui lui procure des revenus complémentaires. Ainsi, il a pu solder son premier crédit sans difficulté.

Monsieur T. Sylvain est toujours en rupture de stock car son capital est insuffisant pour répondre aux demandes de son marché. Ainsi, accroître son activité et en tirer plus de marges bénéficiaires pouvant contribuer l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, Sylvain sollicite un second crédit de $850 qui lui permettra de construire une citerne plus grande afin de faire un stock plus consistant de pétrole et répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Construction of a tank and buying fuel oil

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba is 36 years and completed basic education. She is a single mother with 2 children. Having tried with various trades, she finally settled on the preparation of a local drink made from ginger, pepper, spices, and sugar. This is refrigerated before sale, though some also like to consume it hot. The local name of the drink is 'lomogye' or 'Hausa beer'.

As a beneficiary of the KRABAN learning sessions, Abiba wants the KIVA loan to acquire a deep freeze to store the drinks before selling them next day.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en: Nizami Q. is one of the most successful businessmen in his town. He is the owner of a small shop where he sells electrical equipment such as hairdryers, telephones, tape and CD recorders, etc. He is married and has three children. He applied for a $1200 USD loan to enlarge and repair his rented place, and he plans to use this loan from Aqroinvest CU to make it even bigger and better.

loans.use: Mr. Qurbanov would like to enlarge and repair his electronics store.

loans.name: Zefer

texts.en:
Zefer Q. is 28-year-old retailer who runs a small cosmetics and perfume store in Qizilkend village near Imishli town, which is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Zefer opened his store in 2003, when he was only 24. He recently got married and has 1 child. Summer temperatures in Imishli reach a sweltering 50C so people do not stay long when they come into the store.

Zefer has applied for a loan of US$1200 to purchase and install a new air conditioner and give his customers a chance to enjoy a cool comfortable search for the items they want to purchase. Zefer notes, "Most of the customers who come into my store are women. They like to spend a lot of time searching for cosmetics or perfume and I want to create a comfortable place for them, even in sumertime."

loans.use: purchase air conditioner for his shop

loans.name: Blanca Imelda

texts.es:
Doña Blanca is married and her husband works as a welder assistant. They have 3 children, 20, 17, and 15 of age. She started her business as she needed to contribute to the household income because her three children are studying and the income of her husband is not sufficient. 10 years ago she started selling cosmetics from catalogue, from a well-known firm in Mexico to friends, neighbors, and family and now she has more clients as she has been furthermore recommended. She is helping her husband and improving the entire family's life quality little by little. It is her wish to continue with her business and improve sales.

Blanca is asking for a loan of $925 and she plans to repay in 5 months. She will buy cosmetics and meet existing orders from her clients. She and her family appreciate the support in order to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

Blanca esta casada y su esposo trabaja como ayudante de soldador, ellos tienen 3 hijos de 20, 17 y 15 años de edad respectivamente. Ella inició su negocio por que tenía que aportar ingresos para poder mantener y ayudar a su esposo con la economía familiar ya que sus tres hijos están estudiando y los ingresos de su esposo no eran suficientes, por ello, empezó a vender hace 10 años atrás productos de belleza de una reconocida marca en México a sus amistades, vecinos y familiares por catálogo, y ahora ya tiene más clientes debido a la recomendación de sus clientes anteriores, con esto, ella esta ayudando a su esposo y mejorando poco a poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia, y desea continuar con su negocio y tener cada vez mejores ventas.

Blanca esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 925que ofrece pagar en 5 meses, con el que comprará mercadería y cubrir los pedidos que tiene pendiente de sus clientes, ella y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo is 44 years old, and is married with two children. He owns a grocery store where he sells a wide variety of basic necessities. He also has cows which produce milk for him to sell, as well as to make cheese.

He has had the grocery store business for over five years. His increased sales benefit from the fact that his store is located in the center of the city of Arroyos y Esteros, which is a high traffic area every day.

His business is well-supplied, thanks to the loans granted by Fundación Paraguaya. These funds allowed him to purchase merchandise of all types but particularly items in daily demand such as meats, sugar, oil, beverages, eggs, noodles, etc.

Gerardo declares that he needs to purchase a three-door refrigerator to keep his beverages cold given that he does a good sales volume over the weekends. This is particularly true now, during the summer, a time when cool drinks are in particularly high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Gerardo Tiene 44 años está casado y tiene 2 hijos, el es propietario de una despensa donde vende todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad; también tiene vacas de las cuales vende la leche en su propio negocio además de elaborar queso.

El negocio de la despensa lo tiene hace más de 5 años y registra buena venta ya que está ubicado en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Arroyos y Esteros, dónde hay buena concurrencia de gente todos los días.

Su negocio está muy bien surtido, gracias a los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar mercaderías de todas las variedades y muy especialmente los productos de rotación diaria como ser, carne, azúcar, aceite, bebidas de todas las marcas, huevo, fideo, etc.

Gerardo, afirma que necesita comprar un congelador de 3 puertas para mantener bien frías sus bebidas ya que los fines de semana registra buena venta y en ésta época de calor las bebidas son los de mayor venta.

loans.use: Purchase a three-door refrigerator/freezer.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Mrs. Um S., 35, is married with two school-aged children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She works as a broker purchasing yams from the growers and reselling them, and typically makes on average $5 per day of profit. Her husband is a taxi driver and can make around $5 per day.

Mrs. Um S. has humbly requested a loan to expand her business by purchasing more yams to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: To purchase more yams from the growers.

loans.name: Edith Carolina

texts.es:
To help her husband, Edith began to sell fried foods and sweets from her house. Nevertheless, the money that she earned with this business was not enough to pay for her children’s expenses. As a result, with some savings and a little bit of borrowed money, she decided to open a small grocery store in her house two years ago. Since then, this has been a business which allows her to pay for school expenses and to help her husband pay for utilities like the light bill.

Nevertheless, some of Edith’s customers are not able to find what they’re looking for. As a result, Edith is soliciting a credit of US $550 which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, Edith will be able to buy more merchandise so that she can have variety in her shop. With your help, Edith can help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Para poder ayudar a su esposo, Edith comenzó a vender frituras y otros dulces fuera de su casa. Sin embargo el dinero que ganaba con ese negocio no le dejaba lo suficiente para poder pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Fue por eso que con unos ahorros y un poco de dinero prestado decidió poner una tiendita de abarrotes en su casa hace dos años. Desde entonces ese a sido su negocio con el cual saca para pdoer pagar los útiles escolares y para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de luz y otros servicios.

Sin embargo algunos clientes de Edith se han ido puesto que no encuentran lo que andan buscando. Es por eso que Edith está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Y con este dinero Edith podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener variedad en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Edith podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Supply her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes N.  is married with 5 children. She is 50 years old. She hails from Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She learnt her trade for 1 year before starting out on her own. She sells sand, gravel and support rods. She needs the loan amount of $1200 to buy sand and gravel for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy sand and gravel for re-sale

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village B(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Grace B.. She is currently in the business of selling dairy products and is requesting a loan to purchase a freezer and more milk cans. Grace is 49 years old and is married with a husband who is a builder for work. She has 6 children ranging from ages 13 to 25 and her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately UGX 150000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business and save the rest. Grace has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Grace is joined in her small group by Edith N., Aidah A. and Milly B.. Edith N. has a business running a restaurant and wants to add more furniture. Aidah A. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to purchase more clothes. Milly B. operates a tailoring business and wants to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: To increase inventory in milk business

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is 26 years old and is single woman with one child, age three. Zaituni is a tailor and she also sells decorative items. She started her business in 2004. She works from 6am to 8pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

In the past, Zaituni has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items, including needles, cloth, lotion, rings, cream and necklaces for her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring and decorative items for her business.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: “I am very happy about the Kiva loan,” says Mrs. Patience O.. She is 44 years old and married with 4 children. She sells fresh tomatoes, a business she learned from her mother. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She started her business in 1984. She is requesting $1200 to buy more tomatoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Dung Dinh

texts.vi:
Mr. Dung Dinh N., 50 years old, is borrowing 2,478,000 VND to buy pigs to raise. He has been participated in one round of funding and has finished the repayment. Besides raising livestock, his family also grow flowers and his children sell goods at the market. The family’s income is 110,000 VND per month. Ms. Vien Thi N. is borrowing 2,006,000 VND to buy chickens and pigs. Ms. Bang Thi N. is borrowing 2,006,000 VND to buy pigs. Ms. Hoa Thi N. is borrowing 2,600,000 VND to buy chickens to raise and sell. Ms. Hien Thi N. is borrowing 2,600,000 VND to raise pigs. The total for the group is 10,502,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

Chú Nguyễn Đình Dũng (MS: 020027), năm nay 50 tuổi. Chú vay 2.478.000 VND về mua lợn chăn nuôi. Chú đã tham gia được 1 chu kỳ vay vốn và đã hoàn trả xong. Ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chú còn trồng hoa màu, con chú bán hàng ở chợ. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chú là 110.000 VND/ ngày. Chị Nghiêm Thị Viên (MS: 020029), vay 2.006.000 VND về chăn nuôi gà, lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Bang (MS: 020030), vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hoa (MS: 020061), vay 2.006.000 VND để nuôi gà thịt. Chị Nguyễn Thị Huyền (MS: 020062), vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. (Nhóm nay đã được đăng và được cấp ID : 50849 nhưng nhầm số vốn vay. Nay nhóm được đăng lại. Tổng số vốn vay thực tế của nhóm là 10.502.000 VND).

loans.use: Chăn nuôi

loans.name: Tham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tham Thi Nguyem is a 46 year old woman. She has 3 children, 2 of whom are going to school. Before her participation in TYM program, her family faced many financial difficulties because the finance depended only on farming and they did not have money to invest in businesses. In 1999, she borrowed money to invest in raising pigs. For 9 years, thanks to her intelligent use of the loans, the family’s business has been expanding. At the moment, they are taking care of 10 pigs and 100 chickens. She plans to borrow the next loan of 7,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to renovate the farm and buy more pigs and chickens. The family’s income is 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thắm năm nay 46 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 3 người con trong đó có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đìnhchị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do kinh tế chủ yếu dựa vào làm nông nghiệp và thiếu vốn làm ăn.Năm 1999 chị đã bàn với chồng tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương để vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Có thêm vốn vay gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào mua lợn về nuôi.Đến nay qua 9 năm sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả mô hình chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đã được mở rộng và quy mô hơn. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang nuôi 10 con lợn và khoảng 100 con gà. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 7.000.000đ để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại va mua thêm gà, lợn để nuôi.

Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in raising

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von S., age 46, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 1982, she and her husband, Sout Rin, age 47, have owned a plot of land growing rice and yams for a living and are able to earn around $1 per day. This couple has four children, one of whom is employed by a garment factory. Her daughter always shares some of her money to support the family.

Mrs. Von S. would like a loan of $600 from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to hire workers to plow the land and grow yams. (Mr. Sout Rin is pictured because his wife was not available.) 

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To hire workers to plow the land and grow yams.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim P., 28, and her husband, Mr. Sokchoeun Kan, 31, who live in a small village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have one son.

Mrs. Sim has been a silk weaver for seven years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a wooden house constructor for ten years.

Now Sim is requesting a loan of 200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: 8 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La asociación “ 8 de marzo” pertenece al centro focal de  Villa Adela, hace mas de nueve años, estas mujeres has formado a lo largo de los años  un grupo muy organizado y unido. Todas ella están casadas y tiene un promedio de 4 hijos, éstos de distintas edades, desde bebes hasta jóvenes universitarios. Tienen la esperanza que sus hijos culminen sus estudios ya que muchas de ellas por falta de recursos económicos no culminaron el bachillerato.
Existen diversas actividades dentro la asociación siendo la venta ropa una de ellas, la comercializan en los mercados de la ciudad de El Alto, también se dedican a la venta de cosméticos en puestos y también de manera ambulante, otra actividad entre la asociación es la venta de queso de Patacamaya (localidad de La Paz), es decir que realizan viajes a ésta localidad para abastecerse de una buena cantidad de queso para luego comercializarla en los mercados y ferias de la ciudad. 
La asociación 8 de marzo necesita mayor capital para compara mayor mercadería, de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias, con el objetivo de poder ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos y poder aseguar en bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The association “8 de marzo” belongs to the focal center Villa Adela. For more than 9 years these women have stayed together over the years as a very organized and united group. All are married and have an average of 4 children of various ages, from baby to university age. They hope that their children will finish their studies as many of them, for lack of economic resources, didn’t finish high school. There are diverse businesses within the association, selling clothing is one of them, selling in the markets of El Alto city; also some sells cosmetics in stands and as a street vendor; another activity in the association is the selling of Patacamaya (a locale near La Paz) cheese, where they make trips to this locale to stock up with a good quantity of cheese to then sell in the markets and festivals of the city. The association 8 of March needs capital to buy more merchandise, and in this way improve their earnings, with the objective of begin able to save for their childrens’ education and be able to ensure the well-being of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase products

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Vuthy K. is 36 years old and the father of two young children. His wife, Chim Phary, is a fish seller. Vuthy is a villager in the Preak Samraong Village in Kandal Province. He is a vegetable farmer and gets a small revenue from his 0.4-hectar plantation, which is a small plot of land. Vuthy would like to expand his plantation so he is asking for a loan to buy another piece of land to cultivate.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate.

loans.name: Zohir

texts.en:
Selling office supplies on the street has become the only source of income for A. Zohir, a humble, 33-year-old young man who's been doing this for 7 years. 

This young man has many projects for his future. The main project is to open his own store where he would be able to sell office supplies and books. He's good at what he does; this is why he's been able to support his family, especially his dearest five children, with education. 

His wish is to add more books and, therefore, to have more to offer to his clients. He will pay back this loan and, with the money, he will be able to pay for his children’s education. 

This young man waits for your help. Let's make his dream come true.

loans.use: Office supplies for students

loans.name: Bo

texts.en: Mrs. Bo S. is a widowed porridge seller who lives in Kandal Province. She sells a variety of food including porridge and noodle soups from her house in the village. She has three children, all of whom are single; one works as a construction worker, one works selling fishes, and another one is in school. S. also cares for her old mother. To expand the business and improve income, S. would like to request a loan to purchase ingredients to make porridge and noodle soup selling. Any remaining amount will be used to decorate her business stall.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make porridge and noodle soup

loans.name: Heung

texts.en: Heung L., 50, is married and lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She and her husband have a business recharging batteries and are able to earn $6 every day. People who live in the province usually depend on batteries to power their lighting. Heung L. plans to use this loan to purchase batteries and resell them in the village.

loans.use: Purchase batteries to resell

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet tiene 24 años, vive con su hijo de 5 años en casa de su madre. Trabaja de manera independiente en la venta de ropa desde hace un año, para ello  viaja cada cierto tiempo a la ciudad de Lima para comprar su mercadería y cada semana viaja a otras ciudades de clima cálido para vender sus prendas, por ello es que sus ganancias se perciben cada semana y aunque a veces los viajes constantes tiene sus riesgos por el tiempo de lluvias excesivas, para Janet es una gran satisfacción poder desarrollar una actividad que le permite crecer económicamente. Actualmente también está empezando a vender sus prendas de vestir entre sus vecinos, lo cual la anima más a seguir adelante. Es la  primera vez que está solicitando un préstamo en MFP, ella es una de las integrantes que impulsa un trabajo en equipo y siempre está presente en las reuniones de su banco comunal. Con esta cantidad podrá adquirir más mercadería, el precio aproximado es de 100 soles por docena de polos para damas, en pantalones un aproximado de 300 soles, comprará por varias docenas hasta cubrir el monto que requiere.
texts.en:
Janet is 24 years old and lives with her 5 year old son in her mother's house. She has sold clothing independently for a year. To do this she travels every so often to Lima to buy her merchandise and every week she travels to other cities with warm climates to sell the clothing. She has weekly earnings even though at times the constant travel has its risks during the excessively rainy season. Janet gets a lot of satisfaction from being able to develop her business that lets her grow economically. She is currently starting to sell her clothing to her neighbors, which has further encouraged her to keep going. This is the first time she has asked for a loan through MFP. She is one of the memebers who promotes teamwrok and she always attends the community bank's meetings. With this amount of money she will be able to acquire more merchandise, at an approximate price of 100 soles (about $30.00 USD) for a dozen ladies' polo shirts, and will use the remaining money to buy serveral dozen pairs of pants at 300 soles ($90.00 USD).

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Bihabiba

texts.ru: Бихабиба занимается бизнесом более 15 лет. С самого начала она занимается куплей продажей риса. За товаром ездит по окрестностям и на оптовый рынок в соседний Кыргызстан. Бихабибе 54 года, она замужем  и воспитывает 6 детей. Ее муж тоже работает, а по выходным помогает жене по бизнесу. Бихабиба планирует и дальше расширять свой бизнес, для чего собиратеся получить займ.
texts.en:
Bihabiba N. has been in business for over 15 years. From the very beginning she has bought and sold rice. To purchase the rice she travels to surrounding areas and to the wholesale market in neighboring Kyrgystan. Bihabiba is 54 years old, married, and is raising 6 children. Her husband also works, and help with the business on his days off. Bihabiba plans to continue to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen inició el negocio porqué le gusta cocinar y tiene mucha experiencia en ello, por lo que se decidio a dedicarse a la venta de comidas,además su papá siempre se dedicó a ese negocio.
Comenzó el negocio en Junio del 2006 con un ahorro que le dieron a su esposo donde trabajaba, inicio vendiendo gorditas y cuando falleció su esposo decidió establecer el  negocio más en forma para tener más utilidades.  Ha ido creciendo poco a poco, invirtiendo en más mobiliario y ampliando la variedad de platillos, lo que le ha ganado mas clientes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $4,000 para  comprar  materia prima ya que la venta se ha incrementado por una fabrica que se puso en frente de su negocio, y para comprar los ingredientes de la comida de cuaresma para la proxima temporada.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen started the business because she likes to cook and has experience cooking. Her father had a business selling food and she decided to follow in his footsteps. She started the business in June 2006 with savings that her husband collected from a former employer. She started selling gorditas and when her husband died, she decided to establish the business more formally so that she could get more from it. It's been growing little by little as she's invested in more space and expanded the menu which, in turn, have increased her customer base. She needs a MXN$4,000 loan to buy basic supplies. Sales have been increasing because a factory recently opened across from her business and she needs extra supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Kaniba

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Kaniba Fané est un polygame de 50 ans, père de seize enfants (11 garçons et 5 filles) qui réside avec sa famille à Sanoubougou, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Fané est chauffeur de formation qui, après vingt ans d’exercice de cette profession en république de Côte d’Ivoire, de retour au bercail,  s’initie aux activités de petit commerce notamment l’achat vente d’articles divers de boutique,  cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, Chewing Gum, sachets de lait en poudre, thé, sucre, savons, etc. Il est le représentant de la Société Nationale de Tabacs et Allumettes du Mali (SONATAM S.A.) au niveau de quartier où il habite il y a maintenant cinq  ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 10 cartouches de cigarettes différentes, 2 cartouches du thé, 2 sacs du sucre, 2 sacs de riz, 5 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquets de Chewing-gum, 30 paquets d’allumettes, 2 cartons de savon, etc. Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de la place avant de les revendre en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée des garagistes et routiers puisque sa tablette est située aux alentours des garages auto et de la direction régionale de Douanes de Sikasso.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Kaniba Fané is a polygamist aged 50, father of 16 children (11 boys and 5 girls) who resides with his family in Sanoubougou, in downtown Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. Fané is a licensed chauffeur who, after working 20 years in this profession in the Republic of Côte d’Ivoire, came back to his roots and began to be a petty trader, notably buying and selling various items such as cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, envelopes of powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, etc. He has been the representative of the National Office of Tobacco and Matches in Mali (SONATAM S.A.) in the neighborhood where he lives for the past 5 years. He is much in demand with his customers for the quality of his products.

Wishing to satisfy his ever-growing clientele, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first individual loan. With this loan, he intends to buy 10 cartons of various brands of cigarettes, 2 cartons of tea, 2 sacks of sugar, 2 sacks of rice, 5 packs of chewing gum, 30 packs of matches, 2 cases of bars of soap, etc. He buys his merchandise from local wholesalers before re-selling them retail, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of mechanics and long-distance drivers, since his display is located near the garages and the regional Customs Office of Sikasso.

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to increase his working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on his loan, investing any remainder back into his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various small articles for re-sale

loans.name: Jose Enrique

texts.es: José Enrique C. H.  es un señor trabajador el cual es  sostén de la casa ya que su mujer se dedica al hogar y  cuidado de su pequeña  hija. Pero lo único que al el  preocupa es al momento de irse a trabajar y ellas quedarse solas puedan correr algún peligro por que su casa no tiene ninguna barda que no permita el paso de otras personas ajenas. El recurre a esta institución pudiendo que se le ayude para poner un barandal en su casa.
texts.en:
José Enrique C. H. is a working man who is the support of his home as his wife is dedicated to the home and caring for their small daughter. But the only thing that worries him at the moment is to go to work while his wife and daughter remain alone where they could run in to some danger, because his house does not have a fence that would prevent the entrance of strange people. He has returned to this institution to get help to put a barrier around the house.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a barrier

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba D. is a 38-year-old married mother of two children. One of her children has completed junior high school and the other is still attending school.  She lives with her family in Mankessim which is in the central region of Ghana.  Aba has been a baker for four years now. She bakes bread, cakes, meat pie, and other items and sells them to her customers in the market center.  She is now having trouble to cover the cost of raw materials because of rising prices.  Therefore she requests a loan to help her remain in business.  With the loan she believes she can continue to provide for her family and most especially her children's education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘‘Hwe die Nyame Aye’ which means See What the Lord Has Done.

loans.use: To buy baking materials.

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Hằng Thị Hoàng was born in 1971 (no: 010102080018). She has a shop. She sells noodle soup. She has 3 children. Her husband is a worker. She wants to expand her shop, but she hasn’t enough money. She needs 6,758,000 VND (or 380 USD) to buy a chair and table for her shop. She is a group leader, too. There are 2 other Fund participants in her group.

Khuyên Thị Nguyễn was born in 1968 (no: 010102080017). She has a bazaar at home. She has a daughter. She makes an averge monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She needs 5,886,000 VND (or 330 USD) to buy goods for her bazaar.

Hường Thị Nguyễn was born in 1948 (no: 010102080005). She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (or 300 USD) to buy building materials to resell.

loans.use: To buy chair and table for her shop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. sells powdered fish and shrimp at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast. Elizabeth has received no formal education.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is a trader in electronics. 

Elizabeth has been selling powdered fish and shrimp since 2003. She is responsible for paying utility bills, food and school fees for her child. Her loan will be used to buy more powdered fish and shrimp for resale. She hopes to use the new profit from her business to support her husband in saving towards a house they want to build for the family.

loans.use: To buy more powdered fish and shrimp for resale.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Being fond of gardening, Lucena S. ventures in a vegetable-garden business. According to her, aside from gardening, she also dreams of having a vegetable-vending stall in their village, thus she is requesting PHP 5,000 from Kiva for her to start her store. She is very optimistic that, through the loan, she can start another business for the welfare of her family.

Lucena is a woman with strong determination to face all the challenges in life. Aside from being a business-minded person, Lucena is truly a faithful and loving wife to her husband, Ofelio. They are able to nurture their six children, three of whom are already married. On the other hand, another two were forced to quit schooling because of poverty. Thus their youngest child is the only one attending school.

loans.use: To use to start her new store

loans.name: Benkadi  2  De (Benkadi  B  Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 2 de l’association BENKADI B sont tous des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE, un chef lieu de commune de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution et tous les précédents  ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 24 hectares.
Après la récolte, une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue, sur place au village, dans le marché de Marka-Coungo et à Fana, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 2 of the association BENKADI B are all married women who average 36 years of age and 4 children.  The women live for the most part in polygamous families in TINGOLE, a leading community of FANA sub-prefecture (2nd administrative region of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support to carry out their winter-time work.  Their businesses revolve around growing sorghum and peanuts.  They are on their fifth loan with the institution.  All the preceding loans were correctly repaid.
