With this new loan, they intend to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment.  And they intend to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 24 hectares.  After the harvest, part of their production is consumed at home.  The other part is sold locally in town to customers composed of men and women at the marketplace of Marka-Coungo and Fana. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 25,000 francs CFA after the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry farming supplies and equipment

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is forty years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. As a single parent, she says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. Charity lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in textiles - clothes, underwear, dresses, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells at the local market. Charity also hawks and treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy vive en anticretico con su esposo e hijos en  la calle Jaimes Freyre de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, su esposo percibe una renta de jubilación con lo cual se mantienen, el crédito que solicitan es para pagar los estudios de su hijo menor y de esta manera darle una profesión para que el pueda trabajar y pueda ayudarlos a ellos ya que son personas de la tercera edad.

Son clientes de Impro y pagan muy bien por lo tanto pueden acceder a un nuevo credito.
texts.en:
Nancy lives with her husband and children on Jaimes Freyre Street, in the Tembladerani area of La Paz. Her husband receives a retirement income with which they manage. The loan they are requesting is to pay for the education of their youngest son, thus giving him a profession with which he can in turn, help them because they are elderly. They are Impro clients and pay very well, therefore eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education

loans.name: Akouwa Essowana

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, son mari est un militaire , le revenu de ce dernier est insuffisant pour couvrir les charges du foyer, c’est pour aider ce dernier dans les charges de la famille qu’elle a démarré le commerce de maïs. Voulant se réapprovisionner pour augmenter ses recettes, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 sacs de maïs.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs

loans.name: Dolly Grace

texts.en:
Dolly Grace T., having repaid her first requested loan from ASHI, is requesting a much larger amount. The new loan will be a great opportunity for her to grow her business that she started through her previous loan. It will also enable her to improve her family’s standard of living.

The profits that her business will be making as it grows will be used to satisfy her wish to build a concrete house that will secure her five children (aged from three to ten years old) from any forms of disaster, especially a typhoon. Most especially, through the income of her business, her husband’s income will be augmented and will enable her to provide for the needs of her children, especially food.

Dolly Grace also hopes that her business profit will enable her to sustain the education of her children until college so that they will have more options in choosing their own career paths.

loans.use: To buy eggs and rice to sell

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang K. is a 34-year-old man living with his family in Phnom Penh. To earn a living, he sells ice to local customers, which enables him to generate approximately US$5 of profit per day. His wife, Chhun Sreyphors, is 29 years old, and she is a garment factory worker. By doing so, Chhun typically earns approximately US$2 of profit per day. Neang and Chhun have two young children.

Neang is now seeking a loan in the amount of US$200 to purchase additional ice to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional ice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Alefa

texts.en:
Alefa S. is a 31-year-old woman living in the town of Satupaitea Pitonuu 1. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Alefa owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Alefa has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 250 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Alefa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Alefa is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Alefa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jovencita

texts.en: Jovencita E. is from the village of Maramag, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Jovencita owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jovencita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Lemuel

texts.en:
Lemuel A. is from the village of Capellan, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 27 years old, married, and has one infant child.

Lemuel owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. He manages a motorcycle transport business and he earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lemuel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle used in his business. This loan will be his second loan taken from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of his family. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie B., 39, is married and lives in the village of Hda. San Ramon, Brgy Luna, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living by running a general store.

Rosalie’s husband, Ronie B., is 39 years old and works as a company driver, earning about 6,000 PHP per month. They have three children who are between 1 and 13 years old. Two of the children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Rosalie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in December 2007, in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she was able to increase the family's income by engaging in her general store business. Now, she earns an average monthly income of 5,600 PHP from her business activities.

Rosalie is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP was used to fund the operation of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, she is borrowing for her fifth loan, the amount of 13,000 PHP, which she intends to use on the general store. Rosalie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Leonardo Alfredo

texts.es:
Leonardo B. de 42 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa esta en Alemania con ella tiene 2 hijos que estudian en colegios particulares.  

Leonardo empezó trabajando en una empresa de cerrajería, una vez que aprendió esta actividad decidió independizarse y puso un puesto de cerrajería en su casa.  

Ahora Leonardo trabaja todos los días desde las 09h00 hasta las 17h00 elaborando puertas de hierro, ventanas, tiene un empleado que le ayuda. Una de las dificultades que tiene son los racionamientos de energía del gobierno.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar hierro para la elaboración de puertas y cemento, piedras, arena para construir mejor su lugar de trabajo. En el futuro quiere poner otra cerrajería y que su esposa regrese de Alemania.
texts.en:
Leonardo B., 42, lives in the outskirts of the city on Guayaquil's Perimetral highway. His house is made of cement, and it has all of the basic services. His wife is in Germany. They have two children who go to private schools. Leonardo started working in a locksmith shop. Once he learned this job he decided to become independent, and he set up a locksmith stand in his house. Now Leonardo works everyday from 9:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. making doors and windows from iron. He has one employee who helps him. One of the difficulties he has is the government’s rationing of energy. He will use the loan to buy iron to make doors. He will also buy cement, rocks, and sand to better construct his work place. In the future he wants to set up another locksmith shop, and he wants his wife to return from Germany.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Iron, cement, sand, and rocks

loans.name: Urumuri Group

texts.en:
P. is 32 years old and married. She has four children between the ages of 6 and 15 years old. P. and her family live in Gakenke, a region of Ruhengeri in the Northern Province of Rwanda. P. is the president of a group called Urumuri. This group sells a variety of food for the benefit of each member's family. This is their third successful year in this business. The hours of the business are from 7 AM until late in the evening hours.

This group, of which P. is the president, is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase some new products, including beans and sorghum. With these additional goods, which are highly demanded in this area, this group hopes to increase their sales and their profits. With this loan, this group hopes to earn more profits, and these profits will allow each member to have at least one domestic animal to raise at home.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Esta Señora ha tenido 8 créditos ha sido una excelente cliente, solicita un crédito para mejorar su vivienda, repararla y comprar materiales de construcción tales como: laminas de zinc, bloques, cemento, arena, madera, para vivir en una casa digna para su familia. 
Además por medio de este crédito va a poder reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
She has had 8 loans and has been an excellent client. She is asking for a loan to make some home improvements and repairs. She needs to buy building materials and supplies like: zinc metal sheeting, concrete blocks, cement, sand, lumber so that she can live in a house that is proper for her family. Besides, this loan will make it possible for her to repair her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ndoumbe

texts.fr: Madame Ndoumbe D. est une femme de 44 ans vivant dans la localité  de  Guediawaye plus précisément  dans le quartier de Nimzath 2. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis septembre 2009.Madame D. vend du te, du sucre, des produits  détergents  et a une expérience de 20 ans dans son activité. Elle est divorcée  et mère  de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 20 et 25 ans.  Elle a choisi cette activité  par nécessité  car après  le divorce elle devait assurer la survie de ses  enfants.  Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour renforcer son stock de produits. La rentabilité  de son activité  lui permet de satisfaire ses besoins personnels, d’assurer les frais de scolarité  de ses deux filles, l’une étant   étudiante  en deuxième  année  a l’université  de Dakar   et l’autre inscrite dans une institution de santé.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndoumbe D. is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Guediawaye, in the Nimzath 2 district to be precise. She has been a member of the credit association of Baye Laye since September 2009. Ndoumbe sells tea, sugar, and detergents, and she has twenty years of experience in her work. She is divorced and the mother of three children varying in age from 20 to 25 years. She chose this work out of necessity because, after the divorce, she had to ensure the survival of her children. Ndoumbe is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for bolstering her stock of goods. Her business' profitability enables her to cover schooling costs for her two daughters. One of them is a student in her second year at the University of Dakar, and the other is enrolled in a health care institution.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: Sivaitoa

texts.en:
Sivaitoa F. is 53 and married with 7 children.  She owns a business venture, 0 bbq.  Sivaitoa has 5 years of experience in this business.  Sivaitoa needs a loan of WST $1000 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Sivaitoa joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sivaitoa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Camera Group

texts.en:
Ya Rugie K. who is pictured second from right is the leader of this group called “Camera group”. The 42-year-old woman lives in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone, with her husband and two children. One of her children is in secondary school and the other is not of school going age. Ya Rugie has been a businesswoman for 11 years now. She sells bananas, cassavas, pepper, salt, etc.  

Ya Rugie has requested a loan of SLL 500,000 from Kiva field partner SMT in order to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her stock. This is the first loan members of the “Camera group” have requested from SMT/Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy bananas, cassavas, pepper, salt, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Darlina

texts.en: Forty-two-year-old Darlina, who is married and has four children, manages a rice field in Agusan Del Sur.   She is requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for Php 7,000 in order to purchase farm supplies.  CEVI offers the lowest available interest rate and the loan would be of great help in financing her field.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 46 años, viuda y madre de 9 hijos, de los cuales vive con 5 de ellos, en una casa  alquilada, asimismo posee una vivienda propia en lo alto de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Con la ayuda de sus hijos, cultiva frutas cítricas, café, cacao y demás frutos que producen en la selva, lo que más desea es la tranquilidad que le ofrece el campo, por otro lado le desagrada retirar la maleza de sus tierras ya que le resulta pesado y cuando son varios los días que necesita limpiar sus campos, al final salen perjudicados sus brazos, pero el saber que sus cosechas serán excelentes la motivan a continuar. Lleva 20 años en este oficio y gracias a la agricultura ha podido conseguir muchos bienes, como adquirir terrenos agrícolas, una casa junto a sus chacras y cubrir la educación de sus hijos. Es que desea incrementar su productividad, plantando más productos de manera alternada, asimismo implementar un vivero en donde pueda disponer plantas de café. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasmada de trabajar en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una máquina motorizada que le ayudará retirar la maleza de sus terrenos.
texts.en:
46-year old Julia is a widow and mother of nine children, five of whom live with her in a rented house. She also owns her own home on the hilltops around the town of Pichanaki. With help from her children, she grows citrus fruits, coffee, cocoa and other jungle fruits. She really enjoys the tranquility that country living offers. On the other hand she dislikes pulling up the weeds from her fields as it is exhausting work. When the fields need several days of such work, her arms end up being very sore, but the knowledge that the harvest will be excellent keeps her going. Julia has been doing this work for twenty years and thanks to farming, she has been able to obtain much property such as farmland and a house near to her fields, as well as educate her children. Now she wants to increase productivity by alternating different crops, and also start a nursery growing coffee plants. This is Julia’s second loan with Kiva partner MFP and she is very enthusiastic about working with her community group. With the loan she will buy a motorized machine to help remove the weeds from her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a motorized machine to remove weeds

loans.name: Volcanes Flat Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Volcanes (Flat), porque a los integrantes les agrada la vista que tienen de ellos. Están ubicados en la Colonia Plutarco Elías Calles en Ixtapaluca, Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por cinco integrantes que se conocen no solo por ser vecinos sino por que además tienen una amistad. Volcanes se formo gracias a que escucharon comentarios de una vecina sobre el trabajo que realiza Fundación Realidad así que decidieron comenzar con sus reuniones.

El representante del grupo se llama María Guadalupe C. Hernández tiene 45 años,  estudió solo la secundaria y tiene en total dos hijos, una mujer que ya esta casada y un varón quien aun vive con ella. María se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo y pantalones de mezclilla por pedido desde hace mas de cinco años, pero hace año y medio había dejado de vender ya que estaba atravesando por una crisis económica muy difícil, María logro salir adelante gracias a los esfuerzos que hizo y actualmente conserva parte de la gente que ya tenia como clientes, ella sale a mostrar sus catálogos cada tercer día, y cuando la gente la cita para que se los lleve. Los planes que ella tiene es poner un negocio mas grande y así ayudarse con los gastos de su casa, la razón por la cual pidió el préstamo es para comprar catálogos nuevos y surtir los pedidos que tiene tanto de zapatos como de pantalones, la gente escucha de su negocio por recomendaciones de otras personas. María desea aumentar su negocio, para obtener ganancias  con las cuales pueda ayudar a su mama quien es una persona ya adulta y requiere de cuidados y medicamentos.

Los otros cuatro integrantes son: Rosa Isela Hernández Z. (venta de cosméticos por catalogo), Ricardo R. Jiménez (costura y confección), Martha Patricia Juárez O. (venta de ropa interior) y Erika S. García (venta de lencería en general) y quieren el préstamo para invertir en la compra de: telas, ropa interior, lencería en general, compra de zapatos, cosméticos y así tener un ingreso mas para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con sus familias y agradecen la ayuda que se les brinda.
texts.en:
This group calls themselves Volcanes (Flat) because the members enjoy the view that they have of the volcanoes. They are located in Colonia Plutarco Elías Calles in Ixtapaluca, state of Mexico. The group is comprised of five members who know each other from not only being neighbors but because they also have a friendship. The Volcanes came together thanks to hearing reports from a neighbor about the work that the Fundación Realidad does, and they decided to begin with their meetings. The group's representative is María Guadalupe C. H.. She is 45 years old. She studied up to secondary school and has 2 children, one girl who is already married and one boy who still lives with her. María has sold catalog-order shoes and denim pants to made order for the last five years, but a year and a half ago she stopped her sales because she was facing a very difficult economic crisis. María managed to get ahead thanks to her own efforts, and she retained some of the people she used to have as clients. She went out to present her catalogs every three days and when people would call her to bring them. She plans to have a larger business so she can help meet her household expenses. The reason she is requesting this loan is to buy new catalogs and to supply as many orders for shoes that she has for pants. People hear about her business through the recommendations of others. María wants her business to grow and to have greater earnings, with which she could help her elderly mother who needs care and medications. The other four members are: Rosa Isela Hernández Z. (cosmetic sales by catalog), Ricardo R. Jiménez (sewing and clothing), Martha Patricia Juárez O. (sales of underclothes) y Erika S. García (general lingerie sales). They want a loan to be able to invest in the purchase of fabric, underwear, lingerie, shoes, cosmetics, and therefore earn an income that will give them a better quality of life with their families, and they are grateful for the help that you offer.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of fabrics, cosmetics, shoes, lengerie, ladies' underwear, and catalogs

loans.name: Mrs. Sriv Nuon Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has 14 people who live in Angk Sangkae village, Takeo province. Mrs. Sriv N. is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She is 40 years old. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell, in order to support her family. She is a widow with four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, another is helping her to do the farming, while the others are attending a local public school. Although they try to work hard, they earn little money. So to improve her family's standard of living, Mrs. Sriv N. is applying for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her child taxi driver. All the members are shown in the picture but one of them is blocked.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her child taxi driver

loans.name: Ely's Group

texts.en:
Ely L. is from the village of Upper Inuman. She is 31 years old and the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

She is married and has four children. To make a living, she runs a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $130 a month from this activity.

Ely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Ely is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

       About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

       *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy products and goods to sell

location.town: Sindangan-Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of cement

loans.name: Waefeso Group

texts.en:
Jane U., age 44, is married with 4 children, ages, 28, 25, 22 and 20 years. She has had a poultry business since 1998 and also has been selling cement since 2001.  She works daily from 5am until 3pm and she is able to earn a monthly profit of around $1307. This will be Jane’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  With the loan she plans to buy more sacks of cements. She is a hard working lady.

Jane will share this loan with her loan group, Waefeso, which totals 16 members. The members of the group hold each other responsible in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Jane is wearing a pink dress standing in the second row.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of cement.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y el último de sus hijos de 28 años. Hace más de 15 años posee una pequeña librería bazar en la que vende todo tipo de útiles de escritorio y artículos para el hogar, de igual manera en el stand donde ella arrendó tiene  su propia oficina de servicios contables. Desde entonces Nancy ejerce de manera independiente su profesión, esto le ha servido para que ella y su esposo sean el sostén del hogar. Ahora sus hijos son personas independientes, se siente muy contenta y feliz  porque puede seguir generándose sus propias fuentes de ingreso, a pesar que tiene mucha competencia. Para el futuro quiere tener más mercadería disponible. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de papel de diferentes calidades y medidas.
texts.en:
Nancy is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and her youngest child, who is 28 years old. For more than 15 years, she has had a small stationary store where she sells all kinds of stationary supplies and other items for the home. She has her own accounting services office in the same location as her store. Nancy works independently and this has helped her and her husband to support their family. Now that her children are economically independent from her, she is very happy because she can continue generating her own sources of income, even though she has a lot of competition. For the future, she wants to have more merchandise available. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that she has financial support, because she has always been very responsible with her payments. She also likes being a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible people and very supportive. She is grateful to the people who will contribute to the loan that she is requesting and it will be very useful to her in progressing with her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy paper in different qualities and sizes.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper in different qualities

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta Q. is from the village of Tibanga, Iligan City. She is 40 years old. Henrietta is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Henrietta owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Henrietta has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Henrietta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Henrietta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Henrietta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food and daily use products to sell

location.town: Tibanga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una señora D. 73 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y una hija D. 38 años D. edad, residen en el Transito D. San Miguel, se dedica a la venta D. tamales D. frijol y D. pollo, el negocio lo comenzó por iniciativa D. propia y tiene 15 años D. dedicase a este oficio junto a su esposo e hija.
Doña Ana esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. maíz, frijol, y todos los materiales que necesita para la elaboración D. tamales. Este préstamo el ayudara para producir más y generar estabilidad a su negocio a largo plazo, aumentando sus ventas y así mismo sus ingresos serian mayores.
Sus aspiraciones son poseer un negocio fuerte en la venta D. tamales para mejorar su condición D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a 73-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 38-year-old daughter in El Tránsito, a city in the department of San Miguel. She works selling bean and chicken tamales. She began the business herself and has been working at it for 15 years with her husband and daughter.

Ana is requesting a loan for the purchase of corn, beans, and all of the materials that she needs to make tamales. This loan will help her to make more and to bring stability to her business in the long term, increasing her sales as well as her income. Her aspiration is to have a strong business selling tamales to improve her living condition and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make tamales.

loans.name: Royal Group

texts.fr:
Les Cinq membres du groupe ROYAL (3  femmes mariées  et  2celibataires) ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers en générale tels la vente de fruits et légumes avec MARIAM T. Traoré,  des  condiments , du bois de chauffe, des vêtements et de l’encens.
MARIAM T. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  2 chargements de charrette en fruits et légumes auprès des paysans producteurs et les vend au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses  et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the Royal group (three married women and two single women) average 30 years of age and have on average two children each. They live in mongamous families in Sanoubougou 1, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region).

They are on their first loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the goal of satisfying customer demand. This group of women sell a variety of things, such as fruit and vegetables (as is the case for Mariam T.), condiments, firewood, clothes and incense.

With her loan Mariam T. is planning on buying two barrow loads of fruit and vegetables from the peasants that produce them, and then sell them at the market and within the family, on a retail basis for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA, of which part will be used to help her husband with the daily expenses and the rest invested in her business.

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem S., 29 years old, lives with her husband and two young children in the Takeo province. She works in a garment factory, making 3 USD a day, while her husband, pictured here, operates a moto-taxi. On average, he is able to make about 5 USD a day. This family spends about 25 USD on food monthly, 6 USD on utilities and 10 USD on other expenses.

Chem S. is asking for a loan of 1200 USD to purchase a trailer to attach to her husband’s motorbike. A motorbike with a trailer attached can make more money than a motorbike alone.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar T. M. tiene 36 años. Es casado vive la esposa y con el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.  Tiene 4 hijos.

Julio pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Julio  se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo y comprar casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte y trabajar en la tierra.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar T. M. is 36 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and one son in Guaranda Canton, in the province of Bolivar.  He has 4 children.

Julio belongs to the Communal Bank "Guantucoto" that is located a half hour from Guaranda.  The group works in agriculture and livestock, especially in growing corn and potatoes in the highlands, and rice in the coastal area.  This communal bank has 25 members.

Julio has been devoted to agriculture for several years, growing corn and potatoes.  He also has livestock and cattle that he buys in Guaranda and then later sells in the wholesale market in the same city.

He is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs for planting corn and potatoes.  This support would help meet his family's financial needs.  They face challenges such as pests and crop diseases.  His dream is to buy a vehicle and a house.  He also likes to play sports and work the land.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs for planting corn and potatoes.

loans.name: Deysar Delso

texts.es:
Deysar es un joven padre de familia de 21 años de edad, tiene un menor hijo y vive en casa de padres, ubicada en el sector Aviación del distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina), el brinda este servicio en su distrito y siempre cuida de realizarlo de un modo responsable y eficiente. Adicionalmente tiene junto a su madre un pequeño negocio de crianza y comercialización de aves de corral, ganado porcino y vacuno. Los cuales venden a los negociantes que siempre frecuentan la zona en donde reside.

Deysar desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales adquiriendo más cerdos, con ello planea satisfacer a la demanda con la que cuenta, la cual se mantiene a la expectativa. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles
texts.en:
Deysar is a young father who is 21 years old.  He has a young son and lives in his parents' house which is located in the Aviación sector of Cayalti district.  This is a community which works in commerce, farming and livestock raising.  It is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Deysar provides transport services for cargo and passengers in a 'mototaxi' (a motorized vehicle which consists of a motorcyle with a carriage behind it for transporting passengers or cargo).  He provides this service in his district and always makes sure he does so responsibly and efficiently.  In addition, he has a small business together with his mother where he raises and sells poultry, pigs and cattle.  He sells the animals to salespeople who always frequent the area where he lives.

Deysar would like to expand his business raising and selling animals by acquiring more pigs.  He plans to thereby satisfy the demand which he has.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Buy pigs to expand animal husbandry/sales business

loans.name: Hacia Adelante 1, 2, & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is one of the members of the group Hacia adelante 1, 2 & 3 (Going Forward). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She operates a cybercafe with photocopying, computers, Internet, scanning and other services. 

Maria is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for five years, which she started with her own capital after saving for a while. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing some hardware, repairing some computers, and adding an scanner. She will use the profits to expand her business by adding telecommunications products. She says that her most difficult challenges are to improve her business and to help her family. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to cook for her family.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she heard it was a good program where she could get a loan to expand her business, and her story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian clients and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry; the main economic activities are a free trade zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy hardware and fix computers

loans.name: Juliah Muthoni

texts.en:
Juliah is a married woman of 31 with two children aged three and seven. She sells spare parts in Grogan next to a garage in the town centre. She also sells snacks and soft drinks to the workers around her shop. She has been doing this for the last three years.
 
She got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member, and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions. She plans to buy snacks for Kshs 10,000, soft drinks for Kshs 12,000, brake fluid for Kshs 20,000, and nuts and bolts for Kshs 10,000.

In future she hopes to open a bigger auto parts store and garage.

loans.use: Buy snacks, soft drinks, brake fluid, and nuts and bolts

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia P. A. vive en la localidad de Moyotepec municipio de Cd.  Ayala en el estado de Morelos, México. Tiene 41 años, estudio la educación básica hasta la primaria  de niña, y termino la secundaria ya casada en el INEA. El crédito lo va utilizar principalmente para comprar insumos para su negocio como son: un comal para tostar semilla de calabaza, una parrilla de gas, queso de hebra, tomates chiles, azúcar, hojas para tamal manteca, carne, chocolate. La señora Antonia pretende utilizar una parte del préstamo para realizar algunas mejorías en su hogar que le permitan también mejorar en su negocio como son: echar piso firme en la cocina de su domicilio. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de tamales, atole, semilla de calabaza tostada y molida para el mole verde (pipián); Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años, en aquel entonces la necesidad el obligo a iniciar una  actividad económica. Aprendió el oficio a traves de una prima de su esposo que le enseño a elaborar tamales, antes de dedicarse a la venta de tamales se dedico a otras actividades, vendiendo fruta y verdura de casa en casa, vendia tortillas elaboradas a mano, picaditas y le iba muy bien en su negocio. También cuando es temporada vende mangos y toronjas.
 Su negocio no está establecido, ella  vende de casa en casa los días lunes, miércoles y sábado en su localidad. Su trabajo aunque es pesado, porque lo hace caminando, es importante porque le ayuda a sacar adelante a sus hijos en la escuela y los gastos de la casa, disfruta mucho las labores de su oficio como el dorar la semilla, preparar los tamales. Una gran satisfacción que le da su negocio es que siempre tiene dinero para sus necesidades y también para sus gustos. Un momento de gran orgullo para ella fue cuando, con unos ahorros que junto de su trabajo, compró material para repellar las paredes de su casa.
Su negocio principalmente ayuda  a las amas de casa que cuando no prepararon de comer le compran a ella sus productos (tamales. Mole, picaditas, etc.). Nos comenta que en promedio atiende entre 50 y 60 personas. Algunos de los desafíos que ha enfrentado en su negocio son la contante alza de los precios y las inclemencias del tiempo.
La señora Antonia señala que para ella es muy importante su negocio porque le ha ayudado a salir adelante con sus hijos y le gustaría que a través de su trabajo cada día este mejor con su familia que no les falte nada. Le da gusto recibir este préstamo y siente una gran responsabilidad por pagarlo. La señora Antonia quiere decirle a KIVA “muchas gracias por confiar en mí y darme el préstamo porque es de gran ayuda para mi negocio y para mi familia y que además le me dan facilidad para ir pagándolo y es poco el interés”. A ella le gusta su comunidad porque desde ahí en días despejados se ve el volcán (popocatepetl) y los cerros y es campo abierto.
texts.en:
Ms. Antonia P. A. lives in the town of Moyotepec, municipality of Cd. Ayala, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. She is 41 years old. As a girl she studied basic education in primary school and finished high school in the INEA open system after marriage. She is going to use this loan principally to buy consumable products for her business: a griddle to toast pumpkin seeds, a gas grill, string cheese, tomatoes, chiles, sugar, tamale leaves, butter, meat, and chocolate.   

Ms. Antonia hopes to use a part of the loan to carry out some improvements to her home which will allow her to improve her business. Specifically, to put down a hard floor in the kitchen of her house. She has a business which sells tamales, atole (a maize drink), and toasted and ground pumpkin seeds for green mole/pipian (a sauce for stewing). She started this business 10 years ago when necessity obliged her to take on an economic activity. She learned the trade from a cousin of her husband who taught her how to make tamales. Before dedicating herself to tamale sales, she had other activities; selling fruit and vegetables door to door, and selling hand-made tortillas and picaditas, and her business was going very well. As well, she sells mangos and grapefuit when in season.

Her business is not fixed. She sells door to door on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays in her community. Her work, although heavy as she does it on foot, is important because it helps her to get her children ahead in school and with the household expenses. She enjoys the tasks of her trade, such as browning the seed and preparing the tamales. A big satisfaction she gets from her business is always having money for her necessities as well as for her pleasure. A moment of great pride for her was when, with some savings from her work, she bought material to plaster the walls of her house.    

Her business principally helps housewives who, when they don't prepare something to eat, buy her products (tamales, mole, picaditas, etc.) We mention that on average she serves between 50 and 60 people. Some of the challenges she has confronted in her business are the constant rise in prices and harsh weather. 

Ms. Antonia points out that her business is very important to her because it has helped her and her children to get ahead and she would like that through her work each day is better with her family and that they don't lack anything. She is pleased to receive this loan and feels a large responsibility to repay it. Ms. Antonoa wants to say to Kiva "thank you very much for having confidence in me and giving me this loan because it is a big help for my business and for my family. Also, it gives me easy repayment terms and small interest." She likes her community because from here on clear days you can see the volcano (popocatepetl) and the hills, and it is open country.

loans.use: To buy a tortilla griddle to brown the seed, a gas grill, leaves for tamales, chiles, butter, cane, Oaxaca cheese, sugar, chocolate

loans.name: Johana

texts.es: Johana tiene 22 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos en una casa propia. Hace más de 2 años vende cosméticos por medio de catálogos, ofreciéndoles a sus compañeros de estudios de la universidad donde estudia, asimismo a otras amistades que tiene. Sus productos son ofrecidos a crédito para después cobrarles por partes, pero en lo posible trata de vender sus productos cuando están de ofertas y promociones  para que se mantenga estable sus ventas. Ella se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que no le perjudica su tiempo de estudios y a la vez poder solventar sus propios gastos. Ahora su meta se ha propuesto la de incrementar aún más la mercadería que tiene y poder vender más. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece además a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar más mercadería en productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Johana, 22, lives with her parents and siblings in their own house.  For over two years she has sold cosmetics via catalogue sales to her fellow university students where she’s enrolled as well as to other acquaintances she has.  She offers her products on credit and collects partial payments.  For the most part, however, she strives to offer her products when they are on sale or special promotion so that her sales will remain constant.  She feels very happy with the work she does since it does not interfere with her studies and provides for her personal expenses.

Her goal now is to increase her stock merchandise still more in order to sell more.  This is her first loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she can count on financial assistance.  Besides, she enjoys participating in her communal bank because all the members are people she knows who are responsible and mutually supportive.

She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan she is requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the requested loan to buy more beauty products.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Benigno Vidal

texts.es:
El señor Benigno Ampié labora en el Municipio de Masaya, Departamento de Masaya como Fontanero desde hace 22 años, actualmente dependen de él cuatro personas las cuales son su esposa y sus tres hijos menores que estan en edad escolar.

La necesidad con la que se enfrenta este señor es la de mejorar su vivienda ya que el techo lo tiene algo descompuesto y quiere mejorarlo. Por esta razón se acerca a las oficinas de CEPRODEL para solicitar el crédito y así realizar la compra de materiales para cambiar el techo de su casa.

El está claro que al cambiar  lo anteriormente dicho le estará dando un mejor hogar a su familia.
texts.en:
Ampié P. has worked as a plumber in the town of Masaya, in Masaya Department for 22 years.  He is currently accompanied by another person.  Four people depend on him: his wife and his three school-age children.  

The need that this gentleman has is to improve his home since his roof is a bad state of repair and he would like to improve it.  For this reason, he approached Ceprodel's offices so that he could buy the materials he needs to replace his roof.

It goes without saying that by replacing his roof he will be providing his family with a better home.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve his home

loans.name: Luz Benigna

texts.es:
La señora Luz Benigna C. de 70 años se dedica desde hace más de 20 años a la venta de comida ella inicio con dos pailas haciendo un poquito de comida actualmente tiene una comideria bien establecida con el cual saco adelante a sus cuatro hijos los cuales cada uno es independiente. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en el negocio como arroz, frijoles, carne etc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Benigna C., 70, has been selling prepared food for over 20 years.  She started with just two frying pans making a little bit of food.  Presently she has a well established eatery with which she raised her four children every one of which is now independent.

She will use the loan to invest in the business buying rice, beans, meat, etc.

loans.use: For basic grains especially rice, oil, meat, etc.

loans.name: Wilfredo Heriberto

texts.es: El Sr. Wilfredo es una persona que trabaja en una maquiladora además de contar  con un puesto de hamburguesas en su domicilio, el cual  atiende personalmente  los fines de semana en compañía de su esposa, con la venta de hamburguesas, burritos y toda la variedad de comida rápida que  ellos producen han mejorado satisfactoriamente  sus  ingresos  pero requieren de la  compra  de mercancía  para   que  este  negocio  continúe  funcionando ya  que   con los ingresos  de la maquiladora  no les  es   suficiente para  abastecerse  de materia  prima, así como también desean  incrementar  la variedad  de platillos   ofrecidos a  sus  cliente  ya  que consideran  que  de esta  manera  atraerán  a su negocio a  un mayor   numero  de personas.
texts.en: Mr. Wilfredo works at a factory and also has a hamburger stand at his home where he works on the weekends with the help of his wife.  They sell hamburgers, burritos, and all kinds of fast food that they make.  Their income has increased at a nice rate but they need to buy more supplies to stay in business because the earnings from the factory are not enough to buy high-quality supplies.  They also wish to offer a greater variety of dishes to their customers as they feel they will attract more people.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Adzo

texts.en: Adzo A. is divorced and has three children. Adzo is into multiple businesses. She sells plantain, palm fruits, makes palm oil  for sale at Abura near Frami in Cape Coast. Her income is used to feed and educate her children. Adzo will use the loan to purchase extra quantities of palm fruits for sale to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adzo plans to build a small factory for the production of palm oil.

loans.use: to purchase extra quantities of palm fruits for sale.

loans.name: Pharis

texts.en: Pharis is a hardworking businessman who sells vehicle spare parts. He is 32 years old, married and blessed with a two-year-old child. He has been running his business for ten years. He has saved his money with a group in Faulu Kenya. In the group, he is able to access loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other's loans. He has requested 60,000 Kes to buy more spare parts.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts

loans.name: Doris Estela

texts.es:
Doris, reside en Usulután, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene casa propia donde vive con sus dos hijos, el negocio lo inicio hace 8 meses y lo realiza de forma ambulante, ofreciendo sus productos todos los días a los clientes.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa nueva de diferentes estilos y colores, su objetivo es ofrecer a los clientes una mayor variedad donde puedan encontrar lo necesario para vestirse.
Su sueño es tener un local propio y fijo para ofrecer la mercadería, ya que actualmente debe desplazarse a varios lugares buscando clientes.
texts.en:
Doris lives in Usulután, where she dedicates herself to selling clothing.  She has her own house, where she lives with her two children.  She started the business 8 months ago.  She sells her products as a street vendor, offering items to her customers every day.

She requests this loan to buy new clothing of different styles and colors.  Her goal is to offer her customers a greater variety of items, so they can find what they need.  Her dream is to have her own fixed location from which to offer her merchandise, as she currently has to travel to various places looking for customers.

loans.use: buy new clothing of different styles and colors.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, vive con su madre y una sobrina, es soltero y solamente él trabaja en una panadería, inicio por sus amigos, quienes influyeron para que iniciara el negocio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar, huevos, aceite, leche, entre otros que son necesarios para preparar el pan, esta compra le ayudara a tener los materiales necesarios para la producción y así atender de una mejor manera a los clientes.
Sueña con ser un comerciante de éxito, tener sus propios negocios y vivir en condiciones  dignas junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge lives in El Transito, San Miguel Department, with his mother and a niece.  He is single and works in a bakery that he started thanks to friends who encouraged him to start the business.

He is asking for a loan to buy flour, eggs, sugar, oil and milk, among other, that are needed to make bread.  This purchase will help him have the ingredients that are necessary for production and therefore provide better customer service.

He dreams with becoming a successful merchant, owning his own businesses and living with his family in dignified conditions.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, oil and milk.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La señora María Neófita, vive en unión libre con  el señor  Zenaido, con quien procreo   cinco hijos: Patricia Yurídia de diesi seis años, Britania Marisol  de trece años de trece años, Rocío de siete años,  Enrique Daniel de cuatro años y Anderson de  dos años.

    Ella se dedica a la  sastrería  y con esta actividad lleva siete años, en donde nos comenta que le va bien y solicito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra de materiales  que utiliza en la  elaboración de las ropas, como son: botones, encajes, cierres, hilos, entre otros,   así con ellos podrá comprar mejor calidad y sus clientes estarán satisfechos con su trabajo que realiza.

      Su inspiración  comenzó por su  que su mama la enseño a la costura y cuando estudio la secundaria entro en el taller de corte y confección la cual la apoyo mucho para mejorar su calidad de trabajo, comenta que con esta actividad  se apoya mucho ya que  le deja un mejor ingresos en su hogar.

     Su más  grande deseo es que con esta actividad, pueda tener ahorro, para que con ello  logres salir adelante y apoye también a sus hijos que sigan estudiando.

    Quienes integra  en el grupo son las  señora: Reinalda, quien se dedica a la elaboración de tamales para salir a venderlo en la misma localidad, Lorena, en la compra  de cosméticos, como son: maquillaje, labiales, tintes, entre otros, María Magdalena, se dedica a comprar frutas y verduras para venderlo en el mercado.
texts.en:
María Neófita lives with her partner Zenaido, with whom she has five children: Patricia Yurídia, sixteen years old, Britania Marisol, thirteen years old, Rocío, seven years old, Enrique Daniel, four years old, and Anderson, who is two.

She has been a seamstress for seven years.  She tells us it is going well for her.  She is asking for the loan to purchase materials that she uses to make clothing, such as buttons, lace, closures, and thread, among other items.  She will be able to buy better quality, and her clients will be satisfied with the work that she does.

Her inspiration started because her mother taught her to sew.  When she was in secondary school, she started in a dressmaking workshop, which supported her a lot in improving the quality of her work.  She notes that this activity gives her a lot of support, since it brings in better earnings for her household.

Her greatest desire is that with this activity, she can save some money, so that with it she can succeed in moving forward and also in supporting her children, who are still in school.

The members of the group are: Reinalda, who makes tamales in order to sell them in her town; Lorena, who buys cosmetics such as makeup, lipstick, hair dye, among others; and María Magdalena, who buys fruits and vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as buttons, thread, and closures, among others, to make clothing.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 18 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Aisha has a small retail shop, which she has run for over ten years.
To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.
Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities for resale.

loans.name: Loetitia Viviane

texts.fr: Née en 1943 au Bénin, Loetitia Viviane est une veuve qui  vit  seule. Loetitia Viviane  à un enfant scolarisé, à sa charge. Loetitia Viviane n’a jamais été  à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de  l’enfant à charge, Loetitia Viviane mène comme activité depuis près de douze ans la vente  des tissus.  Grâce  au revenu que lui génère son activité, Loetitia Viviane  assure convenablement les différentes charges de sa famille. Loetitia Viviane s’approvisionne  au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie et son revenu, Loetitia Viviane sollicite pour une troisième  fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Born in 1943 in Benin, Loetitia Viviane is a widow living on her own. She has a dependent child in school. Loetitia Viviane never attended school. In order to provide for herself and   the child in her care, she has been selling fabrics for over dozen years. Thanks to the income from this activity, she manages to provide for her household in a dignified way. Loetitia Viviane stocks up in Togo, the country neighboring Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand and improving her income and life conditions, Loetitia Viviane is seeking a third loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Ruben owns a motorcycle to transport passengers from the village to downtown. He has had this service for two years. He requested a loan of 5,000 to buy needed spare parts, bolts, lights and a tire for the motorcycle.

Ruben has been a member of HSPFI for this year, 2011. In the future, Ruben hopes to stay longer in this sector and buy another motorcycle for transportation services.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, bolts, lights and a tire for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Babyelesa Development Group

texts.en:
The consumption rates of cow milk have always been high in most urban centers in Uganda. The rising demand for this milk has been brought to pass by the increase in cheap milk supplies from Western Uganda, where most people rear sturdy milk producing cattle. This is a far cry from a decade ago when cow milk was scarce. In the present age, cheap cow milk outlets have opened up in almost every major town in Uganda. As a result, even those who could not afford milk in the past are in a position to buy it.

A case in point is 45 year old Clement who does not purchase her milk for home consumption but for resale. She has been engaged in the cow milk sales business in Mukono for the past 12 years. Creating a good rapport with her milk suppliers has been playing to her advantage in many ways, principally the fact that she is supplied with milk every time her supplies run short.

Mukono, like many other Ugandan urban areas, now gets most of its milk supplies from traders who transport their milk from Western Uganda. Clement, a happily married mother of three, says she was pep talked into this business by her brother. Before that, she was engaged in a hides and skins sales enterprise. Weekly, her sales profits total 100,000 Ugandan shillings.

With this Kiva loan, Clement plans to purchase more jerrycans of milk for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more jerrycans of milk for resale.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Luz has a retail shop that sells liquid petroleum gas & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy additional stocks of liquid petroleum gas.

Luz is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of liquid petroleum gas

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El sr. Mario es esposo de una clienta antigua la Sra. María, ellos tienen dos hijas que ya se independizaron, una de ellas se casó y la otra trabaja y estudia, la Sra. María se dedica a la venta de leche, ella cría vacas, el esposo el sr.  Mario se dedica a la venta de arena y piedras, que saca del rio irpavi, anteriormente se dedicaba al manejo de transporte, el que lo vendió para adquirir un terreno, el sr. Mario solicita precisamente este crédito para tramites y regularización de ese bien, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señor Mario is married to a former client of his, Señora María.  They have two daughters who are financially independent; one is married and the other works and is a student.  María works selling milk; she raises cows.  Her husband, Señor Mario, works selling of sand and stones, which he collects from the Irpavi river.  Previously, he worked managing transportation, which he sold in order to buy land.  

Señor Mario is specifically requesting this loan for paperwork and regulation for his property.  He is a very responsible and hardworking person, who is grateful to the institution for the support being offered.

loans.use: to pay for paperwork related to his house.

loans.name: Mukadaskhon

texts.ru: Мукадасхон проживает в городе Исфара. Возраст, 55 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Она занимается торговлей. Арендует торговую точку, где продает ткани. Этим видом деятельности Мукадасхон занимается пять лет. В торговле ей помогает ее муж. Она берет кредит для покупки новых видов тканей.
texts.en: Mukadaskhon lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 55 years old, married and has two children.  She is involved in retail sales and leases a retail outlet, where she sells fabrics.  Mukadaskhon has been involved in this business for five years.  Her husband helps her with the sales.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of new types of fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase new types of fabrics

loans.name: Cheikh Gora

texts.fr: Monsieur Gora est un jeune sénégalais de 23 ans qui évolue depuis 5 ans dans le commerce. Il est spécialisé dans la vente de matériaux de construction tels que les briques, les dalles, les collistrats et balustras. Il a opté pour cette activité par nécessité  dans le but de se procurer des revenus pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.  C’est un soutien de famille car il est l’ainé de sa maman, mais aussi il est père d’un enfant qui est âgé d’un an.  Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat  de produits de base(ciment ) qui lui permettront de fabriquer les briques et dalles qu’il commercialise. Ce financement lui permettra de renforcer son fond de roulement  ,d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de mieux développer son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Mr. Gora is a young Senegalese, 23 years old, who has been working in commerce for five years. He is a specialist in selling construction supplies, such as bricks, flagstones, collistrats, and balusters. He opted for this business out of necessity with the goal of acquiring the revenues for supporting his family. He is a pillar of the family, since he is his mother's oldest son but also since he is the father of a 1-year-old child. Mr. Gora has been a member of a branch of the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC since April 2011. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for buying basic products (cement) that will allow him to make bricks and flagstones, which he markets. This financing will enable him to bolster his working capital, to grow his profits, and to develop his business further.

loans.use: to buy cement

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a business man. Age 28, he is married and blessed with one child. For the last ten years, he has been operating a business of selling scrap metals to make a living. The scrap metals are later used to make energy-saving cookers, pans and cooking pots.

Joseph is requesting for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy scrap metals. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. His dream is to buy a plot.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has a business of selling fish in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Margret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. The extra income will help to pay for the children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Reymonda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Reymonda works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store. Reymonda is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Reymonda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorycle maintenance.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Con su credikiva, don Rigoberto compró plásticos sintéticos al pormayor y fabricó forros de lavadoras computadores e impresoras, con ello aumentó sus ganancias y esta muy satisfecho. En la actualidad aplica a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará Sinteticos para producir mas forros para darle respuesta a su clientela. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: "Muy agradecido por apoyar a personas de la tercera edad que como yo aun somos productivos. "
texts.en: Rigoberto used his Kiva loan to buy synthetic plastic fabric at wholesale and manufactured slipcovers for washing machines, computers and printers.  He increased profits and is very satisfied.  He is currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy synthetic fabric to make more slipcovers to respond to customer demand.  His message to lenders is the following: “I am very grateful for the support you give to senior citizens like me who are still productive.”

loans.use: to buy synthetic fabric to make more slipcovers.

loans.name: And Jef Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe And Jeff  est composé de 9 membres depuis la création du Banc Villageois suite au bon voisinage et une bonne cohabitation. 

Madame Nguénar debout a droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée âgé de 45 ans. Elle mariée et  mère de 12 enfants .

Elle mène une activité de commerce de détails avec son nouveau prêt de 50000 francs cfa elle compte acheter du lait du sucre du savon de la cigarette destiné a la revente. 

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans son activité pour l'avoir mené pendant plusieurs années.

Avec ses bénéfices elle va payer les frais d inscription a une mutuelle de santé pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group called "And Jef" has been  made up of nine members since the creation of the "Banc Villageois" (community bank), based on being good neighbors and living well together.  

Madame Nguénar, who is standing on the right in the photo, is the leader of the group. She is married, aged 45, and the mother of 12 children.  

She has a small-scale retail business and with her new loan of 50,000 F CFA she intends to buy milk, sugar, soap, and cigarettes for resale. 

She has a lot of experience in her business as she has been in it for several years. With her profit, she will pay the registration fees in a health insurance plan for her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, milk, soap, and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Vivian is making and peddling viands like fried fish, ginataang langka and atsara. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Vivian has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vivian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar de 34 años, hace 12 años convive con su pareja, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 7 años. Esta familia habita en la calidez de un  hogar propio en el distrito de Palcamayo. Gracias a su habilidad y destreza, Edgar ha sabido desenvolverse con eficacia en las actividades que realiza. 
Desde niño aprendió a labrar la tierra junto a sus padres. En la actualidad cuenta con sembríos de papa, olluco y oca. Los que al cosechar vende satisfactoriamente en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. 
Así también posee 250 cabezas de ganado ovino, y algunas vacas. Con estos animales pudo iniciar su negocio de venta de carne de carnero. “Para cada feria sacrifico 2 carneros, vendo su carne, la cabeza, el pellejo, las patas y la menudencia”, comenta, agregando que la rentabilidad de su trabajo radica en la captación de clientes concurrentes. Para facilitar ambas actividades, Edgar cuenta con una camioneta, la que emplea para el traslado de sus cosechas, animales, y demás productos. Incrementar su producción de tubérculos es una de sus metas, y paralelamente abrir puestos de carne en el mercado de Tarma, para ello continua con su ardua labor. Éste sería su préstamo número 15 de MFP, como lo hizo en todo este tiempo, se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. “Mirando hacia un futuro mejor”, es el nombre de su banco comunal y a la vez uno de sus objetivos.
Invertirá el 50% del dinero en la compra de abonos orgánicos para su siembra de papas, y el otro 50% para la adquisición de carnes de carnero las que revenderá a mayor precio.
texts.en:
Edgar is 34 years old and has been with his spouse, with whom he has 2 children, ages 9 and 7, for 12 years.  This family lives in the warmth of their own home in the district of Palcamayo.  Thanks to his abilities and skill, Edgar has known how to carry out his activities with great efficacy.

As a child, he learned how to work the land at the side of his parents.  Currently, he has potato, olluco and oca (Peruvian tubers) crops.  At harvest time, his product sells very well at the wholesale market in Tarma.

He also has 250 heads of sheep and some cows.  With these animals, he was able to start a business selling meat.  “For each fair, I butcher 2 sheep and sell their meat, head, hide, and the hooves and giblets,” he comments, adding that his business’ profits hinge on capturing repeat customers.  To facilitate both activities, Edgar counts on a small truck that he uses to transfer his crops, animals and other products.

Increasing his tuber production is one of his goals, as well as opening meat sales stalls at the market in Tarma, which is why he continues to work arduously.  This would be his 15th loan with MFP and, as he has done all this time, he commits to being punctual with his loan payments.  “Looking Towards a Better Future” is the name of his cooperative bank and, concurrently, one of his goals.

He will invest 50% of the funds into buying organic fertilizer for his potato crops, and the other 50% to buy sheep meat to resell at a higher price.

loans.use: buy sacks of organic fertilizer and sheep meat.

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en:
Winfred lives in the coastal town of Changamwe and has a salon that has been in operation for one year. She has employed one person in her current job. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.
 
Winfred is applying for a loan of KES 70,000 to purchase beauty products and appliances like a drier and hot combs. She looks forward to opening a state-of-the-art salon incorporating a training school and a beauty shop in the future.

Her main challenge is the high cost of rent, but she believes that through the additional income from this business, she will still be able to educate her children and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and appliances like a drier and hot combs.

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.en: Hamadi is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,00O to boost his video cafe business. With the loan, he wants to expand the video room and purchase audio speakers. He dreams of expanding his business to meet the customers' needs.

loans.use: to expand the video room and purchase audio speakers.

loans.name: Freddy Gilbert

texts.es:
Freddy Gilpert tiene 40 años vive en unión libre, y vive con su hijo, de 9 años. Vive en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla el recreo  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz, fréjol y soya.
Freddy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace siete años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos, abonos, urea, semillas para la siembra de maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y conversar con su hijo.
texts.en:
Freddy Gilpert is 40 years old, lives with his wife and son of 9 years of age.  They live in the San Vicente las Lomas area of the Ventanas canton.

The V.C.R. El Recreo is located in San Vicente las Lomas, part of the Ventanas canton.  The members are farmers growing corn, rice, beans and soy beans.

Freddy is a farmer and has been growing corn for seven years.  He buys his products in Ventanas and sells his crop at the market of the same location.
