The requested loan is for the purchase of supplies, fertilizers and seed for the planting of corn.  The loan helps him to bring more income for the use of his family.  His dream is to buy a car.

In his free time he likes to go for a walk and to converse with his son.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, fertilizers and seed for the planting of corn.

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Penninah is 38 years old, married, and has four children. They live in Kasese, Uganda. She has been running a pub for one year. Her major hardships are high fuel and taxes.

Penninah is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a refrigerator for use in her pub. In the future, she wants to diversify her business to include a hotel. Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent home.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for use in her pub.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 28-year-old married man. He describes himself to be hard working. He operates a business where he provides transportation services to customers within his area. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a busy residential area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. 

He will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Sayligul Group

texts.en: Это группа состоит из Сайлигул и Сафарали. Они жители города Куляб. Сайлигулу  48 лет. Сафарали 23 года. Сайлигул мать Сафарали, и у нее есть еще дети и невестка. Муж Сайлигул работает учителем в школе. Сайлигул и Сафарали выращивает мелко рогатого скота у себя во дворе более 10 лет. Они любят животных, и поэтому они занимаются животноводством. Сайлигул и Сафарали покупает мелко рогатого скота и откармливает их в течение определенного времени и перепродают их на скотном рынке. Сайлигул и Сафарали решили обратиться  за кредитом, чтобы расширить животноводческой деятельности. И за счет денег купят несколько мелко рогатого скота. Этот кредит поможет им достичь своей целей и улучшить условий жизни ее семьи. Сайлигул и Сафарали надеются на Вашу поддержку.

loans.use: to buy kids to expand their animal rearing business.

loans.name: Ngaakoom Group

texts.en:
The  "Ngaakom" is starting its first loan cycle with ID-Ghana. They meet in the Teshi branch office. The group has 6 members and is led by a board of directors of which Regina is the President. The members of this group are developing a variety businesses, including: kenkey sales, smoked fish sales, tooth brush and paste sales, general goods sales and soap sales.

This loan will benefit all of the small businesswomen in this group. Regina states that this is the fourth time that she has worked with ID-Ghana. She joined the group at the invitation of one of the loan officers from the institution who works in her area. Regina now has a business selling kenkey and fried fish. She got to know this business because she learned it from her mother a number of years ago.

This loan will help Regina to increase her capital (to buy maize,fishes, firewood and other ingredient at wholesale). She will purchase this inventory from the wholesale suppliers in the city of Teshi, and she will later sell this product from her sales stall. By working in this way, Regina can generate resources to support her family financially, as she is married with three children all schooling.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the training and health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy maize,fishes, firewood and other ingredient at wholesale)

loans.name: Guloglan

texts.en:
Guloglan is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Zangilan region. He is married. He settled with family and 3 children in Sumgait city. 43-year-old Guloglan started his business 9 years ago. His first loan was $700, bought 3 calves. The loans were paid back timely.
Now he is planning to buy 4 calves. Guloglan applies for a loan amounting 1000$.

loans.use: He is planning to buy 4 calves

loans.name: Kerimov

texts.en: G. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Khojavand region of Azerbaijan, now under occupation by Armenian forces. He and his family of his wife and four children were relocated to the Beylagan region. Since 2004, he has been engaged in cattle breeding and sales, which is quite a profitable business in rural areas. When he started the business he borrowed $300 from Normicro Beylagan branch as an initial capital to buy calves. Later he borrowed two more loans. Now he needs new loan in amount of $900 to buy livestock.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munirahon owns and operates a small clothing shop in the center of Avganbazaar in Kudjand.
She is a student at the Teacher-training Institute. Her mother helps in her business. They are very diligent women. They started their business 7 years ago from crocheting and knitting headscarves and shawls. They sold their goods in the Yakshanbe and Chuma open-air bazaar. In 2003 Munirahon became a client of Micro Invest. With her loan, she rented a small shop in Avganbazaar. Today she and her mother sell children clothes, which she imports from the Istaravshan wholesale market.  She wants to expand her inventory to include more modern children clothing, which her customers in Khudjand is demanding. She has requested a loan to give her some extra capital to use for buying modern children clothes.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi S. is a 35 year old father of two with three dependants. He has a shop where he sells all sorts of bags, ranging from ladies’ handbags, school bags and travelers’ bags. His business is in the Vituka area, a suburb of Dar es Salaam area near the Nyerere International Airport. He has been in this business for the past seven years. He sells both used bags and new bags, and buys stock from wholesalers from Kariokoo, Dar es Salaam’s and perhaps Tanzania’s biggest trading area.

Apart from this business, he also runs a kiosk. He has recently acquired many customers and his goods are in high demand in the area, since he is the only one with such a business in the area. He is requesting a loan of USD$750 to help him buy more stock and accommodate the increasing demand for his goods in the area.

loans.use: Buy more stock to expand business

loans.name: Sonia Porfidia

texts.es:
Sonia is 39 years old and is married to Erasmo F. Arteaga, with whom she has two children. They live in the Toborochi neighborhood, in a house owned by Sonia's mother. Her beauty salon, providing hair styling, massages and spa services, is located at the same address.

This request for a loan is to buy the equipment necessary to proviD. the best service possible to current and future clients. The equipment includes: hair dryer, chair, and hair tints, whose prices vary based on whether they are new or used in the case of the furniture and dryers, and their brand in the case of the tints.

Sonia had a negative credit record at one time which has been resolved and she has always met her obligations with this sponsoring institution in a timely and responsible manner. It must be noted that her picture is not available as she was not on the premises when the photographer went to take her picture and her assistant did not want to be photographed.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia es una señora D. 39 años D. edad que está casada con el señor Erasmo F. Arteaga, tienen dos hijos y viven en la urbanización TOBOROCHI, en la calle Los Ceibos, UV-132, mza-58, esta casa le pertenece a la madre D. Sonia. En el mismo domicilio se encuentra instalado el salón D. belleza donD. se realizan tintes, peinados, masajes y yesoterapias. Este tipo D. rubros en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz D. la Sierra tiene bastante competencia, pero la demanda por verse bien es también bastante elevada, esto sin distinciones entre estratos sociales. La presente solicitud es para la implementación D. nuevos equipos en el salón, con lo que se satisfacerá D. mejor manera las exigencias D. las clientes actuales y futuras. Los equipos que se comprarán con el crédito son: Una secadora, un sillón, Tintes Profesionales D. diferentes marcas y otros, los precios D. los mismos varian según si los muebles son nuevos o usados y en el caso D. los tintes dependiendo D. la marca. Sonia tiene un antecedente negativo que ya fué solucionado y desistido, sin embargo en la institución siempre ha cumplido sus cuotas D. manera puntual y responsable. Se hace notar que la cliente no sale en la foto debido a que cuando se fué a tomar la foto la misma no se encontraba, sólo se ubico a su ayudante y no quiso salir en la foto.

loans.use: To buy equipment for beauty salon

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María is married and has one son. She is a fighting mother, and for more than nine years, she has had a humble shop where she sells coffee and food in the village market. Nevertheless, she has fixed up the facilities of her simple shop to her tastes.

Before she got her stand in the market, María Estela worked in the Central Bank of Nicaragua. She started her shop with an initial investment of $1000.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for more than two and a half years and has an excellent credit record. Thanks to the financing she has received, she has increased her inventory and invested her extra income in the education of her son and her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Esta señora es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella ha sido una madre luchadora la cual posee desde hace más de9 años un humilde puesto de venta de cafe y comida en el mercado mayoreo. La infraestructura del local sin embargo ella lo ha ido acondicionando a su gusto.

Antes de tener su puesto en el mercado, Marai Estela trabajaba en el Banco Central de Nicaragua. Su puesto inicia con capital de aproximadamente US$ 1000 dólares.

Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace más de 2½ años con un excelente record crediticio. Gracias al financiamiento ha incrementado su inventario y sus ganacias la ha invertido en la educacion de su hijo y manutencion de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase a showcase for her pastries

loans.name: Urima

texts.en: Urima is a married mother of 24 years of age with 2 children. Urima's family lived with a vegetable garden as their only source of income. When she got married, she decided to move on her own with her husband. Her husband is also unemployed and works on their plantation. This is Urima's second loan with SPBD. With her first loan, she bought equipment to use in their garden. With her second loan she will also buy pesticides, fertilizers, and other tools to make the work easier and quicker. Urima is very thankful for such a great opportunity to improve her family's life.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Moriya

texts.ru:
Moriya N., 48, is married and has 3 children. For 14 years, she has been selling traditional fabrics for Tajik national clothing. Moriya has a sales spot at “Tidzhorat” market in Yavan. Moriya plans to use this loan to purchase a few new types of fabric for women. The new fabrics are very popular among the local women. Moriya plans to repay this loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Набиева Мория, возраст – 48 лет, образование средне, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Мория заниамется торговлей национальными тканями для пошива национальной женской оджеды. Этим видом деятельности она занимается в течение 14 лет. Для этого она арендует торговую точку на одном из рынков города Яван под названием «Тиджорат». На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести новый вид женских тканей появивишихся недавно. Так как такой товар пользуется большим спросом у местного населения данный кредит даст возможность женской половине приобретать нужные им виды тканей для пошива национальной одежды на мероприятия различного рода, такие как свадьбы, национальные обряды и просто для повседневной жизни. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of new fabrics

loans.name: Chinyere.

texts.en: A. Chinyere is 35 years old, married with five children, and hails from Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is the secretary of her union for the past four years and has been in business for over five years. She needs a loan of $1200 to enable her to buy more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Zumratbi

texts.ru:
Zumratbi N. lives in the village of Rudaki. She is 52, married and has 6 children. Zumratbi N. sells shoes at the “Korvon” market in Dushanbe. She buys the shoes wholesale from Chinese suppliers and then retails them at the market. This business is the main source of income for Zumratbi N.’s family. Zumratbi N. asks for this loan to increase the volume of goods sold and, consequently, her profits. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ниедова Зумратби проживает в районе Рудаки.Возраст 52 года. Замужем , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей . продает обувь на рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе.Заказывает товар в Китай Оптовым поставщикам , а затем продает в розницу. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи, поэтому ей необходимо развивать свой бизнес путем увеличения товарооборота.Это поможет клиентке увеличить ассортимент и соответственно прибыльность бизнеса.Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase inventory and variety of goods sold

loans.name: Ayeshetu

texts.en:
Ayeshetu A. is thirty-seven years old and a single parent of three children. She works very hard to provide for her children's needs. Through the loan, Ayeshetu was able to open small clothing and earring shop. She buys her products from Togo. She wants to buy more variety of cloths and earrings with the new loan so her stock will attract more customers. Her income will help educate her children.
Ayeshetu is a member of the group called Eagle. Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes and earrings in larger, wholesale amounts

loans.name: Istamar

texts.id:
Istamar has been working as a scavenger for almost six years. He travels around Denpasar every day to collect and buy used items. He starts with his bicycle in early morning. After getting some rest at noon, he starts again in the afternoon. He then brings everything he gathers to his place at jl. Wibisana Barat Denpasar. Once a week buyers come to his place to buy goods such as cans, boxes, newspapers, steels and others. His income per month can go up to 500,000 IDR, but it barely covers his daily expense and nothing is left for saving. Hence he really hopes that he be given working capital to improve his business. He hopes to save enough money for his child's education (Translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between IDR 9,000-9,500.00)

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Pekerjaan sebagai pemulung sudah dijalani oleh Istamar selama hampir 6 tahun. Sehari-harinya dia berkeliling seputaran Denpasar mencari dan membeli barang bekas. Mulai dari pagi dia sudah bekerja menggunakan sepeda dayungnya. Setelah beristirahat sebentar pada siang hari, sore harinya dia berkeliling lagi. Setelah itu dia mengumpulkan barang cariannya selama sehari dirumah tempat tinggalnya di Jl.Wibisana Barat Denpasar. Seminggu sekali pembeli akan datang kerumahnya untuk membeli barng bekas dan rongsokan miliknya seperti kaleng, kardus, koran, besi dan lain-lain. Penghasilan yang didapat selama sebulan bisa mencapai Rp.500.000, tetapi itu hanya cukup untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari, belum cukup untuk menabung. Oleh karena itu, dia sangat mengaharapkan diberi modal usaha, sehingga nantinya usahanya bisa lebih maju. Diharapkan dia bisa menabung untuk biaya pendidikan anaknya

loans.use: To add working capital

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo H. is 35 years old. She is divorced and has a son studying at school. Marhabo has never had anyone's assistance in helping her son get ahead. For five years, she has sold assorted products such as detergent and food items like macaroni, tea, sugar, etc. This has been her only income to support and educate her son, and it has not been easy for her to have the entire responsibility for her family. But her love for her son is what motivates her from day to day.

Marhabo is requesting a loan of 1500 Somoni ($450 US Dollars) that will be used to expand her selling goods and meet her clients' demand. She promises to return this amount in 6 months.

The well-being of this brave woman and her son is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of her business. They sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing goods for selling to increase the variety of goods sold.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is the wife of A. Rahman and has lived in Raiwind, Pakistan for the last 45 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her daughter makes embroidered dresses; her elder son is a government servant, while the next eldest works in a petrol pump. Her husband is a government servant. Sakina has a milk business, but she also does household work. She successfully concluded previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a new one to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Bashiran baji wants to buy an animal to resell; Zahida baji wishes to purchase a buffalo for her milk business; Sajida baji wants a loan for her embroidery business, while Parveen baji wishes to buy more products for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan whose funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Evodia

texts.en: Evodia N. is a Tanzanian woman who has run a cloth shop in Dar-es-Salaam  for more than three years now. Her shop is at Vituka, outside Kariakoo shopping city center. She purchases the items she sells from Kariakoo wholesale shops and re-sells to customers in the Vituka area. She wants to expand the shop inventory but her business capital is limited. She's requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 750 to boost her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying "pagnes" and cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto es una hombre de avanzada edad, por problemas de salud no puede dedicarse a sus labores como agricultor, sin embargo se las ingenió para establecer un negocio dentro de su comunidad, debido a la gran demanda de establecimiento de comida, instaló un pequeño restaurante, punto de encuentro de varios pobladores, los que agradecen a don Modesto por el local, que sirvió para estrechar lazos de amistad y compañerismo entre los vecinos.  Ahora Modesto desea que su negocio pueda ser más acogedor y por ello desea ambientarlo para que las personas puedan sentirse cómodas y a gusto con la atención del restaurante. Espera que podamos atender su necesidad y otorgarle la cantidad que necesita en calidad de préstamo, para la mejora de su negocio, y sobre todo para la mejora de su calidad de vida y la de su pareja.
texts.en:
Modesto is an older man. Because of health problems, he cannot do his work as a farmer. Nevertheless, he managed to establish a business within his community. Owing to the large demand for food establishments, he set up a small restaurant, a meeting spot for various inhabitants who are grateful to Mr. Modesto for the business, which serves to strengthen bonds of friendship and camaraderie among the neighbors. Now Mr. Modesto wants his business to be more welcoming and for this he wants to adapt it so that people can sit comfortably and feel at home with the restaurant service. He hopes that we can meet his need and grant him the amount that he needs in the form of a loan to improve his business and, above all, to improve his quality of life and that of his partner.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Setting up and adapting his small restaurant

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Fatuma I. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 4 children, between the ages of 14 and 20.

Fatuma has been running a mama lishe since 2007. A mama lishe (local restaurant or café) in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all-local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.

Fatuma works at the business for 9 to 12 hours a day, 6 days a week. She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to purchase ingredients for the food that she serves at her mama lishe such as chai (tea), vitafunwa (slightly sweetened poofy pancakes made of rice flour that is deep fried and are to die for!!), and supu ya kongoro (beef soup). Fatuma thanks you for her support!

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the food that she serves at her mama lishe

loans.name: Mumtaz Akhtar Manzoor Hussain Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz Akhtar baji is a 27-year-old lady and resides in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. Her husband's name is M. H., and he works in a factory. Mumtaz baji owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 30 years. Mumtaz baji’s brother also lives with her, and he has a motor bike rental business. He gives motor bikes on rent and charges people $2 per hour. Mumtaz baji is a seamstress and stitches clothes by charging $2 per dress. Her husband earns less income, and she shares her income with him so that he able to manage household expenses easily and doesn’t feel any pressure. She is applying for a loan to repair the motor bikes of her brother. 

She is a group leader of a few more member in her locality. Saira baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy another video game for her video game shop. Shumaila baji wants a loan to buy goats for her butcher shop. Samina baji wants a loan to buy wires for her electric shop. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to resell. Bashiran baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair motor bikes for rented motor bikes business

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.en:
Yuriy is married with two children. He sells bread and other bakery products at a small kiosk in Ordzhonikidze. His income is 3,000 UAH (1 UAH =~0.124USD) per month.

Yuriy has been in this business for 1 year only. He decided to start this particular business because bread and bakery products are always in demand. Yuriy’s business is successful because he tries to offer his clients a large variety of fresh products. Yuriy's business goal is to open a small food store.

Yuriy would like to get a loan to purchase more products for the holiday season. He hopes to increase sales and better provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy more bakery products

loans.name: El

texts.en: El S. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and child in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a wedding chef and can make about US$7 per day. Her husband (pictured here) is a police official and makes about US$3 per day. The couple hopes to use this loan to repair the leaking roof of their house.

loans.use: Repair of a leaking roof

loans.name: Tétévi

texts.fr:
Né en 1972 à Kpémé Mr  A. Tétévi est marié et père de 04 enfants. La pêche sur mer est son activité principale, activité qu’il exerce depuis 08 ans et qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. 

Depuis un certain temps la vétusté  de son matériel de travail ne fait que ralentir son activité  mettant ainsi sa famille en difficulté. Il sollicite un crédit pour l’achat de nouveaux filets de pêche. Il pourra ainsi redémarrer son activité et s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Kpémé, Mr. Tétévi A. is married and the father of four. Ocean fishing is his main work, which he has been doing for eight years. It enables him to provide for his family.

For some time now, the worn condition of his equipment does nothing but slow down his work, thus putting his family into difficulty. He is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets. He will then be able to restart his business and to take care of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es: Edelmira R. V., reside en Ahuachapán, a sus 57 años de edad vive únicamente con su esposo, el cuál junto a ella gozan de una excelente reputación como personas muy trabajadoras y responsables. Edelmira posee un negocio en el cuál se encarga de vender productos de primera necesidad tales como arroz, frijoles, aceites, jugos, etcétera. Así mismo vende en el mismo lugar productos hecho de barro como alcancías, cómales, cabe mencionar que cómales es un producto el cuál se realiza para cocinar las tortillas y es como una cacerola plana hecha de barro. Dicho negocio lo posee desde hace 29 años atrás. Edelmira desea obtener un préstamo a través del cuál pueda invertir mucho más en su negocio e incluir más productos elaborados con barro y productos de primera necesidad.  De esta manera espera poder aumentar sus ventas para poder mejorar la economía familiar.
texts.en:
Edelmira R. V., 57, lives in Ahuachapán with her husband, who along with her, enjoys an excellent reputation as a responsible and hardworking person. Edmelmira runs a business which sells staples such as rice, beans, oil, juice, etc, in addition to goods made of clay such as bowls or earthenware for the preparation of tortillas. She has run this business for 29 years, and is in search of a loan which she can use to invest in her business and provide greater variety in the goods that she already sells. This way she hopes to increase her sales and improve her family's economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina  inició el negocio por la necesidad de tener un ingreso extra que le permitiera apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijos, ya que con su sueldo no les alcanzaba.  Comenzó el negocio En Febrero de 1997, gracias a una compañera de trabajo que la invitó a una demostración de venta de cosméticos por catalogo de reconocida marca, lo cual le gustó mucho y comenzo a vender entre sus vecinas, amistades y compañeras de trabajo. Desde entonces le ha ido muy bien y en la actualidad organiza bingos con los mismos productos. 
 

Cada día han ido creciendo sus ventas gracias a que sus clientes siempre la recomiendan con otras personas a las cuales también puede venderles sus productos.


Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3500 para comprar productos para poder cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes y de esta manera darles un buen servicio para conservarlos.
texts.en:
Agustina started her business to gain extra income to help her husband with the household expenses and their children’s education. His salary did not cover all of their expenses. She started her business in February of 1997 thanks to a friend from work. The friend invited her to a demonstration on catalog selling of recognized brands of cosmetics. Augustina liked it very much, and she started to sell to her neighbors, friends and co-workers. Since then, it has gone very well for her, and now she organizes bingo games with the same products. Every day her sales have grown thanks to her customers who recommend her to other people who she can then sell to. She needs a loan for $250 (3500 MXN) to buy products to be able to fill her customers’ orders. This way she can give them good service and keep them as customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
T. Umar is 44 years old and is married with three children. Umar has been involved in the sale of spare parts for bicycles since 2004. Gradually the business expanded. Being hard-working and polite by nature, he has managed to obtain a clientele that is happy with the goods and the service. The income he derives allows him to provide for the family needs as he is the only bread-winner in the family.

Today Umar requests $800 for the term of 9 months. He is planning to spend the loan to purchase more spare parts for bicycles to increase his range of goods. Umar is counting on your help. He expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for bicycles to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Uqaota Group

texts.en:
Uqaota is the leader of the Uqaota group. There are four members in this group and each of them want to take a loan to expand their business. Uqaota wants to take a loan for her quilt making business. Qaduis wants to take a loan for a tailoring and animal husbandry business. Zhera wants to take a loan for an animal husbandry and agriculture business. Asaiu wants to take a loan for a fruit and vegetable business. 

They want to take a group loan for 42000 Afghanis for the term of ten months. They are all very happy to have this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand her quilt making business.

loans.name: Naún Efraín

texts.es: Naún Efraín B. B. reside en la colonia el Cimarrón en el departamento de La Libertad. Su grupo familiar está constituido por un hijastro y su compañera de vida, la cual se dedica a vender zapatos y a hacer pupusas (comida típica salvadoreña), de esta manera ella le ayuda a su esposo con ciertos gastos del hogar. Naún posee una tienda frente a la escuela el Cimarrón, es así como el se gana la vida y obtiene el dinero necesario para mantener su hogar junto a su esposa. El solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda aumentar el inventario de su negocio, ya que cuando los niños de la escuela salen de clases compran en su tienda, circunstancia que le incentiva a seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Naún Efraín B. B. lives in the Cimarrón residential development in La Libertad Department. His family is made up of his wife and stepson. Naún's wife sells shoes and makes pupusas (a typical Salvadorian dish) in order to help him with household expenses. Naún earns a living and helps his wife support the family with his store, located across the street from the El Cimarrón School. He is requesting a loan that will allow him to increase his inventory, since when children get out of school they come right to his store. This is what motivates him to keep moving forward with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new products for store

location.town: El Cimarrón, Departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Eshpulot

texts.en: K. Eshpulot is the married father of three children. He produces tomatoes and cucumbers which he plants once a year. His wife is a teacher in a local school. To help meet the hard physical labor of his farming work, one of his elder children is working with him. Rice growing is his main source of earning income to sustain his family’s living conditions. Eshpulot is applying for a loan to buy seed and fertilizer. This fund will ensure the economic prosperity of this friendly family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Los Montones: Group 2

texts.en: Dinorah D. L. C. is the coordinator for a group of five women seeking to take out a loan. She is married with eight children, ranging in age from 14 to 35. She makes her living selling bedspreads and cushions. Dinorah plans to use her loan to buy better materials to improve the quality of her product and grow her business. She has taken out multiple loans in the past, but this will be her biggest loan yet.

loans.use: More and higher quality business inputs, such as fabric to make bedspreads

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is the hardworking wife of Teofilo C.. They help each other in making their rice farming business productive. She is already 56 years old but still strong enough to till their field. 

Due to the lack of financial capital, Rebecca wants to borrow a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP14,000. She will utilize the loan in purchasing fertilizer that is really needed for their rice crops to grow and develop full rice grains. Rebecca and her husband are working very hard at farming in order to uplift their poor living conditions. Also, they want to give their children a better future through education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto García tiene 45 años. Vive en su propia casa. En un hombre muy luchador que le gusta mucho el trabajo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de salón de belleza. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que el inicia desde muy joven ya que no tenía un medio de ingresos para su familia, el un hombre responsable y disfruta mucho su trabajo ya que muchos clientes conversan con él mientras realiza su trabajo. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ciertos productos para su salon. El sueño de Jorge es poder mantener su actividad económica para brindar a sus clientes una excelente atención.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto García is 45 years old and lives in his own home. He is a hardworking gentleman who enjoys his job. He offers personal grooming services at a beauty salon and has been in business for more than 16 years. He started working at a young age because his family did not have much money. Sr. Jorge is a responsible person. He likes his work so much because he has many customers who chat with him while he is working.

He is requesting a loan is to purchase products for his salon. His dream is to continue his business and provide his clients with excellent service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena O. is married and has two children. He has received junior high school education.

Kwabena sells arts and crafts at Coconut Grove in Elmina, which he has done for eight years now. Kwabena uses his income to pay housekeeping and utility bills and his children’s school fees. He will use the loan to purchase more crafts to sell.

With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwabena plans to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more crafts to sell

loans.name: Alofa

texts.en:
Alofa T., a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Saasaai, is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Alofa runs a general store selling both food and daily use products in her community. Alofa has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2009, Alofa (01012003-03) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD that was used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business, Alofa is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST. This loan will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Alofa's second loan from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a general store

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Nuestro socio se llama Genaro, este socio pertenece al banco comunal, líderes del tercer milenio, nuestro socio es natural de Iscuchaka en el distrito de Anta, y reside en la misma ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 39 años de edad, es soltero y alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista, nuestro socio vende libros en ferias, casa, instituciones  y las da tanto al crédito como al contado, este viene siendo su trabajo formal y ya lleva muchos años con este negocio. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio y parte de ello hacer uso personal.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Genaro belongs to the community bank 'Lideres del tercer milenio' (leaders of the third millenium). He comes from Iscuchaka in the district of Anta, and lives in the city of Cusco. Genaro is 39 years of age, single and as well as being a commercial retailer, he also sells books for cash and credit in fairs, institutions and his own house. This is his formal occupation and he has spent many years in this profession. He is applying for a loan to reinvest in his business and to use part of it for personal use. Genaro is thankful for this valuable loan and is committed to making his repayments at the allocated times.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma O. is an independent woman who is 56 years old. She lost her husband a long time ago and all of her children are working in Manila and have their own families now.

Aside from her intention of having the opportunity to obtain a loan to be able to put up a business, Norma joined ASHI in 2008 because she wanted to meet a lot of people, make friends, and be able to belong to the association of women that has a common goal in life, which is to rise above poverty. Her capacity and courage in running a business all by herself was inspired by her fellow women in ASHI.

After having started her small business through a loan she had requested, now Norma is requesting a much larger loan which will enable her to grow her motorcycle-for-hire business. With the amount she is requesting she plans to purchase a sidecar to be attached to her motorcycle to make it a tricycle-for-hire business.

For Norma, her business is her life, and the loan she obtains is her source of life. This has been her support to be able to buy her food and live independently. She wants her children not to be bothered about her and she wants to live her live productively by helping her children and grandchildren someday.

loans.use: To buy sidecar for her motorcycle

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria R. is a 72-year-old married woman from the village of Manticao. To make a living, Victoria owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. More specifically, she makes and sells food -- primarily snacks and other delicacies for her local community members. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years, and she earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services and to thereby improve her living situation as well as her ability to engage in business activities. Victoria is now requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 PHP ($100), which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make foods to sell to her customers. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Victoria through HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated as a result of this loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City, and it reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional raw ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
La señora Jacqueline, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años y es madre de 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Jacqueline, lleva 15 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo implementar su taller de confección de vestidos y teniendo habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa.
Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de vestidos y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Jacqueline, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Jacqueline belongs to the Community Bank "Sargento Lores" in the district of Morales, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. She is single, 41 years old, and the mother of one son who is still dependent on her.

Jacqueline has been making dresses for 15 years, little by little she has been generating her own income and saving her money, wanting to start up her own dressmaking shop. Having the skill for sewing, there is no doubt that she can do it, and with the support of Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she decided to set up her own business located in her own house. She tells the MFI that her sales are going well, and she works with orders from her customers in advance.

Currently, she continues with her dressmaking, and has a faithful clientele that come to her house daily to place their orders. She personally attends them with the kindness that characterizes her. With this loan of 800 soles, she will buy fabric of different kinds in meters, instruments that she uses as scissors, sewing needles and for the sewing machine, pins, and buttons.

Nowadays, Jacqueline, feels like a very fulfilled woman, with desires to reach and make the rest of her dreams a reality. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Manuela Ramos Movement) for helping her start her business and also to the many woman who want to grow from a business perspective.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing materials

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan M. is 44 years old and a grocery seller. Nan M. has been selling her goods since early 2005 and normally earns US$ 2.50 a day to feed her family. She is married with four children, all four of whom are no longer in school. All four of her children are employed: two are workers in Malaysia and one is a garment worker in Phnom Penh.

As another source of family income, her husband’s business provides a taxi service. Nan M. is taking out her loan to accumulate more grocery inventory to sell and to repair her old house. Note: Nan M.'s was not available when the photo was taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To accumulate more grocery inventory to sell and to repair her old house

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas C., 37, is from the village of San Manuel. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Felicitas owns and operates a service-based business, primarily hairdressing and beauty services to local community residents.  Felicitas has been in business for over 11 years.

Felicitas joined ASKI to access financial services, improve her living situation and engage in business.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI.  Felicitas is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP  to purchase needed materials to provide customer services.  Felicitas plans to use additional revenue to support her family. 
--------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to provide services.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is 25 years old and single without children. She is a part-time student in a higher institution. She is ambitious and hard working. She sells rechargeable phone cards and she also makes calls in her community in Benin City, Edo state. She also sells women's clothes in various sizes. Blessing went into business in order to support herself to pay her school fees, settle her bills, and take care of her younger ones. She needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards and clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable phone cards and clothes to sell

loans.name: Oldemar

texts.es:
Oldemar U. F., tiene la edad de 22 años, es soltero. Vive con sus padres y seis hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para la cría de gallinas ponedoras y pollos de engorde.También, desea construir los encierros para las gallinas y otros arreglos a la granja. Con esta inversión el espera crecer en su negocio y poder aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su situación económica. Es la primera vez que don oldemar se financia con FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y que le brindaron muchas facilidades a la hora de solicitar el crédito. 
El espera que con este proyecto poder fortalecer su negocio aumentando la producción y aumentando las ventas, para así ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Oldemar U. F. is 22 years old and single. He lives with his parents and six siblings. He is requesting the loan to raise laying hens and chickens. He also wishes to construct a chicken coop and other arrangements on the farm. With this investment, he hopes to grow his business and be able to increase his income so he can improve his economic situation. This is the first time Oldemar has been financed by Kiva partner FUDECOSUR, and he tells us that the credit committee has greatly helped him and provided him many facilities when applying for the loan. He hopes that this project will strengthen his business and increase his sales, thus offering his family a better quality of life and more economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase laying hens and chickens

loans.name: Om

texts.en:
Mrs. Om D. is a humble villager who lives in Battambang Province. She is 38 years old and has established her own small family with other members. She is married to Savouth, age 48, who assists her in the business, and they help each other to care for two children who are students in the local public school. 

Om D. owns a simple shop next to her house where she sells different kinds of vegetables, for which she earns a profit. Om D. needs a loan to mend and decorate her old house because it is breaking down.

loans.use: To mend and decorate her old house

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith tiene 39 años, es una responsable madre que vive con su pareja y sus 4 hijos; 2 de los cuales ya son independientes económicamente y la ayudan en el hogar. Toda la familia vive junta en su casa propia.

Su negocio es una bodega que instaló muy cerca de su vivienda, esto gracias a su esfuerzo y al de su familia para juntar el capital necesario para su implementación. Desde entonces, todos apoyan para que el negocio salga adelante, reemplazando a Judith cuando tiene que salir a comprar mercadería. Ella se siente satisfecha con su trabajo, pues le arroja buenas ganancias y puede cubrir los gastos de su hogar, además tiene la ventaja de poder realizarlo junto a las personas que más quiere. La parte difícil del negocio radica en tener que trasladarse de su casa a su bodega, pues para llegar a ella debe subir una gran pendiente arenosa donde está ubicado su establecimiento. 

Este es el primer crédito de Judith con MFP y promete ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar más productos para surtir su tienda y por ende conseguir más clientela.
texts.en:
Judith is 39 years old, and is a responsible mother who lives with her spouse and four children, two of whom are already economically independent and help her in the home. The whole family lives together in their own home.

Her business is a store that was built very close to her home, made possible thanks to her efforts and those of her family who helped mount the necessary capital to build it. Since then, everyone supports her so that her business can move forward, and they cover for Judith when she has to go out to purchase more merchandise.

She feels satisfied with her work, as she is able to save her earnings and cover the costs of her home. In addition, she has the advantage of running it with the people she loves most. The difficult part of running her business is that she has to climb a large, sandy slope to get to the establishment.

This is Judith's first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with all of her repayments. With the money she seeks, she wants to buy more products to stock her store and thus obtain more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with a son. She lives in Melitopol and runs her small business selling imitation jewelry in one of the local markets. She started her business two years ago and presently, she has 25,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 7,500 Grivnyas and her net profit is about 3,500 Grivnyas a month.

Natalya is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to increase her working capital and diversify the assorted merchandise she offers for sale. She is hoping to continue developing her business and keep her merchandise in demand. She can be characterized as a solvent borrower with a good credit history.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise operates her electronics shop in Ndunyu Njeru, which is a rural town in Kenya.  Her stock of electronics consists of basic electrical goods and cheap ones to cater to her client base.  She sells mobile phones, mobile phones spare parts, and other goods, like radios and TV sets, all for the low-end target market. She is 37 years old and married to James Mbugua. They have three school-going children. 

She was introduced to KADET by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to buy more mobile phone spare parts to stock her shop. In the future, she plans to expand her shop and be a major supplier of electronic goods in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phone spare parts to sell

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es: La señora Salome tiene 30 años de edad es casada. Ella tiene una tienda de consumo diario, vende maiz frijol gaseosas, galletas y helados, trabaja actualmente porque aun tiene hijos pequeños por quien luchar. Ella esta solicitando el credito para abrir un nuevo negocio cerca de su casa ya que obtuvo ganancias del credito anterior y aparte de eso tiene un molino de nixtamal. Ella sueña con tener una abarroteria en el futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. Salome is 30 years old and married. She has a store where she sells daily consumer products such as corn, beans, sodas, cookies, and ice cream. Salome currently works because she has three small children for whom she struggles to support.

She is requesting a new loan to open a new business next to her house. Her previous loan resulted in earnings and she now has a corn mill. Salome’s dream is to have a small grocery store in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas, candy, and corn for her new business

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet R., from the town of Centro Sur, Alcala, Cagayan, is the 43-year-old leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Juliet, who is married and has five school-aged children, owns and operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She is just starting this business.

Juliet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Siga Thiuombou

texts.fr: Siga Thioumbou D. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de NDONDOL  depuis le 25 juin 2002 et y a bénéficié de 15 prêts qu’elle a toujours bien gérés. Elle est détentrice d’une cantine où elle vend des produits laitiers, du sucre, du riz et de l’huile végétale. Elle fait parallèlement de l’embouche ovine. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter 10 paires de moutons et approvisionner sa cantine. Elle participe à la nourriture et au maintien de la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
Siga Thioumbou D. is a 38-year old woman who is married and mother to five children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in NDONDOL since 25th June 2002 and has had 15 loans, all of which she has managed well. She has a canteen where she sells dairy products, sugar, rice and vegetable oil. At the same time she has a sheep fattening activity. With her new loan she is going to buy 10 pairs of sheep and stock up her canteen. She contributes to food expenses and to covering her children's health costs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her investment level in order to carry out her activity

loans.name: Freddy De La Cruz

texts.es:
Freddy de 35 años de edad, es casado con la Sra. Mayra Hurtado con quien procreo 2 niños: Freddy de 13 años que esta en 5to grado de primaria y Noe de 4 añitos. Don Freddy trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 1 año, desempeñandose como  ayudante de albañil. 

Por esfuerzo propio logro construir un cuarto en su casa para mayor comodidad de su familia, sin embargo aun le falta poner el techo y el piso por lo que esta solicitando  su 1er credito para comprar el zinc, perlines, cemento, arena y piedrin para al fin terminar el cuarto para su familia.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder ver su casa bonita y que su familia cuente con las condiciones necesarias para vivir comodos.
texts.en:
Freddy is 35 years old, married to Mrs. Mayra Hurtado and they have 2 children: Freddy, 13 years old, a 5th grade student, and Noe who is 4. Don Freddy has been working for the Office of the Municipal Mayor of Juigalpa for 1 year as an assistant building worker.

With his own effort he succeeded in building a room at his house for more comfort for his family, nevertheless it is still missing the roof and the flooring, reason why he is requesting his first loan to buy zinc, purlins, cement, sand, and gravel in order to finish building the room for his family.

It is his dream to have a pretty house and give his family the necessary conditions to live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building a room

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia J. is from the village of Banga, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 35 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living Venancia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food and daily use products in the local community. Venancia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Venancia joined HSPFI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venancia is requesting her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Mrs. Esterlita R. is from Barangay Pulot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years of age and married. She is blessed with 6 children, all of whom are still single, in their teens and school aged. To make a living, she is presently engaged in snack vending, particularly rice cakes or “bibingka” in local terms and in direct sales of AVON Beauty products. She’s been engaged in this business for 1 year already and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from this business activity. 

In the month of January 2010, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 Php. This time she is requesting a loan of 7000 Php as her 2nd loan to be used for the additional capital for her “bibingka” vending and AVON Products direct sales activity. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, insurance, children’s education, and possible house repairs. 

About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice cake "bibingka" vending and AVON Products direct sales business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
M. John is 40 years old and runs a formidable business venture in the form of a general store in Ikoba trading centre, Kyenjojo. This business enables him to earn money to meet his daily needs.
It is always difficult for many people in this area to settle and create their own livings. This leads many to spend time drinking alcohol and gambling. However John is different. His economic obligations and responsibility to his seven children and family have made him settle for business.
John used the small capital from his previous transportation business to start his retail shop, which now brings in 120,000 UGX monthly. He is seeking a loan to expand his business by purchasing more stock since there is ready market from customers. He is also looking at setting up a fuel pump station when he gets enough capital in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Badegna I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Badegna I sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, en moyenne 3 enfants et qui vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Maban, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, l’arachide, le fonio et le haricot. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, ARATA D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare de petit mil, d’arachide et du fonio.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA environ par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group Badgena I are married women with an average age of 42 years, an average of 3 children, and most of them live in polygamous families in Maban, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activities during the rainy season. They grow, among other things, pearl millet, peanuts, fonio, and beans. This will be their sixth seasonal loan and all of their previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Arata D. hopes to buy fertilizer, small farming equipment, and pay for labor costs to maintain about 1 hectare of pearl millet, peanuts, and folio. The harvested crops are sold in the towns of Dioïla and Massigui to a client base composed of both men and women. The women hope to make an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA per season.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, provincia y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Fernando; el tiene 42  años de edad y es viudo  tiene 2 Hijos; El socio es natural de Anta y alterna sus actividades diarias con el comercio minorista,  ella vende cochinilla (sirve para usar en el teñido de lanas); desde hace 14 años. El socio es solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cochinilla para la venta.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This gentleman is part of the “Mi Peru” communal bank, located in the Santiago district of the Cusco province and department. Fernando is 42 years old and is a widower with two children. He is originally from Anta and has been working in his small business daily; selling cochinilla (an insect used for dying wool) for 14 years. He is asking for this loan so that he can invest in cochinilla for resale. He is grateful to those who are helping him fulfill his dreams through this medium and is committed to making his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen lives in the historic city of Lahore, Pakistan, famous for its gardens and culture. She lives in a little house with her brother and 18-year-old daughter. She is a 45-year-old widow. She couldn’t complete her education because her mother didn’t have enough resources to afford it. Parveen sells clothes to put three daily meals on the table for her family. She started this business after her husband’s death few years ago. It was a very difficult time for her but she never gave up.  Her daughter does embroidery, and her brother sells costume jewelry in his shop at the nearby market.
 
Parveen has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy more clothes for selling. Her daughter is near marrying age, and it is Parveen’s responsibility to marry her. She is hopeful that with the increased profit of her business she will collect the dowry and marry her daughter. This is her first loan and she hopes that it will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for reselling.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 59 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí, sus hijos ya se encuentran disipados. La zona en donde vive es tranquila y apacible, la mayor parte de sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario a precios cómodos y con un buen trato. Esto le ha hecho conocida en la zona y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que prefieren su establecimiento. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad se encarga de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que puedan ampliar sus ventas y percibir un mayor número de ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Rosa es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Santos is 69 years old and she lives together with her family in the district of Pacasmayo, it is located in a province by the same name. It is located in the region of La Libertad, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked for more than thirty years in the sale of plastic goods, selling from a store located in the exterior section of the small market in the city where she lives. She works every day from the very early morning hours. Thanks to the years she has had in this business she has a well established client base that always come to her business to purchase what they need. Santos wishes to expand her business by adding new merchandise to put on sale. She will be able to have a greater variety of products to offer the clients and her sales will increase. In order to meet her objective she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. She is a very reserved person and she is always ready to help anyone in need. She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past and she has always demonstrated responsibility in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery store items.

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en: Nafisa M. has no educational background. She is married and takes care of six dependents. Nafisa sells cassava, plantains, and cooks 'banku' (fermented corn dough) and sells rice as well at Abura. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to buy more of her goods for sale. She plans on reinvesting her profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy more of her goods for sale

loans.name: Heoung

texts.en: Heoung S., 39, is married and lives with her husband and five young children in Takeo province. Since 2005, she and her husband have been selling vegetables in the local market and make about US$5 of profit every day. Heoung S. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Segundo Rodrigo

texts.es:
Segundo Rodrigo M. C. tiene 36 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Segundo pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo y comprar casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Segundo Rodrigo M. C. is 36 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province. He has 6 children.

Segundo belongs to the Guantucoto communal bank located a half hour from Guaranda, it is a group focussed on farming and livestock, especially the sowing of corn and potatoes in the mountain area, and rice in the coastal area. This group has 25 members.

Segundo has been farming for several years, sowing corn and potato, in addition he raises animals and cattle to later sell. He buys them in Guaranda and sells them in the main market of that city.

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies for sowing corn and potato. This loan would help him financially to supply the necessities for his family. They face challenges such as pests and disease in the crops. His dream is to buy a vehicle and a house.
He likes to play sport.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for sowing corn and potatoes

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” ubicado en el distrito Cabanilla,  provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 01 hijo independiente, la señora estudió hasta 5to de educación primaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, nos cuenta que su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de animales caseros.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar ovejas.

Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque intercambian palabras entre todas las socias.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women) community bank which is located in Cabanilla district, in Lampa province, in the department of Puno.  She is 52 years old, married, and has 1 grown-up child.  She studied up to the 5th year of elementary school.

María has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 3 years.  She tells us that her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used it to increase the working capital of her business selling domestic animals.

She is requesting a new loan for 1,000 nuevos soles to buy sheep.

Her dream for the future is to improve her business.

What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings because all the members talk to each other.

loans.use: To invest in buying sheep

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa Q., es casada tiene 28 años de edad y dos hijos los que aun estudia, su esposo trabaja por su propia cuenta vendiendo verduras, le ayuda  con los gastos de su casa. Josefa vende artesanias  como ropa  típica cortes, Güipiles y blusas. Empezó  a vender en el mercado durante tres meses luego se traslado al mercado municipal de su localidad  su sueño es poner su negocio en un local ya que vende afuera del mercado y poder contar con los mismos ingresos para ayudar a su esposo y a sus hijos, desea ahora trabajar con un crédito individual y espera se le dé la oportunidad.
texts.en: Josefa Q. is 28, married, and has two children who are in school.  Her husband works on his own selling vegetables and she helps him with the household expenses.  Josefa sells handicrafts such as typical clothing, dresses, huipiles (traditional native embroidered tunics) and blouses.  She started selling at the market three months ago and then switched to the municipal market in her town.  Her dream is to have a stand for her business now that she sells away from the market and to be able to count on the same earnings to help her husband and children.  She hopes to have her own loan and is waiting for the opportunity.

loans.use: Sale of handicrafts, such as various types of typical clothing

loans.name: Mgandi

texts.en:
Mgandi is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 


He has a goat meat selling business, selling to his neighbours and at the market to market goers. In addition he operates a retail shop, which contributes to his income. Mgandi faces a major challenge in theft and drought in his business. He hopes to open a butcher shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase goats  for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 38 años, vive en la casa de su madre al lado de ella y de sus  2 hijos menores; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante en busca del progreso. Esta empeñosa mujer se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, de manera ambulatoria, en las calles de un paradero muy concurrido. Esta muy satisfecha con su labor pues la desempeña de lunes a sábado, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, y tiene muy buenas ganancias por lo que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Además se dedica a la venta de ropa, que deja a crédito, y también comercializa útiles escolares; dice que su labor es por temporadas, es por esta razón que no tiene un trabajo estable.
