Solo le disgusta que tiene que soportar las inclemencias del tiempo, y durante la temporada de invierno comercializa trozos de caña de azúcar que ella misma fabrica en unas bolsas, de esta manera siempre esta en busca de ganar dinero para sustentar a su familia. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un negocio fijo para lograr sacar a su familia adelante. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Elizabeth tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en ropa, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes y espera concretarlos para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 38, lives in her mother’s house with her mother and her two minor children.  Together they put forth great effort every day to get ahead in the search for progress.  This enterprising woman sells soft drinks in an itinerant manner.  She sells on the streets of a very busy bus stop.  

She is very satisfied with her work.  She works from Monday through Saturday from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has very good earnings, and she has managed to get her family ahead.  She also sells clothes on credit, and she sells school supplies.  Her work is seasonal, which is why she does not have stable work.

The only thing she does not like is having to put up with inclement weather.  During the winter season she sells pieces of sugar cane in bags that she makes herself.  She is always looking for ways to earn money to support her family.  As she is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to establish a steady business in order to manage to get her family ahead.

This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time.  She does not want to disappoint the people who make this loan possible.  The loan will allow her to continue working in the search of progress.  Elizabeth plans to use the requested loan to buy clothing merchandise because she has several pending orders.  She plans to fill them in order to improve her earnings.

loans.use: Stock up on more clothing to fill her customers' orders

loans.name: Aligda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aligda de 28 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, ella es soltera, vive con sus padres. El negocio se fundó por iniciativa propia hace 5 años, atendiendo todos los días a su granja desde las 5:00am hasta el atardecer, ya que este oficio es de todo el día, por el momento todo marcha bien en el negocio y ha decidido comprar más cerdos para la crianza, por lo que solicita un préstamo para adquirir tres cerdos aumentando su granja y con la oportunidad de recibir mejores ganancias en un futuro.
Con este préstamo crecerá su negocio y estará más motivada para cuidar y alimentar los cerdos, trabajando arduamente para lograr sus objetivos y metas que son establecerse con una granja grande y rentable de cerdos, ayudando a sus padres cubriendo gastos que demanda el hogar.
texts.en:
Álgida, 28, lives in El Transito, Morazán department.  She is a pig merchant. She is single and lives with her parents.  She started the business on her own initiative five years ago.  She tends to her farm every day from 5am until nightfall since this is an all-day occupation.  For the time being, everything is going well in the business and she has decided to buy more pigs to raise so needs a loan in order to buy three pigs to increase her farm’s size thus providing the possibility of higher profits in the future.

This loan will make her business grow and she’ll be more motivated to care for and feed the pigs working hard to reach her goals and objectives which are to establish a large, profitable pig farm to help her parents meet household expenses.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married. He is a small business entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Mykola offers transportation services in Ukraine. He works as a taxi driver and also offers long-distance rides. Mykola started his business four years ago. Presently, his monthly income amounts to 4,000 UAH. 

The business is the main source of income for Mykola’s family. Mykola is seeking a 6,000 UAH loan to do major repairs to his car's engine. Its mileage is high; therefore, the engine needs to be repaired for continued operation. One of Mykola’s long-term plans is to save enough money to be able to purchase his own housing one day.

loans.use: Repair car engine

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud A. is a talented young man from Gaza City in Gaza Strip. He studied making perfumes and scents and started his own small shop. Mahmoud produces different scents and perfumes according to his customers' tastes.

Mahmoud requested a loan from FATEN to purchase basic ingredients to make more perfumes and scents to attract more clients. He is photographed in his small store.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and scents ingredients

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha Patricia G. Pérez  es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada de 37 años ella desde hace 5 años tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio con la venta de chivería, además vende licor sellado. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en granos básicos, carne y licor.
texts.en:
Martha Patricia G. Pérez, age 37, is a hardworking and determined woman. She has managed a small store for five years. Martha started out selling yogurt and then liquor.

She will invest her loan in basic grains, meat, and liquor.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meat, and liquor to sell in her store

loans.name: Gerbacio

texts.es: El señor Gerbacio, es maestro albañil, y trabaja a contrato, el crédito lo necesita para la compra de material de construcción como ser: cemento, estuco, arena, vigas. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto; es viudo y tiene cuatro hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy contento con los créditos que se le otorgaron y mejoro la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gerbasio is a master mason who works on contract. He needs the loan to buy construction materials such as cement, stucco, sand, and beams. This business is his source of income for covering his family’s expenses. He lives in his own house, which is located in the Villa Ingenio neighborhood of the city of El Alto. He is a widower and has four children. He has been very happy with the loans he has been granted, as they have improved his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, stucco, sand, and beams, to finish a work contract

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio nació en la histórica ciudad del Cusco y tiene 42 años de edad. Actualmente, Antonio vive en la misma ciudad donde nació donde la gente es amigable y alegre, él es una padre trabajador que saca adelante a sus tres hijos, él trabaja en una agencia de viajes de turismo y está encargado de recoger a los turismo, da información acerca de la tuor a los turistas, lleva a los hoteles a los turistas y otras cosa más. Ya son 10 años que trabaja en la agencia y le ha ido muy bien. Antonio en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal desea comprar ropa para sus hijos y otras cosas mas.  

Antonio es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Puntualito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Antonio was born in the historic city of Cusco and is 42 years old. He currently lives in the same city where he was born, where the people are friendly and happy. He is a hardworking father who helps his three children to get ahead. He works in a travel agency, where he is in charge of picking up tourists, giving them information on the tours offered, bringing them to hotels, and other things. He has been working at the travel agency for 10 years already and it is going very well.

At this time, Antonio needs a loan for personal use. He would like to buy clothing for his children and some other things.

Antonio is a responsible person who belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Puntualito" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy clothing for his children and some other things

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: La Sra. Leonor vive en la zona sur entre 5to. Anillo desde hace 10 años, ella se dedica a la venta de libros nuevos, enciclopedias, atlas, diccionarios, libros infantiles, escolares, al contado y a crédito. La Sra. Leonor se dedica a esta actividad junto a su esposo desde hace 5 años. Tienen 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. El crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar más libros que están llegando y así poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. La Sra. Leonor  es trabajadora, responsable con los compromisos que asume, su meta al igual que la de su esposo es la superación de su familia para para darles una buena educación y que sean profesionales sus hijos, la Sra. esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Leonor has been living in the southern area of the 5th Ring for 10 years. She engages in selling new books, encyclopedias, atlases, dictionaries, children’s books and school books, and she accepts cash and credit. Leonor has been running this activity together with her husband for 5 years. They have 2 children who go to school. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more books in order to carry out all of her customers’ requests. Leonor is a hardworking woman, and she responsibly undertakes her commitments. Her goal, as well as her husband’s, is the growth of her family, by giving a good education to their children so that they will be able to become skilled professionals. Leonor is thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy more books.

loans.name: Pelelina

texts.en:
Pelelina is 32 years of age and married with nine children. Pelelina owns & operates a business planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Pelelina needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase weed killer, gromozone and sacks of fertilizers to improve the business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to improve/expand the business.

Pelelina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Pelelina's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killer, gromozone and sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Ddmashen village, an area of Sevan, where he has his own farm. On that farm he grows potatoes and breeds farm animals such as cows, calves, sheep, pigs and chickens. Thanks to his farming profit, Armen supports his big family, which consists of his parents, his wife and his three children.
 
Armen is 34 years old and he has been engaged in farming for over 12 years. 

This is his second loan from Nor Horizon, and now he needs a 600,000 AMD loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Kibii

texts.en:
Kibii is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya where he has been farming for 10 years. He sells his milk on the local market. He also earns additional income from his small-scale farming of tea. 

Kibii is 37 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school.

He has requested a loan of 36,634 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will enable him to meet his family's basic needs and expand his farming activities. His major challenges have been the poor transport network to the market and lack of enough land to plant grass and pasture. He would like to improve his farming activities in future by constructing a good dairy unit and increase the number of his dairy cows for increased milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora una mujer entusiasta de 41 años, reside en el caserío de Llanco. Ahí vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia, donde cuida y educa con mucho amor y cariño. Como mujer emprendedora, ella se siente orgullosa de poder ser la cabeza de su familia. La mayor parte de sus días la pasa cuidando a sus hijos y trabajando en su terreno donde siembra papa y verduras, por lo que tiene 20 años realizando la misma tarea. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver como se desarrollan sus frutos, de ello depende para vender toda  la producción, que normalmente los ofrece en el mercado de su ciudad. Como mujer trabajadora administra muy bien su dinero, pues su meta es  comprar hectáreas de tierras para poder sembrar papa y verduras, así tendrá como abastecer a sus clientes que normalmente tiene en la capital, ya que es ahí donde viaja a ofrecer su producción. Actualmente esta llevando técnicas para aumentar sus ventas. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda cumplir con su propósito de comprar terrenos agrícolas y así obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan brindarles a sus hijos la calidad de vida que se merecen. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los ángeles de llanco” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Nora de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus sembríos, y así obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Nora is an enthusastic 41 year old woman.  She lives in Llanco, a rural community.  She lives with her husband and their four children in her own house.  That is where she raises and educates her children with a lot of love and affection.  As an enterprising woman, she is proud to be able to be the head of her family.  She spends the greater part of the day taking care of her children and working her land.  She has been growing potatoes and vegetables for 20 years.

What she likes the most about her work is being able to see how the plants develop.  Selling all of her productions depends upon the growth of her plants.  She usually sells in the market in her city.  As a hard-working woman, she manages her money very well.  

Her goal is to buy hectares of land in order to be able to plant potatoes and vegetables.  That way she will have stock for the customers she usually has in the capital.  That is where she travels to sell her production.  She is currently employing techniques to increase her sales.  Therefore, she hopes for support from each one of you so that she can carry out her proposal of buying farmland.  That way she will get greater income, which will allow her to provide her children with the quality of life that they deserve.

She belongs to the Los Ángeles de Llanco Communal Bank.  This is her seventh loan with MFP.  She hopes to get a small loan in order to meet her objectives.  She pledges, once again, to make all of her payments as she has done with the previous loans she has had.  It pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  She will use the requested money to buy sacks of organic fertilizer to spread amongst her plants.  That way she will get a good production.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 32 years old.  She is married to Dominic and they are blessed with two children, ages 12 and 9. She has been running a hair salon for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 60,000, which she uses to support her family members.

Salome is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after having successfully repaid the previous loans. Salome will use the new loan to add stock and equipment to her salon: hair pieces, a blow dryer and a water heater. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her children up to their comfort level. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open other hair salon branches in different towns, creating a source of employment for society, and to improve the living standard for her family.

loans.use: buy hair pieces, a blow dryer and a water heater

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es: El señor Braulio es chofer y trabaja con su taxi en el área de transporte público de pasajeros. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (estuco, pintura, arena) ya que realizara la refacción de una habitación. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Central de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva, debido al excelente historial de pagos.
texts.en: Braulio is a driver who provides a passenger transport service with his taxi.  He needs this loan to buy building supplies (plaster, paint and sand) as he would like to refurbish a room in his home.  He lives in his own home which is located in the central district of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has four children.  This is the second time that his loan has been funded via Kiva owing to his excellent payment record.

loans.use: to buy plaster, paint, sand, etc. to refurbish a room in his home

loans.name: Math

texts.en: Ms. Math is a 30-year-old single woman who lives in Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh with her relatives.   She has been selling clothes in the market for several years, but recently started a business in which she sells shoes.  In this business she can earn about $10 per day.  She would like to request a loan to purchase additional shoes for sale.  With her additional income, she will help to support the daily needs of her relatives.

loans.use: to purchase additional new shoes for sales.

loans.name: Djekafo Vii Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe DJEKAFO VII sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et  en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Konfon, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, LALA SALIF, qui est assise au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Klè, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of DJEKAFO VII are married women. They are on a average 41 years old and have an average of 6 children each. For the most part they live in polygamous families in Konfon, one of the villages in the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative district of Mali.

They are working with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they grow are, among others, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. With the loan, Lala Salif, seated, in the middle, plans to buy inputs, small equipment and to pay for plowing and hoeing costs in order to maintain about 0.5 hectare of rice and groundnuts. After the harvest, the crops are sold at the Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou markets to customers who are both men and women.

The group members expect to make an average profit of 20,000 CFA francs each season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, weedkiller, hoeing and small equipment.

loans.name: Merlin

texts.en:
Merlin, age 53, operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five Philippine pesos' worth worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Merlin earns her living by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. 

Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every day. She lives on Pasay City. Her husband Pedro works overseas. Merlin manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Merlin hopes to be able to grow her business soon, as she also hopes to live a peaceful life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es:
Ángel, vive con su hija y nietos, su hija tiene 30 años y sus nietos 6 y 3 años de edad, Ángel se dedica a atender un chalet desde hace 15 años, en dicho negocio ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, ropa y accesorios, se ubica en el parque central de la ciudad.
Ella comprara ropa, zapatos, camisas y jeans, por medio de un préstamo, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar el servicio a los clientes y generar más ganancias.
Para Ángel como madre, le gusta mantener siempre lo necesario en el hogar y apoyar a su hija en todo lo necesario, al igual que sus nietos.
texts.en:
Angel lives with her daughter and her grandchildren. Her daughter is 30 years old and her grandchildren are 6 and 3. For the last 15 years she has had a store in a villa located in the central park of the city. She sells staples, clothes and accessories. 

With the loan she will buy clothes, shoes, shirts and jeans. The investment will help her improve the service to her customers and generate more profits. As a mother, Angel likes to always have what's needed at home and to support her daughter and grandchildren in everything they need.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, shirts and jeans for her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama makes palm oil in Abura to sell. She is single but has ten dependents that she is taking care of. The demands of her dependents keep increasing, so she needs a loan to expand her business to be abe to take care of their needs. The loan will be used to buy palm fruit to process into oil to sell. Ama hopes to reinvest the new profit for further growth of the business.

She washes the palm fruit and boils them until they become soft and tender. She scoops the cooked fruit into a big mortar and gently pounds with a pestle to avoid damaging the nut. Water is then added to the pounded fruit. The mixture of water and the pounded fruit is squeezed and filtered to get the juice out and the chaff removed. The chaff is sometimes used by the local people to light charcoal fires. The juice is boiled again, and as it boils, the fresh oil will float to the surface of the pot. The oil is scooped into yet another pot and left to cool. 

Fresh oil from palm fruit is traditionally used in eating roasted yam or plantains in Africa – especially on the farms after a hard day's work. Palm oil is the preferred type of cooking oil because Ghanaians like its consistency and flavor. It is used in most traditional dishes.

loans.use: to buy palm fruit to process into oil to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a widow with five children, four of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Her major dream is to become a main supplier of vegetables in the region. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to renovate her selling stall and purchase cabbages, green vegetables, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cabbages, green vegetables, potatoes and onions, and renovate her stall.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 41 years old and lives with her children and mother in a Ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. Her daughter is a high school student. 
Byambasuren started her business of selling grocery products and goods in 2010. In 2011, she got a job at the local post office. She manages her job and private business very well. She is well-known in her local town. She is expanding her business little by little. She believes that her business will be successful in the near future. She is a diligent and hard working woman. 
She says "With the bank loan, I want to expand my business and improve my life. I think my business will grow." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy more products.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Mwangaza Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mwangaza SHG Group in Western Kenya! Pamela is the facilitator of the Mwangaza SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Everlyne takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and have additional maize profits to educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had a very good maize yield, harvesting 7 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Everlyne will educate her children and invest in poultry rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mwangaza SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Everlyne is pictured with her group members in the photograph with their Field Officer on the far left in the blue shirt.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with one young child who is currently enrolled in school. Eunice works as a tailor and sells her goods from home. She's been a tailor for four years and her customers are primarily her neighbors and other local residents. Eunice describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Eunice plans to use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy fabric in preparation for the Christmas season. Eunice aspires to open a large store with several sewing machines in the future. She joined Kiva field partner Yehu because of their favorable loan products and conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric in preparation for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children.

Helen has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is married with five children. Emelita is 38 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Emelita has a general store. She has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns approximately 60000. She has requested a loan of 35000 to purchase stocks for her general store to sell. Emelita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Emelita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her general store to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe es socia del Banco Comunal “Ahorro es Progreso”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene  63 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos independientes.  Estudió educación secundaria.

Desde hace seis años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo anterior fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de servicio de impresión, fotocopias y venta de útiles escolares.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de cinco cajas de papel bond, tóner para la maquina, también comprará útiles escolares.  Trabaja junto con su esposo.

La señora desea seguir con el negocio y ampliarlo ofreciendo otros servicios y más productos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la unión con las socias, la facilidad del préstamo y la ganancia del ahorro.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a member of the Communal Bank "Ahorro es Progreso" [Savings for Progress] which is located in the province and department of Puno. She is 63 years old, she is married and she has three independent children. She studied Secondary Education.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past seven years. Her previous loan was for the amount of 300 nuevo soles, which she invested in her business of providing printing and photocopying services and selling school supplies.

She is requesting a new loan for the amount of 1000 nuevo soles which she will invest in the purchase of five boxes of bond paper, toner for the printer and she will also buy school supplies. She works with her husband.

The lady wants to continue on with the business and expand it by offering other services and more products.

What she likes most about her Communal Bank is the closeness of the members, the ease of borrowing and the profits from savings.

loans.use: to buy five boxes of bond paper, toner for the printer and school supplies.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of hiring more employees in the future.

With the 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables and onions.

loans.name: Felipe Francisco

texts.es:
Felipe Francisco   tiene 46 años vive en Unión Libre, y vive con su cónyuge  y con los hijos. Vive en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla el recreo  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente las Lomas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz, fréjol y soya criar gallinas.

Felipe se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, a criar gallinas. Desde hace ocho años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para la maleza  para la siembra del maíz, así también para la compra de la comida apropiada para criar sus gallinas. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia. Su sueño es poder comprar un terreno  y así poder  tener mayor ingresos  para su familia.

En los tiempos libres me gusta jugar indor, pasar  con su familia.
texts.en:
Felipe Francisco is 46 years old and lives with his spouse and his children.  He lives in the San Vicente las Lomas area of the Ventanas canton.

The V.C.R. El Recreo is in San Vicente las Lomas, part of the Ventanas canton, and is composed of members dedicated to farming corn, rice, beans and soy beans and the raising of chickens.

Felipe grows corn and beans and raises chickens, he has been doing this for eight years.  He buys his products in Ventanas and sells his production in the market of the same location.

The requested loan is for the purchase of supplies, fertilizers, weed killers for the planting of corn.  He is also buying feed for his chickens.  The loan helps him to increase his income for the use of his family.  His dream is to buy land and be able to generate more income for his family.

In his free time he likes to be with his family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, fertilizers, weed killers for the planting of corn, and also to buy feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 35 years old, a married mother of 2 children living in Hioma, Uganda. She has a music system business that she has been running for one and a half years. She is a teacher by profession. She saved her salary to start the business of hiring out music systems.

Sarah faces a challenge of inadequate capital. Her business goal is to expand her business to new markets. She intends to use the loan to buy a new music system.

loans.use: to buy a music system.

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Alegría” está conformado por 16 emprendedoras, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa de casa (sábanas y cortinas), venta de joyas, lencería, juguetería y frutas. Todas ellas pertenecientes a la Provincia de Osorno.
Jacqueline integrante y presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en cuclillas en la primera fila, ubicada en el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda. Ella usa su cabello tomado, viste un polerón color claro y además sostiene a su pequeña hija en sus brazos.
Jacqueline es chef de comida internacional y se dedica a preparar comida gourmet (platos de comida refinados), desde hace 7 años. Sus comidas preparadas las vende a domicilio por pedido, promociona sus servicios de boca en boca y con tarjetas de presentación. Comenta que lo primordial en sus preparaciones es la presentación de los platos, ya que todo “entra por la vista”.
Prepara las comidas en la cocina de su casa, para esto debió ampliarla. Ahí cuenta con diferentes maquinarias y electrodomésticos para trabajar.
Con el crédito comprará insumos para su negocio.
Una de las metas en su negocio es comprarse un vehículo para trasladar su mercadería y también contar con un local independiente a su casa, para tener una mayor comodidad. 
Jacqueline vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son reconocimiento en su negocio y que este le brinde mayores utilidades. Ya que con esto podría brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es responsable.
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios.
Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Alegría' (Happiness).  It has 16 female members.  The women are all entrepreneurs and all work in different fields, including selling soft furnishings (sheets and drapes), selling jewelry, underwear, toys and fruit.  All of the women live in Osorno province.

Jacqueline is a member of this community bank.  She is also its president.  In the photo, she is crouching down in the front row.  She is on the far right of the photo.  Her hair is tied back and she is wearing a light-colored hooded top.  She is holding her young daughter in her arms.  

Jacqueline is a chef who makes international food.  She has been making gourmet meals for 7 years.  She sells her prepared meals to order, by home delivery.  She promotes her services by word of mouth and with business cards.  She says that the most important thing in preparing her meals is presenting the dishes well as everything "enters through the eyes".  She prepares the meals in the kitchen in her house, which she had to extend for this purpose.  There she has different machines and appliances which she works with.

Jacqueline will use her loan to buy supplies for her business.  One of her goals for her business is to buy a vehicle so that she can transport her merchandise.  She would also like to have business premises which are separate from her house, so that she can work more comfortably.  Jacqueline lives with her husband and her two children who are 8 and 2 years old.  Her dreams, on a personal level, are to become well known in her business and for her business to make her more profit so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

Jacqueline is happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza have given her as it will allow her to invest in her business.  She says that her community bank is responsible.  

Osorno is a city which is located in the southern part of Chile, in Los Lagos region.  It is an important agricultural center which is known as Chile's 'homeland of milk and meat'.  Chief among its farming activities is the production of wheat and oats, cattle raising (both for meat and milk) and the manufacture of farming equipment.  Osorno is home to the only soccer stadium in Chile to have a roof: the 'Rubén Marcos' Municipal Stadium.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 26 years old lady single mother of two school going children. She has been selling dry maize for the last one year. 

She will be using the loan to purchase more maize for sale and hopes this will help her pay school fees. Her hopes and dreams for the future are built a big house and educate her children."

loans.use: to purchase more maize to help her pay scholl fees

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida  is 34 years old, married woman. She is been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases variety of cloth at low prices from city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Sajida  has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR. She wants  to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his tomato farming business

loans.name: Tu

texts.en: Tu is married to Than. Both Tu and Than were born in 1962. They live with their son who is in the ninth grade at a local school. They don’t have any land aside from 20 square meters for their home. Tu’s husband must work as a labourer in his village. Tu has a small shop where she sells some fruits and vegetables. Their main income, which comes from selling fruits and vegetables, is only $10 per person/month. Because of low capital, Tu isn't able to purchase various fruits and vegetables in order to improve her income. Tu wants to get a loan of $75 so that she will be able to purchase various fruits and vegetables for her shop. Tu believes that she is going to repay monthly.

loans.use: To increase the variety of fruits and vegetables for her shop.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Miss Loan is 31 years old. Her husband died of cancer. She has two children between ages 7 and 10 who are going to school. Miss Loan must support her parents-in-law who are very old and often suffer disease. She only has 1000 square meters where she plants rice. Miss Loan sells vegetable at the local market. After this venture, her income increased about $1.5/person/month. The average income is $10/person/month. Miss Loan has repaid the first loan on time. Now, she wants to borrow a loan of $75 again.

loans.use: sells vegetable

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and is a mother of seven children and some grand children. She had always wanted to be of the maximum assistance to her loving husband who was found it difficult to meet the demands of his large household. But her attempt to cultivate and sell crops failed because she did not have enough land. She then decided to sell firewood and fatten pigs since less land is needed.

Her search for a start-off capital led her to become a member of GHAPE and before receiving her first loan she was trained in business management, marketing techniques, and credit discipline. Since then, she has been able to invest and repay her first loan of $40 with which she raised money to increase her business and buy food for her household.

Given a loan of $300, she plans to fatten and sell pigs and piglets and also sell firewood which is the cheapest sourced of energy used by 90% of the population. She plans to pay her loan in 15 months.

loans.use: Purchase piglets, pig treatment, firewood

loans.name: Garib

texts.en: Mr. Garib is a 48-year-old married farmer with three children. He lives with his family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1987, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The work is hard, but interesting, and takes a lot of effort. Garib buy calves, breeds them, then quarters them before selling them to the butcher who works in the big local market. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of Garib’s family expenses. To increase the profit margin from the selling, Garib has to invest some money to make his small herd bigger. This Summer he applied for $500 to buy four calves.  He hopes eventually to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Mr. Khalid is a low income vulnerable person. He is 23 and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. For the last five years, Khalid has owned and operated a small food market in the local bazaar of Saatli town. The business is stable. But there are no investment funds to diversify his trading assortment, increase the turnover and therefore improve his income to provide all the necessities of life for his children. Some commercial banks demand collateral for loans. But Khalid has nothing to mortgage. That's why he applied to the Normicro Saatli branch, which disburses loans free of collateral, for a $700 loan. This loan would let him buy and sell a bigger amount of goods and to develop his business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Surita

texts.en: Surita is a married mother of 44 years of age. Her family has lived on their taro plantation for years. She heard of SPBD through some village women and she was very happy to join. Through her loans she has managed to improve many things in her home. Surita is planning to have her own small market in her village so she can sell many other crops and improve her vegetable garden.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation and market the crops

loans.name: Julaeha

texts.en: Julaeha is 31 years old. Her husband A. does not work anymore. To earn a living Juleaha sells food and beverages near a school. She earns $40 a month. She is requesting a loan of $150 to buy more goods. As a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo S. is a mother of three and is 45 years old and lives in Okoko, Lagos State. She produces nylon which she supplies to her community market and she has been in business for 10 years.She needs a loan of $450 to buy more un-produced nylon materials for production purposes.

loans.use: To buy uncut nylon in bulk for production.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung, 36 years old, runs a small shop in the front of her house where she sells mainly school supplies and snacks. As a single mother, Nhung raises her 10-year-old son, Luu Minh Hoang, on her own. Her track record has proven both reliable and trustworthy as she has successfully repaid a loan from Mekong Plus in the past. She would like a loan from KIVA in order to increase her store's stock. She is able to earn between 10-15,000 VND ($0.62-0.94) per day. With the money she earns, she sends her son to school.

loans.use: To increase her shop's stock

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna D. buys food items like maize and groundnut in large quantities and sells them to her customers in smaller quantities they can afford. She is married and has 2 children. Business is very good but she spends most of her income on transportation.

She is asking $825 as additional capital to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her capital.

loans.use: As additional capital to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her capital.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys B. is married and has 8 dependents. She prepares a native food called ‘kenkey’ which has maize as a main ingredient. It is highly patronized by the fishermen at the shore. Business is growing well and she wishes to increase production and sales. She is running low on ingredients for her food production.

Gladys is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for her food production.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for food production

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dương Thị Nghĩa, 40 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 1998. She has two school aged children. She used the funds from her loans to buy scrap material for reselling. The business gradually better the she switched to opening a restaurant. The average monthly income from her restaurant of 2,000,000 VND and plus her husband’s wage from his job as a bronze casting crafter allow them to save enough to build their new house and provide more to their children’s education. She would like to take out a loan of 10,000,000 VND to expand her restaurant and buy some breeding pigs so their children would have extra activities after their school hours.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Dương Thị Nghĩa năm nay 40 tuổi, gia đình chị có 2 con hiện đang đi học. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Những năm đầu tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương chị sử dụng vốn để di thu mua phế liệu. Sau một thời gian tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã dần quen và tích lũy thêm được nhiều kinh nghiệm trong kinh doanh vì vậy công việc kinh doanh của chị ngày càng có hiệu quả. Hiện nay chị không đi mua phế liệu mà sử dụng vốn vào việc mở hàng ăn thu nhập bình quân 2.000.000/ tháng. Ngoài thu nhập từ công việc buôn bán, gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ công việc đi đúc đồng thuê của chồng chị. Vì vậy ngoài việc xây dựng được nhà cử, cho các con ăn học gia đình chị còn có thể dầu tư thêm vào của hàng ăn. Chị Nghĩa muốn vay thêm 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư vào của hàng ăn phục vụ khách hàng trong và ngoài xã. Ngoài ra chị cũng muốn vay thêm vốn để mua thêm giống chăn nuôi tạo công việc cho các con chị lúc rảnh rỗi.

loans.use: Restaurant and breeding pigs

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Kanchi K. is a 26 year old lady who lives in SainbuBhaishepati. She has four members including herself in her family. Her husband, Pradan is a land broker. Their daughter is studying for her BBS (Bachelor in Business Studies) and their son is studying in grade 12.
Kanchi started selling cow's milk a year ago to raise the living standard of her family. She already owns two cows. She usually sells cow’s milk door to door in the morning. Now she is requesting her third loan of $300 to buy another young cow. She lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. In Nepal people love to drink cow's milk so demand for milk is increasing constantly.

loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Thi Bay

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Bay, 35 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. Born in the rural area, she understands that she would face financial problems if her family only relied on farming. Right after she was married, she discussed with her husband to find a business that would stablise their family's economy, and they decided on selling pork. Everyday, her husband goes to the town market to buy pork which her sells at home whiL. Mrs. Bay then sells in the village market, bringing back a daily profit of 150,000VND (about 10USD). Since joining the Fund, her family has had more capital so their business has been even more smooth. Besides, she still has a source of income from farming and raising livestock. This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550.00USD) to further invest in her business. Her family's average monthly income is 6,000,000VND (about 400USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Bảy 35 tuổi. Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006, xuất thân từ vùng nông thôn nên chị rất hiểu rằng nếu chỉ trông vào nông nghiệp thì kinh tế gia đình sẽ gặp nhiều khó khăn. Ngay từ khi chị lấy chồng chị đã bàn bạc cùng với chồng kiếm một nghề buốn bán để kinh tế gia đình ổn định hợn, vợ chồng chị đã lựa chọn nghề buôn bán thịt lợn, hàng ngày chồng chị đi chợ huyện lấy hàng về chị đem bán tại chợ xã còn anh bán tại thôn nhà công việc buôn bán đều đặn thu nhập bình quân 150.000đ/ ngày. Từ khi vào Qũy vay vốn gia đình chị đã có thêm vốn nên công việc buôn bán của gia đình chị thuận lợi hơn rất nhiều,. Ngoài buôn bán gia đình chị vẫn có nguồn thu nhập từ nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vốn vào buôn bán. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Selling pork

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 29 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 8 and 2 years old. She has been a charcoal, bedsheet, and food items seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Salma now requests a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Esta cliente inició su negocio en una pequeña pulpería y con los créditos que adim le ha proporcionado ella empezó a ofertar gran variedad de productos. Ella ha ido creciendo en sus negocios con la ayuda de sus hijos y de su  esposo el que desempeña el oficio de sastrería  y tiene su propio taller; con estos ingresos extras  le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y el estudio de sus hijos que están en la universidad. Por su carácter amable se ha ganado la simpatía de sus vecinos logrando mantener una gran clientela. Su mayor sueño es de ampliar su negocio hasta llegar a tener una abarroteria.
texts.en:
This client started her business in a tiny general store and with the loans that ADIM has granted her she began to offer a large variety of products. She has been growing her business with the help of her children and her husband who works as a tailor and has his own shop. With this extra income she helps him with the household expenses and with the education of their children who are in university. Because of her pleasant personality she has won the friendship of her neighbors, succeeding in keeping a large clientele. Her biggest dream is to enlarge her business so that it will one day be a convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sengthaiy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sengthaiy M. lives in Prey Pdeak village in Kampong Speu Province. She is 41 years old and the mother of six children. One of her children works in a garment factory while the rest attend the local school.

She and her husband, Mr. Koe Srey, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. However this work is not enough to support their family. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sengthaiy M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband so that he may begin a motorbike taxi business. She hopes with this new profession, her husband can make more money to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Con Dios Hacia Delante Group

texts.en:
Maribel is a hardworking mother of three children. She is the representative of this group of 20 people and a great example of the type of people Esperanza International deals with. She came to Esperanza International with no job, and no way to help her husband care for her three young. The family was going through hard times and her husband was having a hard time earning sufficient money to proviD. for the family.

Maribel took out a loan and started a business selling small pets. She found great success, and now is taking out her fifth loan and increasing the business. For the first time in her life she feels useful and feels like she has a purpose. She is able to proviD. for her family and to send her children to school. She is very happy with the success she has, but wants to keep increasing her business and bettering her life and the life of her family. She is very excited about the future, and the even more excited about the future of her children!

loans.use: Buying animals for breeding and selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy skirts and blankets

loans.name: Mohammadullah

texts.en:
Mohammadullah is the son of G. M.. He lives in district 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a carpet weaver, and his business enables him to earn enough money to provide the essential requirements of his family members.

Mohammadullah wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 10 months for the purpose of increasing his business and adding to his monthly income.

loans.use: To expand his carpet-weaving business

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en el centro Santa Barbara, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijos a su cuidado, posee estudios de secundaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 05 años, posee un negocio de tienda de abarrotes; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles el mismo que lo pagará en 05 cuotas mensuales; dicho préstamo le servirá para poder incrementar mercadería en su negocio y de esta manera incrementar la capacidad de su tienda, es decir comprar más azúcar, arroz, golosina, bebidas, etc. Todo al por mayor; con ello piensa obtener mejores ganancias las que piensa invertir aún más en su negocio (su sueño es tener una bodega propia y una tienda de artefactos) con la ayuda de sus hijos. 
 
Ella agradece de sobremanera a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the communal bank "03 de Mayo," in the El Collao district of Puno. She is a 42 years old single mother of two children, and she has completed her secondary level of education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos (a Kiva partner) for 5 years, and she sells groceries. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian Soles, with which she bought merchandise for her store. With this loan of 3000 Peruvian Soles, which she will repay in 5 monthly installments, she will be able to increase her merchandise and so increase the capacity of her store. That is, she will buy more sugar, rice, sweets, drinks, etc., all wholesale.

With this, she hopes to secure higher earnings which she can reinvest in her business (her dream is to have her own store and a store of artifacts) with the help of her children. Rosa is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for her support of women.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Elvis Hamilton

texts.es:
El señor Elvis V. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a laborar para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación supliendo las necesidades de su familia.
Se ha dedicado con ahínco a su actividad de ganadería y por este motivo es que ha acudido a Ceprodel porque requiere la compra de ganado como son los bueyes para proceder a su crianza ya que se ha dado cuenta que esta actividad ganadera le ayuda a salir adelante mejorando sus ingresos. Con el crédito se beneficia grandemente en su municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua.
texts.en:
With much effort, Mr. Elvis V. labors to sustain his house, supporting the needs of his family. He works eagerly farming cattle and for this reason he has turned to Ceprodel because he needs to purchase livestock such as oxen to continue breeding, since he has realized that livestock farming helps him to get ahead, improving his income. He will profit greatly from this loan in Managua's municipality of San Rafael del Sur.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami Ndao est mariée avec 07 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Thiaré Dendel depuis 5 ans et demi. Ami veut  acheter des bœufs, des aliments et des arachides pour renforcer son activité d’embouche et de vente d’arachide. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ami Ndao is married and raising 7 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Thiaré Dendel for 5 and a half years. Ami wants to buy cows, feed, and peanuts to bolster her business fattening cattle and selling peanuts. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying cows, feed for fattening cattle, and peanuts for re-sale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 22-year-old young man living in Barja in Mount Lebanon. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2005 and desires to open an Internet cafe. Today, Ahmad is requesting $1,200 to further expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mr. Thy S. (not shown in the picture), 52, and his wife, Mrs. Kan Chea (shown in the picture with her son), 52, have been married for 20 years. They have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home and another one is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Thy and his wife have been raising ducks for 20 years. They hope to expand their business and that is why Thy is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase 150 more ducks

loans.use: To purchase more ducks

loans.name: Muyurina Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Muyurina inicia su ciclo 17 con 15 socias, las socias son D. la comunidad D. Muyurina distrito D. Tambillo.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, abarrotes en general, comidas y agricultura.
	
Como es el caso D. Julia que es casada, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Julia tiene un puesto en un nuevo mercadillo D. su zona en donD. venD. comida, También Julia se dedica a la agricultura, además Julia viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región.
	
Mientras que Lidia es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Lidia junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo D. verduras, sus productos los comercializa en los mercados D. abasto D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 10,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideo, verduras, semillas, abono y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, mejorar la producción D. sus tierras y ahorrar lo suficiente para el futuro.
texts.en:
The Muyurina Village Bank has 15 members and is currently beginning its 17th loan cycle. The group members are from the Muyurina community of Tambillo District and have different businesses. They sell vegetables, basic grocery items and prepared meals; some are farmers. For example, Julia is 44 years old and married with two children. She has a stand in the recently opened small market, where she sells prepared meals. She also has a farm and travels to different regional markets. Lidia, another group member, is 42 years old and married with three children. She and her husband grow vegetables, which they sell in the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho. The group members are requesting different loan amounts, like 300, 600 or 900 soles. The village bank is requesting a total of 10,200 soles in loans. Group members will use their loans to buy rice, sugar, pasta, vegetables, seeds and fertilizer and to pay field workers on their farms. Some of the group members' dreams are to improve their businesses, proviD. their children with a good education, improve their crop yields and save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, pasta, vegetables, seeds and fertilizer; pay field workers

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem, a 25-year-old man living in Haret Hreik, Mount Lebanon, has been a baker since 2006, with four years of previous experience. Today, Kassem is hoping to borrow $1,200 in order to buy new tools.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his bakery.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: T. is 29 years old; she sells phone recharge cards in large quantities, as she has a printing machine. She has been in this business since 2002 and is doing fine. T. is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more material for printing. She says thank you and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase material for printing rechargeable cards to sell

loans.name: Đậu Thị

texts.en:
H. Đậu Thị (1811071242) is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, H. owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. H. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. H. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: used to invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is 32 years old. She is married with four children. Currently, all her children are in school. Yaa is a trader who sells used clothes. Used clothes are bought by many people for their daily wear, so Yaa has many customers. Most people buy used clothes because of the high price of new clothes.

However, with her small amount of capital, Yaa can barely buy more clothes to sell to make a profit. She wants this loan, therefore, to buy more bales of used clothes, with good variety to meet the desires of her customers, and to increase the income of her family. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buys bales of used clothing

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac Y. is married and has two children. His educational background is senior high. Isaac sells maize which he buys and resells at the market in its raw state at a new market in Elmina, which he has been doing since 2007. His wife is a trader. Isaac uses his income in payment of his children fees. Isaac will use the loan to purchase t more maize for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Isaac plans to reinvest into his business.

loans.use: Isaac will use the loan to purchase t more maize for sale.

loans.name: Kamin Group

texts.en: Waheedullah who is the group leader Kamin group after hard working he made a group of  Three members each one of them are busy in different tasks like Waheedullah busy in hair dresser shop, Abdul Rahaman busy in catering shop and S. Agha busy in retail shop they wants to become stronger in there business so there for they made a group and wants to containing there business and they requested a group loan each members need 10000 Afghani and to further there work and be a good Client for Kiva and AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) Waheedullah  is ensure that they can repay the loan on it is time and he can control the whole group he would like to thank Avery body that help with this process of loan in Jalalabad  Afghanistan.

loans.use: They want to buy necessary things for there business

loans.name: Wake Up Traders Group

texts.en:
The above are members of the Wake-up Traders’ group. Small-scale businesspeople in the town of Magburaka, located in northern Sierra Leone, they are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 each to enable them to improve their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to carry more goods in their stalls, make more sales and earn greater profits. Consequently, their living standard will improve so that they can better look after themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Fatmata N. (on the left in the photo), born in the village of Blama in eastern Sierra Leone but now living with her husband and three children in Magburaka. Her husband is a businessman, while two of her children are attending secondary schools and the eldest is a nurse. For many years now, Fatmata has sold local goods such as palm-kernels, bananas, palm-oil, etc.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Yolita

texts.en: Yolita, 46 years old and married to Fernando, manages a sari-sari store within the village of San Fabian Echague.  Improving and expanding her store to  improve their standard of living is Yolita's goal, so she is requesting a loan of PHP5000 to purchase additional groceries to generate a bigger income. Yolita hopes for the success of her store in order to save for their security when they are elderly.

loans.use: Additional capital for business development

loans.name: Sherlina

texts.en:
Sherlina S. is from the village of Country Hill Iligan City. She is 45 years old. Sherlina is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Sherlina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling cooked food in her carenderia and she also had her sari sari store in the local community. Sherlina has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sherlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherlina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Sherlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
L. señora  MANUEL. ISABEL D. L. C. G. tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito D. FLORENCIA D. MORA, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento L. Libertad – Perú. L. socia tiene estudios hasta 3º D. secundaria, dejó D. estudiar debido a que salió embarazada. Tiene 3 hijos y todos dependen económicamente D. elL..
MANUEL. se dedica a L. confección D. calzado, únicamente para damas, se ha perfeccionado en L. fabricación D. calzado sport, algunas veces cubre pedidos para caballeros, pero en menor proporción. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compró material para L. fabricación D. su calzado sport, como: plantas D. goma, D. jebe, suelas, entre otros.  Con este crédito D. 400.00 nuevos soles comprará material como: cuero, plantillas, hilos, hebillas, suelas, tacos, etc., para fabricar modelos nuevos D. zapatillas y calzado sport para damas y caballeros, dado que L. socia aprovechará las fiestas naviD.ñas e incrementará sus ganancias. 
MANUEL. sueña con vender sus productos en una tienda dentro del centro comercial ubicado en el Distrito D. Trujillo
texts.en:
Sra. ManueL. Isabel D. L. C. G. is 32 years old and lives in the District of Florencia D. Mora, Trujillo Province, Department of L. Libertad – Perú. After completing her education through the 3rd year of secondary school, she dropped out upon becoming pregnant. She now has 3 dependent children.

ManueL. manufactures shoes specifically for women. She has perfected her process for making athletic shoes. Sometimes she fulfills orders for men’s shoes, but to a lesser extent. She used her first loan of 300 soles to buy materials for making athletic shoes such as rubber soles.

With this loan of 400 soles, she will buy materials such as leather, stencils, thread, buckles, soles, heels, and other items for making new models of shoes for women and men. She hopes to take advantage of the Christmas season so that she can increase her earnings. ManueL. dreams of selling her products at a store located in a shopping center in Trujillo District.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is 23 years old and married with two children. He has a small internet cafe. He would like to take a loan to expand and improve his internet cafe which he uses to support his big family; besides his wife and children, Ibraheem is also supporting his parents and seven siblings.

He thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To expand and improve his internet cafe

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio M. is from the village of Tamucco, Sto. Niño, Cagayan. He is 60 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Rogelio operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP every harvest season. In 2008, Rogelio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his second from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lars

texts.en: Lars P., 31, is married and lives with her husband in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling Chinese noodles and coffee to her new and existing customers in the village. She has operated this business since 2000 and is able to earn a gross income of US $15 per day. Her husband buys sweet potatoes and cows from local farmers in the province in stock and sells them to the markets. He is able to earn a gross income of US $40 per day. P. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of US $750 to purchase more sweet potatoes for her husband to resell. This couple works so hard every day and helps each others in the family businesses. The husband always helps his wife in selling noodles and coffee in the morning. This is P.’s first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. In the future, she hopes she will be able to build a new nice house for her family.

loans.use: buy sweet potatoes for re-sale

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 38 years old. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. She works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. 

Angelina is a seamstress by profession. She works in a shop by the roadside in her community. According to her, she has been in business for some years now and has four apprentices currently under her training. Angelina wants a loan to buy fabrics and other sewing accessories to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Édith

texts.fr: M. Edith est née en 1972 à Dogbo au Mono. Edith vit depuis 20 ans environs au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Edith est mariée et mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Mais Edith vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les différentes charges. Edith a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Edith mène comme activité la vente de riz, de chaussures et des produits cosmétiques à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo, que Edith se ravitaille. Edith exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année et a obtenu une fois déjà, de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Edith a bien remboursé le crédit. Edith sollicite un deuxième prêt afin de renforcer son capital et de rehausser le niveau de son activité pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Édith M. was born in 1972 in Dogbo in the region of Mono. She has been living for about 20 years in the Zogbo neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married and the mother of four children who all attend school. Édith lives alone with her children and also provides alone for them. She studied until secondary level. Édith sells rice, shoes and cosmetics in her home-based store. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and in Lomé (Togo). She has been in this trade for ten years. Once she got a loan from Alidé which she repaid on schedule. This is Édith's second loan which she will use to strengthen her working capital and expand her business to better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina, de 32 años, vive al lado su pareja Isidoro (32), quien es agricultor, y de sus 3 hijos que son menores de edad y estudian en el colegio.

Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, aprendió viendo a sus padres y hermanos cómo sembraban con esmero la tierra. Cuando formó su familia, hace 15 años, continuó con las labores agrícolas; en la actualidad ambos siembran maíz y papa y cuidan  mucho de sus tierras para asegurar su producción, pues deben vender todo a los comerciantes mayoristas que van hasta sus mismas chacras a recoger los productos. Ella está muy satisfecha, ya que tiene buenas ganancias y le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque a pesar de ser sacrificado, es gratificante sacar adelante a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo. A su vez, se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y porcino, el cual comercializa en las ferias de la zona por donde vive. Para el futuro tiene pensado sembrar en mayor cantidad el maíz, ya que el precio en el mercado esta alto, pero también quiere comprar más cabezas de ganado.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir el crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de maíz y fertilizantes para asegurar la producción de sus campos.
texts.en:
Ernestina is 32 years old and lives with her husband, Isidoro (32), who is a farmer, and with her three young children who attend school. She’s been farming since she was a child and learned by watching her parents and brothers work the land with great care. When she started her family 15 years ago, she continued farming. Now they both raise corn and potatoes and care for their land in order to ensure a good harvest. They sell all of their products to large business who travel to the same fields to pick up their products. She is very satisfied, has a good income, and likes her work. Even though it requires a lot of sacrifice, it’s gratifying to help her children get ahead. She also raises cattle and hogs, which she sells. She would like to increase her corn production, since the price of corn is high, but she also wants to buy heads of livestock. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is very thankful to all the people who make this loan possible and allow her to continue working. She will use the money from this loan to buy corn seed and fertilizer to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Meris

texts.es:
