La señora C. tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, ella va a utilizar el crédito para surtir su negocio en la compra de  arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leña, golosinas, bisuterías, etc. 

Doña Meris es una señora de 63 Años, acompañada no tiene hijos, solo vive con su marido el cual el también le ayuda en lo que es la pulpería ya que es su único medio de alimentación diaria.

Este es el crédito No. 24 que tiene con CEPRODEL los cuales todos los ha cancelado muy bien en tiempo y forma por lo cual dice estar muy agradecida con la Institución por haber ayudado a crecer en su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Chavez runs a small store out of her home. She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, firewood, snacks, soft drinks, knick-knacks, etc, to stock her store. She is 63 years old and married with no children. She lives with her husband who also helps her run the store, as it is their only source of daily sustenance. This will be her 24th loan through CEPRODEL. She has paid the previous loans on schedule and she tells us that she is very grateful to the institution for having helped her build her business and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Muriel

texts.es:
Muriel J. G. tiene 40 años y vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos entre 19 y 9 años de edad en el barrio La Paz de Barranquilla, barrio conocido por sus fiestas religiosas como la fiesta de San Pedro y San Pablo, y sus procesiones de Semana Santa. Su negocio consiste en una mini tienda de víveres, como arroz, aceite, azúcar, leche, pan, sal y café, de productos domiciliarios como jabón y champú, y de una miscelánea. Inició su negocio hace 4 años cuando dejó de vender ropa bajo pedido y productos por catálogo. Siempre le ha gustado trabajar y quería empezar un negocio. Ahora cuenta con clientes como amigos, familiares y vecinos y va promocionando a sus casas para impulsar las ventas cuando tiene nuevos productos. Sin embargo, considera su mayor desafío la ubicación del negocio ya que no se ve desde fuera con falta de espacio y de capital. Para resolver esto su meta es de tener una tienda más grande en el primer cuarto que le otorgaría más espacio tanto a la tienda como a la vivienda y haría la tienda más visible en la calle.
Actualmente Muriel solicita un crédito de $2.000.000 la mitad quiere invertirlo en la compra de productos para el negocio; con la otra mitad quiere mejorar la vivienda en subir el techo que está bastante bajo. Aunque este es su segundo crédito, el esposo estuvo vinculado a la Fundación durante varios años y en aquella época los dos fueron surtiendo más, ganando más clientes y consiguiendo mayores ventas. Además, pudieron construir la cocina de su casa y otro cuarto en la vivienda. Más adelante, Muriel sueña con arreglar la casa por completo y también con educar a sus hijos para que terminen el bachillerato en el colegio, un paso que Muriel considera imprescindible para que hagan algo en la vida.
texts.en:
Muriel J. G. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and four children, who are between the ages of 9 and 19, in the neighborhood of La Paz in Barranquilla. This neighborhood is known for its religious festivals, such as the Festival of Saint Peter and Saint Paul, and the Holy Week processions.

Muriel’s business consists of a mini-grocery store where she sells rice, oil, sugar, milk, bread, salt, and coffee. She also has household products in stock such as soap, shampoo, and other items. Muriel started her store four years ago when she quit her clothing by catalog order business. She always enjoyed working and wanted to start another business. Now her customers include her friends, relatives, and neighbors. She goes to their homes to boost her sales by advertising whenever she has new products. However, she considers her greatest challenges to be the location of her business because it is not visible from the outside, the lack of space, and insufficient capital. To resolve these issues, her goal is to have a larger store in her main room that provides more space and is more visible from the street.

Muriel is currently requesting a loan of 2,000,000 COP. Half of the money will be invested in the purchase of products for her business. The other half will be used to improve her home by raising the ceiling because it is quite low. Although this is her second loan, her husband has been associated with the Foundation for several years. During this season, the two of them plan to acquire more supplies, attract more customers, and continue making more sales. In addition, they hope to build a kitchen and add another room to their home. Later on, Muriel dreams of completely remodeling her house and also providing her children with an education so that they can finish both high school and college. She considers this to be an essential step to doing something in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her business & raise the ceiling of her house

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es:
La Sra. Boquín García trabaja como Maestra de Primaria en una Esc. Urbana ubicada en el municipio del Viejo.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito en la compra de Zinc y madera para Reparar el techo de su casa.

Actualmente lleva 10 créditos con la Institución los cuales   todos los ha pago en tiempo y forma de igual manera dice sentirse muy agradecida por todo el apoyo que ha recibido por parte de la Institución.
texts.en:
La Sra. Boquín García trabaja como Maestra de Primaria en una Esc. Urbana ubicada en el municipio del Viejo. Ella va a utilizar el crédito en la compra de Zinc y madera para Reparar el techo de su casa. Actualmente lleva 10 créditos con la Institución los cuales todos los ha pago en tiempo y forma de igual manera dice sentirse muy agradecida por todo el apoyo que ha recibido por parte de la Institución.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Zinc para Reparación de vivienda.

loans.name: Delia's Group

texts.en:
Delia A. is from the village of Bannagao. She is 54 years old. Delia is the leader of a 5-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Delia A. Group.

Delia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Delia is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Delia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to sell

loans.name: Yagou

texts.fr: Yagou S. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants, elle est aussi tutrice de 3 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches et parents. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 25 février 2005 et 10 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours bien remboursé ses prêts. Ses activités sont très diversifiées, elle vend du mil, des haricots séchés, de l’huile de palme, des jus de fruits naturels qu’elle fabrique et fait aussi de l’embouche ovine. Son crédit lui permettra de s’approvisionner en marchandises et d’acheter 6 moutons qu’elle va engraisser et revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Elle soutien beaucoup son mari pour la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Yagou S. is a 52-year old woman who is married and mother to nine children; she is also guardian to three other children who have been entrusted to her care by relatives. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since 25th February 2005 and has had ten consecutive loans, which she has always repaid on time. Her activities are very diversified: she sells millet, dried beans, palm oil and natural fruit juices which she makes, and she also has a sheep fattening activity. Her loan will allow her to stock up on goods and to buy six sheep, which she will fatten up and resell after four to five months. She helps out her husband significantly in taking care of the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Xecajà Group

texts.es: Doña Santos S., tiene 19 años de ser Viuda y sola ha salido adelántate con sus hijos, tiene 49 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales dos están a su cargo, se dedica a la Alfarería (trabaja el barro, tales como sartenes, cómales, etc.) su negocio ya cuenta con 25 años de estar funcionando, vende todos los días y con eso logra el sustento diario. Conjuntamente con otras vecinas deciden organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo. El cual será utilizado como capital de trabajo y así poder  incrementar el volumen de ventas. Son 15 señoras que conforman el Banco Comunal  denominado Xecajá, las señoras de dedican a diversas actividades productivas tales como, las crianza de animales, alfarería, sastrería y algunas otras a la venta de helado frutas y verduras. Grupo que se localiza en Cantón Pacanac, San Cristóbal, Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Santos S. has been a widow for 19 years. She has gotten her children ahead by herself. She is 49 years old, and she has seven children. Two of the children are under her care. She works with pottery (she works the clay and makes pans and “cómales”, which are used to cook tortillas, etc.). She has had this business for 25 years. She sells everyday, and this is her daily support. Santos and some neighbors decided to organize a group to be able to request a loan. The loan will be used as working capital to be able to increase the volume of sales. There are 15 women who comprise the Xecajá Communal Bank. The women devote themselves to various activities like raising animals, pottery, or being a seamstress. Some of the other members sell ice cream, fruit, and vegetables. The group is in Cantón Pacanac, San Cristóbal, Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie E. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 50 years old. Elsie is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Elsie operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester O. is from the village of Caluya. She is 55 years old, married and has three adult children. Ester owns and operates a business selling seafood. The main source of income for the business comes from selling "latu," the term for seaweed in the local community. Ester has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2006, Ester joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Ester is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase "latu" to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Ester from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase of latu (seaweed) for resale

loans.name: Querer Es Poder Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Querer es Poder” es conformado por 17 socias pertenecientes a la ciudad de  Rancagua.
Palmenia es la presidenta de este grupo, en la foto se encuentra a la izquierda, en 3º fila y viste un suéter blanco con figuras color negro y rojo. Ella tiene en  su casa una paquetería y librería y  además  vende comida rápida para llevar en la  casa  de al lado, la cual arrienda. Su hijo de 15 años y su marido, cuando llega del trabajo, le ayudan a atender los negocios. También tiene 3 hijos más, unos mellizos de 9 años y una pequeña de 4 años. Palmenia y su marido empezaron estos negocios hace 2 años, cuando su marido empeoró la visión de un ojo, lo cual era fundamental para el trabajo que realizaba como analista de sistemas. Fue entonces que tuvo que dejar su trabajo y ambos decidieron iniciar estos negocios con ayuda económica  de su suegro. Sin embargo, afortunadamente su marido pudo retomar su trabajo después, pero ella siguió con ambos negocios. 
Con este préstamo Palmenia comprará mercadería para sus negocios.
Su sueño es comprar la casa que arrienda y ampliarse para desarrollar sus actividades.. 
Esta muy contenta por el apoyo que recibe de Fondo Esperanza y de su grupo de trabajo del cual ha aprendido mediante las experiencias de sus compañeras.

Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O’higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 Km. de túneles.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Querer de Poder” is comprised of 17 members from the city of Rancagua.

Palmenia is the group president. In the photograph, she is seated on the third row to the left wearing a white jacket with red and black bands. She operates a parcel shipping center and bookstore out of her home. In addition, she sells fast food next to her house which she is renting. Her 15 year old son and her husband, when he comes home from work, help manage her businesses. Palmenia has three more children, 9 year old twins and a 4 year old daughter. She and her husband began these businesses two years ago when her husband began losing vision in one eye, which is essential for his job as a systems analyst. He then quit his job and both of them decided to start these business with financial assistance from her father-in-law. Fortunately, her husband later returned to his job but she continued to manage both businesses. With this loan, Palmenia will by merchandise for her businesses.

Her dream is to buy the house that she is renting and expand it so that she can develop her businesses. She is very happy with the support she has received from Fondo Esperanza and her Communal Bank. Palmenia has learned from the experiences of her fellow group members.

Rancagua is part of the Libertador Bernardo O’Higgins region. This modern city is one of the main producers and exporters of fruits and wine in Chile. It is also a mining city because it is the home of “El Teniente”, one of the largest underground mines in the world with 4500km of tunnels.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a bookstore & parcel shipping business

loans.name: Bernard Onyonyi

texts.en:
Benard is a 38-year-old man. He owns a butcher shop where he sells meat to his customers. He has been in the business for a period of about four years  and he gets a profit of approximately of $685 per month.

He was introduced to KADET by his group members and he has applied for his 1st loan. He hopes to improve his business using the loans he receives from KADET. Currently his target is to use the money to buy a motorbike for transporting the meat.

He hopes to buy a piece of land in the future to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transporting meat

loans.name: Yudy

texts.es:
Yudy es socio del Banco Comunal Delfín, Yusy es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 3 años, Yudy tiene un mototaxi con el cual realiza trasporte de pasajeros, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Yudy es albañil y realiza trabajados de construcción por contrata. Los sueños de Yudy son mejorar su negocio, brindar una buena educación a su hijo y comprar un carro para trabajar.
Yudy solicita un crédito de 2000 soles para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi y la compra del seguro.
texts.en:
Yudy is a member of the communal bank Delfín. He lives with his partner and has a 3-year-old son. Yudy has a moto-taxi with which he transports passengers everyday. He's also a bricklayer and does construction work on contract. Yudy's dreams are to improve his business, provide a good education for his son, and buy a car for work. He's requesting a loan of 2,000 soles ($725) for the maintenance of his moto-taxi and the purchase of insurance.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of moto-taxi and purchase of insurance

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of two young children. He has more than 20 years of experience running a small car repair shop. He is especially talented in car electricity repair. He also works on a freelance basis with some car repair shops who ask for his electrical services.  Today he is requesting a loan of $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.al. to purchase new tools for his business. In the future, he is looking to diversify his business and open a new shop where he can buy and sell car spare parts. His income is needed to help support his wife and two children and to pay the schooling fees.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita P. lives in Brgy. Gawi, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living through her food vending  business. Her husband, Richard P., age 51, works as a taxi driver to earn his living. They have two children between the ages of 15 and 25.
 
Anita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired toward something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Anita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,500, thus improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her tenth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase raw materials for her food vending business. Her goal is to continue to save up for the future, specifically toward children's education and her family's needs. Anita P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon, a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable." Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her food vending business.

loans.name: Arshavir

texts.en:
Arshavir H. was born in 1949 in Sevakar village, Kapan area. He is married and has two children, who are already married. 
Arshavir and his wife are farmers – they keep cows, calves, sheep and beehives. Arshavir’s working day starts at 6 a.m. and lasts till late evening, but he has never complained about it and deals with the hard work with pleasure. This kind of zealous work allows him to make good profit and keeps his family. Arshavir asks for a 750.000 Armenian dram loan to buy some sheep for his farm.

loans.use: To buy some sheep for his farm

loans.name: Zaven

texts.en: Zaven Sedrekyan lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the town of Artik.  He is university-educated.  Due to limited employment opportunities, for the past fifteen years he has been a self-employeed entrepreneur.  He owns a small business selling a range of clothing.  He is married with two children – a 17 year old daughter and a 19 year old son.  He supports his relatives with clothes from his store.  His dream is to have both his children graduate from university.  He considers himself an honest and hardworking person.  Zaven is seeking a loan to expand the range of clothing in his store.  With the investment he expects his family income to grow by 20 percent.  His store is in a good location and Zaven has many loyal clients.  Someday he would like to open a second shop and upon retirement leave the businesses to his children.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for his store

loans.name: Juan Hermilo

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Hermilo, es una persona que trabaja como supervisor en una maquiladora, en su casa viven sus hijos y su esposa, su esposa vende maquillajes y zapatos por catalogo, para ayudar en lo economico a su esposa y estar un poco mas libres de gastos, la casa se la descuentan a  Juan Hermilo a traves de la nomina, ellos ya es la segunda ocasión que solicitan un credito con esta institucion, siendo unas personas muy honestas y trabajadoras, ultimamente tienen unos vecinos que son muy conflictivos y  cuando los niños juegan se molestan, ellos tienen 2 visiones, una terminar la barda de bloque que empezaron con el primer prestamo, para tener mas privacidad en su casa y la segunda que los niños no se salgan a la calle yq que viven enfrente de un blvd. muy grande y temen que los puedan atropellar o ocurra un accidente. al tener la barda terminada, para la familia sera un gran alivio, tener privacidad y ver a su familia jugar en el patio de su propia casa.
texts.en: Juan Hermilo works as a supervisor in an assembly plant.  His children and wife live with him in his house.  His wife does catalog sales of makeup and shoes.  To help his wife out with the finances and to be a little more free with their expenses, they have their house payments deducted from Juan Hermilo's paycheck.  This is the second time they are seeking a loan with this organization.  They are very honest and hardworking people.  Lately they have had some troublesome neighbors who bother the kids while they are playing.  They have two goals: one is to finish up the cement wall they started with the first loan to make the house more private; and the other is for the kids to not have to go out to the street, because they live on a very large boulevard and they're afraid the kids could get run over or there might be an accident.  Having the wall finished will be a big relief for the family; they'll have privacy and the family can play on their own patio.

loans.use: To put up a wall.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a 32-year-old single mother living in her own permanent house with her child in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family dream is building rental houses to support her child in school. She owns a textile shop and has been in this business for nine years. This has enabled her to construct a permanent house. However, she longs to become a wholesale trader someday. Edith intends to buy more clothes to as the Christmas season is fast approaching

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Fany Carmita

texts.es:
Fany Carmita A. A. tiene 34 años. Es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada 20 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y otras labores profesionales, en esta ventanilla son 17 socios.

Fany se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Compra sus productos en Chillanes y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de maíz, fréjol, arbeja y chocho. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta hacer deporte conocer gente y festejar las fiestas.
texts.en:
Fany Carmita A. A. is 34 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  She has three children.

The 'Luz y Progreso' (Light and Progress) solidarity group is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office, in Chillanes canton.  This group is engaged in farming and other professional tasks.  The group has 17 members.

Fany is a farmer and she grows corn, beans, peas and 'chocho' (a type of bean native to the region).  She buys her products in Chillanes and sells them in Chillanes market and district.

Fany is requesting this loan to buy corn, bean, pea and 'chocho' seeds.  The support of this loan will help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to continue working and to provide her children with an education.

Fany likes to take part in sport, get to know people and celebrate the holidays.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr:
Jeune femme de 54 ans, célibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge,cliente de Hope depuis bientôt cinq mois. N'ayant pas pu finir ses études au lycée par manque de moyens, elle se lance dans la vente de poissons fumes qu'elle va acheter dans les régions poissonneuses au nord du pays. 
Elle vend en moyenne 150.000 fr a 300.000frs par semaine.Elle a rembourse son premier prêt avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables..
Avec le second prêt,elle compte renforcer son stock de poisson, acheter différents qualités de poisson en stock considérable pour éviter de voyager chaque semaine.
Tres remarquable par ses services, elle tient a aller loin avec Hope, jusqu'à ce qu'elle atteigne son objectif, ouvrir un grand dépôt de poissons fumes dans un marche de la place
texts.en:
54-year-old young woman, single with 2 children in her care, soon a client of Hope for almost 5 months.  Unable to finish her high school studies due to a lack of means, she started to sell smoked fish that she goes to buy in the fishing areas in the north of the country.  

She sells on average 150,000 fr to 300,000 fr per week. She successfully repaid her first loan and saved a considerable amount.

With the second loan, she intends to strengthen her stock of fish, buying different grades of fish in considerable amounts to avoid traveling each week.  Very remarkable for her services, she wants to go far with Hope, until she reaches her goal of opening a large smoked fish depot in a local market.

loans.use: Purchase of baskets of smoked fish, such as eel, carp, catfish

loans.name: Betty Patricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “URPI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Betty Patricia; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como docente en la provincia de Anta y distrito de cachimayo y también se dedica al negocio de manualidades, ella vende en forma independiente y ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de manualidades. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer las manualidades.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Urpi communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Betty Patricia is 41 years old, single, and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with her work as a teacher in the Cachimayo district, within the province of Anta. She also works in the handicrafts business and sells independently and by foot. She wants to expand her handicrafts business and is requesting the loan to purchase materials to make handicrafts.

Betty Patricia is happy for the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make handicrafts

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 64 años, vive en su casa que es propia,  al lado de su esposo y sus dos hijas adultas, quienes ya tienen familia. Desde hace 5 años, está laboriosa madre de familia se dedica a  la venta de productos de belleza a sus familiares y vecinas de su barrio. Por esta razón,  que todas las tardes a partir  de las tres de la tarde, se dedica a recorrer las calles de su barrio, para ofrecer sus productos de belleza y mostrar sus catálogos. Sólo trabajando de esta manera es que alcanza la meta de sus pedidos para la campaña del mes,  y es una de las primeras en vender más. Le gusta el negocio que realiza por que se entretiene  mucho conversando con cada uno de sus clientes, además le permite captar buena utilidades. Por ello se siente muy feliz, pero a veces se fastidia por lo que le demoran en pagar los créditos que dio, ya que eso le perjudica, y siendo así a veces que no puede  adquirir más productos. Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y sabe que este aporte le será de mucha utilidad para continuar realizando su negocio. Por ello, paga sus cuotas oportunamente  para acceder a otras ayudas en el futuro. De obtener el crédito solicitado, lo piensa invertir en la compra de más productos de belleza, para abastecer los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en: Ana is 64 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their two adult children, who also have families. For the past five years this hard-working mother has made a living selling beauty products to relatives and neighbors. Every afternoon after 3 she travels the streets of her neighborhood, offering her products and showing her catalogs. Only working in this way can she reach the goal of orders for the month, and she is one of the first to exceed it. She enjoys her work because she is entertained by conversing with every one of her customers, and it allows her to bring in good profits. She feels very happy, but she gets bothered sometimes because her loans get held up so sometimes she can't acquire more products. This is her 11th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she knows that this support will be very helpful in continuing her business. She plans to make her payments on time in order to have access to more aid in the future. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to invest in the purchase of more beauty products to supply the order backlog that she has.

loans.use: Stock up on beauty products

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 44 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona D. clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por producir frutas como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta D. pescado en el mercado D. su localidad.  Ella se dedica desD. hace mucho tiempo a esta actividad, por ello es conocida por muchas personas.  Isabel procura obtener el pescado fresco, para poder venderlo a buen precio a sus clientes. Los ingresos que le genera esta acitivadad le sirve para sacar adelante a su familia.

Isabel desea ampliar su negocio comprando mayor cantidad D. pescado y venderlo a mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Isabel, 44, is married and lives with her family in the TambogranD. farming zone, an area with semitropical weather known primarily for lemon and mango production, that belongs to Piura province and is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells fish in her local market.  She has been in this line of work for many years and is well known by many people.  Isabel tries to obtain fresh fish to sell to her customers at good prices.  Income from this activity is used to support her family.

Isabel wants to expand the business buying larger quantities of fish and sell it at a better price.  To reach this objective, therefore, she has requested a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Suy C., 38, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. C. is a farmer, earning an income of approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about $4 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $56 on food and $20 on the other necessary expenses. 

Chuney is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase fish to sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal BOLIVIA, en su Secuencia 13, está formado por 10 clientes, la mayoría D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. Pampahasi, que están ubicados por los alrededores D. la oficina D. Emprender las socias se dedican a la venta D. diversos productos como ser, D. ropa, carteras, cosméticos, venta D. comida. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron a excepción D. dos socias que pagaron con sus ahorros debido que 
Yolanda  Socia que asume el cargo D. presidenta del banco, se dedica a la venta D. pescado en la misma zona  cuenta esta actividad hace 10 años, el préstamo esta destinado a incrementar su capital, comprando productos para su venta. Casada con el señor Néstor tiene tres hijos. Asimismo, la socia Yolanda nos cuenta que, cuando ingreso a Emprender el muro D. su casa se estaba por caer, y con los créditos D. emprender realizo el arreglo D. su vivienda el cual ella esta agradecida.
Es una D. las representantes en su banco comunal, que ha sido elegida para el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado dentro del banco como garante y como compañera D. grupo. 
Nadia, es elegida como tesorera, se dedica a la confección y venta D. ropa. El préstamo esta destinado para incrementar su capital. Soltera tiene un hijo, vive con sus familiares en la zona D. Pampahasi. Su meta es tener su propia microempresa y realizar sus ventas al por mayor.
 Juan es elegido como tesorero  es una persona bastante responsable  ayuda a su madre con los gastos D. la casa  el trabaja el es un joven soltero  trabaja como chofer con la movilidad D. su mama con el dinero del credito realizara el mantenimiento D. su movilidad.
Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos sacan adelante a sus familias solas, están agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Bolivia village bank is in its 13 phase and is maD. up of 10 partners.  Most of the partners live in the Pampahasi area which is located close to the Emprender office.  The partners sell varoius products such as clothing, wallets, cosmetics, food, etc.  In the prior phase, all of the members paid back their debt except for 2 who paid with their savings.  Yolanda has become the new president of the group; she has sold fish in the area for the past 10 years.  The loan will be used to increase their working capital, buying more products for them to sell.  Yolanda is married to Nestor with whom she has 3 children.  When she started working with Emprender, the walls of her home were about to fall down, but with the loans she received, she was able to fix her home and she is grateful for that.

She was elected president because she has shown responsibility in the group as both the treasurer and a group member.

Nadia has been elected treasurer; she works making and selling clothing.  She will use the loan to increase her working capital.  She is single but has a son; she lives with her relatives in the Pampahasi area.  Her goal is to run her own small business and become a wholesaler.

Juan was also elected treasurer and is a very responsible person; he helps his mother with the household expenses.  He works driving the car that his mother owns.  He will use money from the loan to do maintenance on the car.

All the group members are very responsible people who work hard; many of them are the only source of income for their families.  They are grateful for the support they are receiving.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy peanuts and cashews

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefanía de Jesús vive en el barrio los Calamares de la ciudad e Cartagena allí se dedica a la confección de ropa que financia a crédito. Una compañera apoyó a Estefanía para iniciarse en el mundo de la confección, pues ella le  enseñó el arte para que  dos años después se dedicara a hacer sus propios diseños y conseguir una abundante clientela,  aprovechando que tenia una maquina adquirida desde  el año 1976, en la que aun confecciona, porque ella dice que la puntada de esta antigua maquina es la mejor.  Como Estefanía es muy creativa hace poco incursionó en la fabricación de adornos en cerámica y también a eso le gana dinero; Este es su quinto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y  su segundo credikiva, con él que comprará materiales e insumos como telas e hilos para confeccionar, aprovechando ahora que tiene muchos pedidos. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores:  “Agradezco la ayuda prestada y ojala sigan apoyando a los microempresarios que mucho lo necesitan.”
http://www.kiva.org/lend/187438
texts.en:
Estefanía de Jesús lives in Cartagena’s Calamares neighborhood where she manufactures clothes that she sells on credit.  A companion encouraged her to get into the dressmaking world teaching her the art so that two years later she was able to make her own designs and attain abundant clientele.  She took advantage of the fact that she had a sewing machine that she’d acquired in 1976, which she still uses, because she says that the stitch this old machine makes is still the best.  Because Estefanía is very creative, she recently went into making ceramic decorations and she makes money doing this as well.

This is her fifth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her second with Kiva.  She will use it to buy materials and supplies like, fabric and thread, to sew with taking advantage of the fact that she has many pending orders.

She sends the following message to lenders:  “I am grateful for the support provided.  I hope you will continue to support micro entrepreneurs that so need help.”


http://www.kiva.org/lend/187438

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie J. is 39 years old and married with four school-aged children. She lives at Bitibut, Sapang, Dalaga.  Rose Marie sells "Balut" (a boiled, fertilized egg) in the local community. She started the business eight years ago and has worked very hard to keep it going. She's earning a monthly net income of 3,600 out of this activity.

In 2002, Rose Marie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rose Marie has successfully repaid her previous loan of Php20,000. She is requesting her 15th loan of Php14,500, which will be used to purchase new stock. 

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new stock

loans.name: Aia

texts.en:
Aia is 41 years of age and married with three children. She has a business catching and selling ocean-caught fish.  She has one year of experience in this business. Aia needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase fishing equipment such as hooks & nets.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Aia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Aia's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment such as hooks & nets

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 27 años, vive con sus hijos y su madre en casa de sus padres. Hace más 12 años se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad en una tienda que posee, en este negocio su madre la ayuda en la atención hacia el cliente, mientras trabaja en algún trabajo temporal que se le presente. Desde entonces, cada mañana abre su establecimiento, que se encuentra en casa de sus padres, ellos la apoyan en todo para poder salir adelante. Parte de su trabajo consiste en  administrar su tienda, y procurar abastecerse de los productos que tiene mayor demanda por parte de sus clientes.  A lo largo de todo este tiempo, su negocio se ha establecido y por tal espera continuar invirtiendo en la compra de más productos y ampliar su tienda. Es su crédito número 3 con MFP, considera que ha tenido una buena experiencia en todos estos ciclos de  trabajo con el banco comunal que integra que a pesar de dificultades que han existido han sido superadas por lo  que renueva su compromiso de seguir siendo de una actitud responsable ante este nuevo préstamo que tiene. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar productos y poder abastecer su negocio. Asimismo desea comprar de sacos de abono ya que sembrará maíz en el terreno de cultivo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Isabel is 27 years old and she lives with her children and her mother in her parents' home. For more than 12 years she has sold basic necessities in her store. Her mother helps her out by waiting on customers so that Isabel can take other temporary work when it is available. She opens her store every morning. It is located in her parents' home and they have supported her in everything they can in order for her to get ahead. 

Part of her job is administering her store and stocking up on the products that are most in demand. Over the years, her store has become well-established and she expects to continue investing in more products and expanding her offerings. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She has had a good experience with the communal bank that she belongs to despite difficulties, which she has been able to overcome. Isabel is renewing her commitment to responsibility as she requests this new loan. With the loan, she will buy new products and stock her store. She would also like to buy fertilizer because she will be planting corn on the land that her parents farm.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 61 years old and married with 13 children aged between 18 and 36, two of whom are currently attending school. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years in his hometown of Kitale in western Kenya. He employs one farmhand and sells his produce of milk, maize, and beans to the local market. He also depends on his pension pay to cater for the needs of his family.

Sammy has made a loan request of 51,600 Kes from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow and buy additional stock of chickens. The income from these projects will help him meet the family's expenses. In the future, he would like to acquire two more dairy cows that will help improve his milk production. He faces the challenge of unpredictable weather conditions which makes it difficult to find enough animal feed, especially during the dry spell.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and buy additional stock of chickens.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina tiene 57 años, casada, vive en casa propia que esta ubicada en el Caserío San Eloy del Distrito de Tambogrande, su comunidad es rural y pequeña, con deseos de superase con el tiempo

Justina cuenta con un puesto de venta de ropa, frazadas y variedad de objetos para  obsequios, su negocio lo ha instalado en el lugar donde vive. Justina adquiere sus productos en la ciudad de Lima y los comercializa entre el público que diariamente acude a su negocio. Las prendas que vende son para todo público y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fidelizada. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le sirven cubrir sus gastos en su hogar

Justina está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería y ampliar el rubro del negocio, e ir creciendo poco apoco como empresaria.

Justina es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás
texts.en:
Justina is 57 years old and married. She lives in her own home, which is located in the neighborhood of San Eloy in the district of Tambogrande. Her community is small and rural, and its people have the desire to get ahead in the future. 

Justina has a sales stand where she offers clothing, blankets and a variety of gift items. She has set up her business in the place where she lives. Justina buys her products in the city of Lima, and she sells them to the customers who come to her business each day. The garments she sells are for all types of people, and she has a steady customer base. The income provided to her from this work allows her to cover her household expenses. 

Justina is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 Peruvian new soles to buy merchandise and expand the scope of her business. This will allow her to grow little by little as an entrepreneur. 

Justina is a very hard-working woman who puts forth effort every day to get ahead and achieve a better quality of life. The people who know her consider her a kind person who is always ready to help others.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and expand her business.

loans.name: Hum

texts.en: Mrs. Hum is a 58-year-old fish vendor and the mother of two children. She and her family reside in Siem Reap Province. To make a daily income, she always goes to buy fish from the fishermen, and she hurries up and brings her fish by motorbike to the market for resale. Mrs. Hum has a life partner in her husband, who is a boat deliverer and always uses his boat to pick up both domestic tourists and foreign tourists to see the view along the river for fees. One of her kids helps support him in the same business. As his boat is too old, he would like to repair it but he doesn’t have immediate cash. Mrs. Hum is seeking for a Kiva loan for her husband to mend the broken boat.

loans.use: to mend a broken boat for her husband.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel de 32 años de edad, solicita su primer credito para comprar un solar que le permitira en el futuro construir su propia vivienda y asi mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su familia, su esposa trabaja el cual lo apoya con los gastos familiares,  segun referencias comerciales y  personales es un hombre bien responsable con sus compromisos adquiridos y bien querido por sus vecinos y comunidad, su mayor sueño en la vida es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su familia, tener un trabajo digno que no les falte lo basico en  el hogar.
texts.en: Miguel is 32 years old and is requesting his first loan to buy a plot of land that he can build his own home upon in the future. In this way he will improve the living conditions for he and his family. His wife works and helps with family expenses. According to professional and personal references, Miguel is a good man who honors his commitments and is well liked by his neighbors and in the community. His biggest dream is to improve his family's quality of life, to have a decent job and to not lack the basics at home.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 12 children.
Josefina has a shop that sells breads, canned goods and snacks. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and breads. Josefina has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and breads.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y una hija, es casada, administra una tienda donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, lo atiende d 6:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. de lunes a domingo.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de aceite, pollo, galletas, refrescos, entre otros productos, esta compra le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y a tener mayores ingresos.
Su mayor sueño es incrementar la clientela para mejorar los ingresos y ayudar a su familia en los gastos necesarios.
texts.en:
Ana is married and lives with her husband and daughter.  She has a store, which she began on her own initiative, and sells basic needs items.  Her working hours are 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m., Monday through Sunday.

She is requesting a loan to buy oil, chicken, cookies, and softdrinks, among other items.  This will help strengthen her business and increase income.

Her dream is to increase her customer base and improve income so she can help her family cover household expenses.

loans.use: To buy oil, chicken, cookies, softdrinks, and eggs for her business.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is 43 years old, married to Waweru and has three children.

Loise has been manufacturing and selling metal products for the last three years. She was introduced to KADET by one of her friends who is already a KADET client, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use a loan of 30,000 KES to buy more materials to use in her metal workshop.

In the future Loise hopes to grow her workshop and produce metal products on a large scale.

loans.use: to buy more materials to use in her metal workshop.

loans.name: Rhina Esmeralda

texts.es:
Rhina, vive con su hija D. 10 años D. edad, ella administra un chalet, desD. hace 8 años, venD. productos domésticos, comida y lo tiene instalado en el parque municipal, lo atienD. D. lunes a sábado. El préstamo lo invertirá en compra D. productos como gaseosas, pan para hot dog y hamburguesas, aceite, tomates y condimentos, esta inversión le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio, ofreciendo mejor servicio a los clientes.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio rentable, que genere ganancias para ayudar a su hija y que esta continúe sus estudios.
texts.en: Rhina lives with her ten-year-old daughter.  For eight years she has been running a store, selling home products and food.  It's located in the town park and she works it Monday through Saturday.  She plans to use her loan to buy items like soft drinks, hot dog and hamburger buns, oil, tomatoes, and condiments. The investment will help her strengthen the business by offering better service to her customers.  Her goal is to have a profitable business so she can help out her daughter, who is in school.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, hot dog and hamburger buns, oil, tomatoes, and condiments.

loans.name: Efia

texts.en: Efia is married and has six children. Her schooling is up to the junior high level. Efia sells sugar and mortars in Abura, which she has done for 5 years. She is holding one of the mortars she has made in the photo. Efia helps her husband take care of the home. She will use this loan to purchase wood to make mortars to sell. Efia plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make mortars to sell.

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en: Hannington is a twenty-six-year-old married man with two children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the salon business and also running a video library for two years. His hardship is customers not returning films on time. His vision is to have a large stock of films, to sell computers and to educate his children. Hannington needs the loan facility to buy films, a printer and a modem for his video library.

loans.use: to buy films, a printer and a modem for his video library.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora devotes herself full-time to managing her fish selling business in the public market. She inherited this business from her parents. She had been managing it for almost 20 years. She decided to rent a stall in the public market to have a more convenient place to sell fish to her customers. She usually earns a monthly profit of P20,000. Profits earned went to stall rentals, electric bills, meals and school fees.

Melchora has four children and she has been separated from her spouse for six years.

She is now requesting for a loan of P10,000 to buy additional items such as fish, pork meat, and chickens to dress and sell in the market. She would like to increase her sales and keep growing as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy fish, pork meat, and chickens to dress and sell in the market

loans.name: Amuka Oaf Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Amuka OAF Group in Western Kenya! Arnold is the facilitator of the Amuka OAF SHG Group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Arnold takes care of one child at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and be able to build a house for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Arnold had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 7 bags on 0.5 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Arnold was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 0.5 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Arnold  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Arnold would like to build a new house for his family.

In 2012, the members of Amuka OAF SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Akouavi est une femme âgé(e) de 30 ans. Elle est mariée å un déclarant en Douanes. Elle a 03 enfants, dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 07 ans et le dernier a 1an et demi.  
Akouavi travaille comme revendeuse de produits cosmétiques depuis 2007.  Elle sert ses clients de façon ambulante après achat à LOME. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le fait de marcher pour vendre.
Akouavi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des parfums. Elle veut avec les profits réalisés avoir un étalage.
Dans les prochaines années, Akouavi voudrait ouvrir une boutique pour mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle aimerait subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Akouavi is a 30 year old woman. She is married to a customs broker. She has 3 children, 2 attend school. The first is aged 7 and the last is aged 18 months.
Akouavi has worked as a cosmetics reseller since 2007.She serves her customers as a mobile saleswoman having purchased her wares in Lomé. At present her principal difficulty is the fact that she has to walk in order to sell.
Akouavi   has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase perfumes. With the profits she hopes to be able to afford a stall.
In the next few years Akouavi   would like to open a boutique which would enable her to  better satisfy her customers’ demands. She says that with the profits, she would like to support her family

loans.use: to purchase perfumes.

loans.name: Ensherah

texts.en:
Ensherah is a 45-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of eight children.

Ensherah is selling milk and other dairy products that she makes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase materials needed for her business .

Ensherah is looking to improve her business so that she can finance her daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to make dairy products.

loans.name: Terbish

texts.en:
Terbish is a 70-year-old woman who lives with her husband in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her kids are all independent and employed. 

Terbish started her garment retailing business in 2008 when she retired from teaching. Her business is going well and it is very supportive for her living. Now that winter is approaching, she needs support to buy winter supplies. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says "First I was little scared to start a business considering my age and all, however now that I started it isn't scary at all. In fact, it makes me feel young again." 

She is requesting 2,000,000 Mongolia Tughriks (MNT) to purchase clothes for winter.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for winter.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 37 years old and has four children aged 6 to 13. She is married to a home builder. She has been selling vegetables  in a store she has run for 10 years. Valentine would like a loan in order to buy more tomatoes, eggplant, and spices to sell in her store. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children. She dreams of one day becoming a wholesaler of vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia lives in Uganda.  She is single and has 6 children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a cousin and her daughter).

Leonia has a pub business. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days a week. Leonia sells her products from home, by retail.  She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin for the festive season.

She also generates additional income through selling piped water. The main business challenges for Leonia include thieves, defaulters and the rainy season.  Because she works in a muddy place, this hinders her customers from reaching out to her.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and to own a fully stocked pub and also to educate her children up to university level.

Leonia lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Nelida Emilia

texts.es: Nelida tiene 38 años de edad  es separada y tiene 01 hijo de 16 años la cual sigue apoyando. Hace más de 10 años que Nelida se dedica a la  venta de comida, ya que cuenta con un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio,  ella brinda desayudo, almuerzo y cena,  con su trabajo y esfuerzo Nelida  ha podido brindarle educación a su hijo y también cumplir una de sus metas  comprarse su propio terreno. Con el fin de seguir mejorando  su negocio solicito el crédito para comprar una congeladora la cual le ofrecían a un precio económico. El deseo de Nelida es de terminar de construir su vivienda. Ella agradece a los prestamistas Kiva pues hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en: Nelida is 38 years old and separated. She has a 16 year old son that she continues to support. More than ten years ago, she started selling food and owns a small restaurant in her home where she offers breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Through hard work, Nelida has been able to provide her son with an education and also achieve one of her goals, buying her own land. She requested this loan with the objective of continuing to improve her business and will purchase a freezer which was offered at a good price. Nelida’s desire is to finish building her house. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders, for they have made her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 49-year old married and blessed with three children. He has been in business of hawking of assorted goods in Voi for the last ten years. He earns a monthly income of kes 19,800.

 He is requesting for his first loan with KADET ltd of kes 20,000 he plans use the funds to purchase more wrist watches, flashlights, basins, key holders, and knives. With the anticipated profits he plans to purchase a motorcycle to aid him in transporting his goods with ease.
 
He hopes to have a more profitable business that will enable him to educate his children to the college level.

loans.use: to purchase more wrist watches, flashlights, basins, key holders, and knives

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Madam Doris is 48 years old. She is married with two children. She is a hairdresser and has rented a shop in which she does the business. For six years, she has been in the salon business. She fixes weave-ons, braids and does both pedicures and manicures.  

She is applying for a loan to buy a hair dryer since the one she uses recently broke down. With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her earnings and improve her business. This is her second loan. Her dream is to expand her business and build a house someday.

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer for her salon

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr: KADIATOU est née en DÉCEMBRE 1967 à FAKOLA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali .Mme  KADIATOU est âgé de 48 ans avec 10 enfants dont 3 filles. Mme  KADIATOU réside à FAKOLA dans une famille nucléaire. Mme  KADIATOU s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de poissons fumés. Sa vente se fait à FAKOLA et environnants. Forte de  ses 5 années d’expérience dans le domaine, elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  troisième prêt. Mme  KADIATOU compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 colis de poissons fumés. EIle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant à une clientèle mixte. Mme  KADIATOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat de poissons fumés

loans.name: Pamella

texts.en:
Pamella is 42 years old married to Philemon and blessed with two children aged between 14 and 20 years old.She has been into vegetable and fruits business for ten years and earns a monthly income of KES. 15,000.

This being her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya,she intends to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale in the village as she anticipates to help her husband in paying school fees for their children from the expanded business profits.


Her dream is to expand her business for greater income.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rosemary would like to buy foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Yombo, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children. Two in primary school and one in secondary school. Elizabeth owns a small pharmacy near her residence selling human medications. She has been in this business for seven years and her business is licensed by the authorities.

She frequently faced with shortage of medications for malaria and water contamination diseases like cholera, typhoid and parasites. The situation is intense especially during the rainy season, occurring now in Dar es Salaam. She is in need of USD 750 to replenish her stock.

loans.use: Buy medications for pharamacy

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
María is 32 years old, is married, and has 8 children. Her husband works in the fields cultivating corn. She has a small store in her house, where she sells food products, such as salt, sugar, and cooking oil to her neighbors. She belongs to the “Clouds Group 1”, which is made up of two women. The other lady is Rosa Gomez Gomez, who works at embroidering cotton blouses, which she sells to people in the community, since this is a common type of clothing in the area where she lives. The loan will be divided in equal parts between the two. María will buy merchandise for her store (candies, pastas, cooking oil, rice, etc.), and Rosa will buy threads and cloth to increase her production of blouses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA TIENE 32 AÑOS, CASADA 8 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO CAMPESINO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZ, ELLA TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDITA EN SU CASA DONDE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO SAL , AZUCAR, ACEITE ENTRE SUS VECINOS . PERTENECE AL GRUPO NUBES 1 QUE ESTA INTEGRADO POR DOS MUJERES , LA OTRA SEÑORA ES ROSA GOMEZ GOMEZ QUIEN SE DESEMPEÑA COMO ARTESANA BORDANDO BLUSAS DE MANTA LAS QUE VENDE ENTRE LAS COMUNIDADES YA QUE SON IMPLEMENTOS TIPICOS DE LA ZONA DONDE ELLA VIVE. EL PRESTAMO SERA REPARTIDO EN PARTES IGUALES ESPERAN INVERTIR COMPRANDO DOÑA MARIA MERCADERIA PARA SU TIENDA ( DULCES, PASTAS, ACEITES, ARROZ, ETC,) Y DOÑA ROSA EN HILOS Y GENERO PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION DE BLUSAS .

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a small grocery store; To buy embroidery thread and cloth

loans.name: Mariyanis

texts.en:
Mariyanis has 7 children from 16 years old on down to 5 years old. Estefania, Mariyanis' oldest daughter (16 years old), depicted in this picture, "takes care of business" while her mother completes chores for the family.

Mariyanis is a full fledged businesswoman. She is farming some of the vegetables they sell in the store, right outside of the small shed where they sell the produce. She's had this business for two years now. Additionally, she has some rental property, which she keeps to supplement her income. It is not easy to care for 7 children, one right after the other in age! Mariyanis will use the loan to buy supplies for her store.

loans.use: To buy food, mostly rice, beans, plantain, and other local fruits.

loans.name: Melehet

texts.en: Melehet M. is a business woman who operates a women’s clothing stand in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Melehet has already successfully repaid four loans with Norwegian Microcredit, proving that she is a customer who can be trusted. Her last loan was for $1,000 and she is now looking for funding in the amount of $1,200. She plans on using her funds to increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.use: To increase and diversify her clothing inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Kuasopera

texts.en: Kuasopera is a married mother of seven who is 50 years of age. She is a new member of Levili Tuvao Centre. Her husband works for Samoa's Local Shipping Company, unfortunately his salary is not sufficient to support the whole family. Kuasopera heard of SPBD through the village women in her area so she decided to join. She is a hard working mother and is very active- she has always believed in working hard. She is looking forward to earning enough money so that she will be able to start another business so she will earn more money to assist in supporting her family.

loans.use: Kuasopera would like to start up her chips business.

loans.name: Kamuli B3(Iv) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Sylvia has a canteen business. She intends to use the extra profits to construct her own premises for business. Perusi has a beauty salon and wans to use the loan to buy a hair dryer. Afuwa sells maize and ants for a living. Racheal offers catering services and wants to use the loan to buy more utensils. Ruth wants to increase stock in her canteen.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in the current business and add in stock, to buy a hair dryer, to increase farm products, to buy more utensils for a catering business, to increase stock in a canteen

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah O.is a mother of four married and is 48 years old. She hails from and lives in Okoko, Lagos state. She sells drinks, provisions, and foodstuffs. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more drinks, provisions, and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, provisions, and foodstuffs

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon S. works selling a variety of fruits in a busy market; she earns around $2.50 a day of profit. Her husband is a land broker; he generally makes about $3 a day. They have one child who goes to school.

They have requested this loan because they would like to begin raising pigs, a popular and profitable activity in the province.

loans.use: This loan will be used to raise pigs

loans.name: Watan Yelie Group

texts.en: Ibrahim J. is 36 years and married, with 4 children. He is the leader of the group. Ibrahim started buying and selling cows when he was young but could not purchase more than one cow at a time due to lack of capital. With his previous loan he was able to buy two cows at a time, and he would like to expand his business even further to generate more income. The other group members operate different types of businesses. Saidu has a small local restaurant, Mohamed B. buys and sells cows, and Hassanatu B. and Alphajor B. own small grocery stalls in the market. All would like to expand their businesses. They are requesting loans of approximately $275 US per member. Group members guarantee each other in case of failure to repay the loan by any member, and the group already has some savings and are saving additional money weekly.

loans.use: Capital for expanding several businesses:  livestock, restaurant, and grocery stalls

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar A. prepares food for sale and also sells plastics and provisions. She is married and has 4 children. Business is going very well, so Mrs. A. wishes to increase sales. But she is running out of stock.

She is asking for an additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom N. is a villager in Thlork Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Sokhom N. and her husband, Mr. Seng Kong, own a part of rice field that is infertile. Thus, Mrs. Sokhom N. is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizer to improve her rice field.

Mrs. Sokhom N. is 45 years old and the mother of three children. One is employed in a garment factory and the other attends school. The youngest is too young to work or study.

Her husband appears on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to improve her rice field.

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en:
Sat P. (shown at the far left, with the rest of her group members) was nominated to be a group leader for a loan. In a group loan, all the members split the loan equally and guarantee that each will repay her portion.

All of these women live in a small village on an island in Cambodia's Mekong River, about 10 miles north of the capital city of Phnom Penh. They all help support their families by weaving silk into cloth; a middle man takes their finished products to sell in Phnom Penh's markets. To grow their businesses, they plan on purchaing more raw silk to weave.

From right to left, Sat's group includes:

1. Sat P., 45, who has been a weaver for more than a decade, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She is married to Khun San, a mason; they have one son.

2. KhO. O., 20, is a newlywed. She and her husband, a construction worker, married last year. . 3. P. Pheap and her husband, a fisherman, have six children. 4. Sitha C., 27, and her husband, Vuthy Touch, a boat driver, married this year. 5. Sreynheb P., 42, is widow with three children, all of whom are garment factory workers. .

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr: Dame A. Florentine est née le 01 Septembre 1982 à Lomé (TOGO). Divorcée, elle est mère d'un enfant; Ronaldo ATALEY âgé de 5 ans et scolarisé. Elle est revendeuse de divers produits de consommation courante dans le marché de Gbégamey qui est l'un des marchés de Cotonou. Elle exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. Avant cette activité elle faisait la distribution vente. Elle assure seule l'éducation de son enfant et les charges familiales. Le but essentiel de sa demande de crédit est de renforcer sa capacité financière afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mrs.Florentine A. was born on September 1, 1982 in Lomé (TOGO). She is divorced and the mother of one child; Ronaldo ATALEY, 5 years old and attending school. She sells various every day goods in the market in Gbégamey, one of the markets in Cotonou. She has been running this business for 5 years. Before this activity she was in the supply/ sale business. She, alone, provides for the education of her child and for the needs of the family. The essential goal of this loan request is to strengthen her financial ability in order to provide for the needs of her clients.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 bags of rice, one box of canned food, and 2 boxes of pasta

loans.name: Dora Veronica

texts.es:
Dora es costurera,  confecciona abrigos para damas de mediana calidad y los vende en la ciudad de El Alto. Esa es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que ayuda a su madre y hermanas, también se ocupa de pagar el alquiler (él y su familia viven en la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de la maquina Overloock de mediana calidad, lo que permitirá que mejore la calidad de sus productos.

Es su primer crédito en Impro pero nuestra evaluación indica que no tendrá ningún tipo de problema con las cuotas
texts.en:
Dora is a seamstress, making average quality ladies’ jackets. She sells the jackets in the city of El Alto. This work is Dora’s principal source of income, and with the help of her mother and sisters, Dora is able to pay the rent (Dora and her family live in the Villa Ingenio zone of the city of El Alto). Dora needs a loan to buy an average quality Overoock sewing machine, which will help her improve the quality of her products. This is Dora’s first loan with Impro but our evaluation indicates that she won’t have any problem making the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Mohammad Ashraf

texts.en:
Mohammad Ashraf is 28 years old. He is educated. He is one of the staff of the National Bank of Afghanistan. He has been involved in this business for more than 8 years but he lives in a rental house. With his salary he can support his family and pay the rent of his house, but he can't build a house or buy a house. A few years ago, he bought land but he was unable to build on it. Now he needs a loan to build a house and go to live in his own house.

Therefore he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis with a term of 18 months to start working on his land to build his new home and start a new life to help with his family better than now and make a bright future for his family.

Ashraf is happy with all parts of his family. He would like to say that it is really a big help for Ashraf. He wants to say that without this loan it would be impossible for him to undertake the work on his house. Finally, he would like to thank lenders around the world.

loans.use: to build a house on the land he owns

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia I. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She is a computer operator but due to unemployment, she began selling drinks and provisions. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says this will help her to maximize her profit. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders and to LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial and technical support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana forma parte del Banco Comunal “Señor Del Cautivo II” del distrito D. Independencia, provincia D. Huaraz, departamento D. Ancash.

Tiene 64 años D. edad y 5 hijos que ya no los tiene a su cargo, pero apoya, junto a su esposo, a sus nietos. Comenta que todo ha transcurrido tranquilamente en su vida y que ha tenido como logro la satisfacción D. ver a sus hijos mayores y trabajando, Juana venD. especerías en el Jr. Hualcán, cerca al jardín D. niños D.
