Huarupampa, negocio que ha crecido poco a poco, menciona que ella empezó con s/.3.00 y actualmente invierte diariamente un promedio D. s/.150.00 en sus molidos, Juana compra sus insumos D. los mayoristas que vienen  D. la zona costa.  

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,300, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, invertirá en la compra D. 19 sacos D. maní y con el saldo comprará ají.
 
A Juana le es importante trabajar porque afirma que todavía debe seguir adelante por sus nietos.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the communal bank called “Señor Del Cautivo II” in the district of Independencia in the city of Huaraz in the state of Ancash. She's 64 years old and has 5 adult children who no longer depend on her financially, but she and her husband support their grand-children. She tells us that she's had a good and quiet life and she has had the satisfaction to see her kids grow up and find good jobs. Juana sells spices in the area of Jr. Hualcan close to the children's park in Huarupampa. Her business has been growing little by little. She tells us that she began with little money and now she makes a good profit. Juana buys her ingredients from the vendors that come to her area who sell at whole price. With this loan, which she will repay within 8 months, she will purchase 19 sacks of mani and with the earnings she will purchase aji ( a Peruvian hot pepper). Juana thinks it's important for her to continue working in order to support her grand-children.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 19 sacks of Mani and Aji (Peruvian spices)

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y hamburguesas, trabaja con sus hijos que le ayudan a vender. 
Vive en la zona norte, Av. periférica de la ciudad de La Paz tiene tres hijos, dos están a su cargo y uno es independiente.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería ( Papa, salchichas, aceite, y salsas)
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Teresa sells salchipapas (Peruvian street food made of pan-fried sausages and French fries) and hamburgers for a living, working alongside her children, who help her sell the food.

She lives in the North Zone on Periférica Avenue in the city of La Paz. She has three children, two of whom are under her care while one is independent.

The loan will be used to purchase ingredients (potatoes, sausages, cooking oil and sauces).

This is the second time she requests a loan from Impro. Her good credit history qualifies her as a client 1, which means she adequately repays her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, sausages, cooking oil and sauces for street food sales

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami N. est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère d’une petite fille. Coiffeuse de formation, elle tient un atelier de coiffure depuis 3 ans à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle espère avec ce crédit équiper son atelier avec un séchoir et acheter des mèches et produits de beauté pour les revendre aux clients. Elle espère avec ceci gagner plus d’argent pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ami N., 33, is married and the mother of a little girl. A hairdresser by profession, she has been running a beauty parlor for 3 years in Lomé, the Togolese capital. She hopes to use this loan to equip her salon with a hairdryer and to buy hair extensions and cosmetics to sell to her clients. She hopes in this way to earn more money and better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase a dryer, hair extensions, and cosmetics

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina E. quiere hacer un baño nuevo, el que tiene ya esta muy deteriorado y en tiempo de frió es muy helado ya que esta hecho de cartón y lamina. Aparte esta en el exterior y  cuando se traslada del baño a su casa a salir  de ahí recién bañada teme a enfermarse ella y su niño o agarrar alguna infección en el estado que se encuentra.
El nuevo baño lo quiere construir dentro de su casa para no exponerse algún problema respiratorio con esta temporada.
Ella percibe ingreso de un negocio de abarrotes  el cual le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Paulina E. wants to build a new bathroom. The one she has is very deteriorated and during the winter it is freezing as it is made of tin and carton. In addition, it is located outside and when she has to go from the bathroom to her house after taking a shower she is afraid she or her child will get sick or get some kind of infection. Paulina wants to build her new bathroom inside her home so that she is not exposed to a respiratory problem during this season. Paulina counts on income from a grocery store that does very well.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a new bathroom.

loans.name: Aide Nely

texts.es: La señora Aidé es ama de casa, su esposo labora para una empresa en los estados unidos con una antigüedad de 12 años, ella esta al cuidado de la familia, ellos son un matrimonio sólido y empeñado a salir adelante,están solicitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en el frente de su casita para mayor seguridad del hogar.
texts.en:
Aidé is a housewife whose husband has been working for a company in the United States for 12 years. She is the caretaker of the family. They have a strong marriage and are determined to get ahead in life. They are requesting a loan for the construction of a fence in front of their small house to increase the security of their household.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a fence in front of their house

loans.name: Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El comité se había formado hace como un año atrás y la mayoría de las integrantes recien empezaban a lanzarce al mundo comercial, los créditos les había incentivado aún más.  El comité ha crecido bastante y ha ido mejorando en muchos aspectos se nota el crecimiento y el cambio de mentalidad en las señoras, el comité sigue en crecimiento y con ganas de superación de todas las integrantes.

Josefina R.  Vta Artesanias
Zulma G.	  Copetin
Cristina D.	  Vta Comestibles
Rafaela A.	  Vta Carbon
Maxima A.	  Vta  de Frutas
Carmen N.	  Vta de Ajos
Zulma G.	  Merceria
Andresa P.	  Comerciante
Erma V.	  Empleada
Norma F.	  Costurera
Cecilia B.	  Repostera
Martina L.	  Vta de Mani
Esmeralda C.	Vta de Bebidas
Mirna R.	  Copetin
Simona Balbuena	  Vta Leche
Mirna S.	  Copetin
Margarita P.  Vta  de Frutas
Gloria V.	  Vta de Ajos
Felicia G.	  Merceria
texts.en:
This group was formed a year ago and the majority of the members are new to the business world. The loans have helped give them even more incentive. The group has grown considerably and has been improving in many aspects. You can see the growth and the change of attitude in the women. The group continues to grow and is each member motivated to succeed. Josefina R. sells handicrafts. Zulma G. sells drink. Cristina D. sells food. Rafaela A. sells coal. Maxima A. sells fruit. Carmen N. sells garlic. Zulma G. has a general store. Andresa P. is a vendor. Erma V. is employed. Norma F. is a tailor. Cecilia B. is a pastry chef. Martina L. sells peanuts. Esmeralda C. sells drinks. Mirna R. sells drinks. Simona Balbuena sells milk. Mirna S. sells drinks. Margarita P. sells fruit. Gloria V. sells garlic. Felicia G. has a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: different products that the women sell or use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Livsandorj

texts.en: Luvsandorj R. is a thirty-eight-year-old single man who lives with his parents in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His parents are both retired and stay at home. Since 2000, Luvsandorj has been driving a mini bus along various city routes. He currently has two mini buses that serve different routes. He drives one mini bus himself and has hired a temporary driver for the other mini bus. He hopes to get married this year and settle down with his own family. He requests a loan to repair one of his mini buses.

loans.use: To fix his mini bus.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena Ruíz F. se dedica a su negocio de venta de chinelas que con mucho entusiasmo comercializa en su localidad siendo este un negocio del cual percibe las utilidades para mantener a sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera y debe proporcionar la educación a uno de sus pequeños por estar en la edad escolar.

Ella ha venido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las chinelas ya que requiere de estas para ofertarlas y así brindar las condiciones necesarias en su negocio y satisfacer a sus clientes. Espera muy confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena Ruíz F. sells sandals. She sells from her location with great enthusiasm, as it is through this business that she receives the profits to take care of her two children. She is a single mother, and she needs to educate one of her little ones because he is school-aged. She has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy sandals to sell. She wants to offer the necessary business conditions to satisfy her customers. She very trustingly hopes that the loan will be granted as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sandals

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị N. is a 25 year old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, N. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. N. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. N. is now requesting a new loan of 16000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Espirita

texts.es: Espirita tiene 52 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y madre soltera, vive en su casa propia con su hijo de 18 año y su hija de 11, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. A temprana edad quedo huérfana de madre, era la mayor de 4 hermanos por lo que se hizo responsable de ellos, trabajando en la chacra de sus vecinos quienes le pagaban en productos (papa y maíz) que los compartía con sus hermanos. En vista de que le faltaba dinero se propuso criar cerdos y luego vendía la carne a sus vecinos. Al pasar los años, a base de mucho trabajo, compró sus propias tierras agrícolas, en ellas sembró papas y arvejas, algunas veces le resultó muy rentable, como también tuvo pérdidas, pero jamás desistió en su trabajo. Fue así que logró construir su casa e instaló allí una bodega y desde hace 9 meses también tiene una pequeña librería de la que se ocupa su hija en sus tiempos libres. Espirita atiende su bodega mientras va conversando con sus clientes y brindándole un buen trato, puesto que valora la preferencia que le tienen, lo que le permite acumular dinero para cubrir la educación superior de su hijo mayor, con los anhelos de que sea un buen profesional. Mientras tanto, Espirita sigue trabajando hasta terminar de educar a su hija menor a quien también ama mucho. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos pasados demostró puntualidad en cada una de sus cuotas. En una oportunidad en que a su hermano le faltaba dinero para cubrir sus cuentas (ambos pertenecen al mismo banco comunal) ella pagó la diferencia, lo que muestra que aún sigue pendiente de sus hermanos menores. El dinero que ahora viene solicitado es para la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos y en mayor parte para adquirir cuadernos y papales para su mini librería.
texts.en:
Espirita is 52. She is a very hard working woman, and she is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her 18 year old son and her 11 year old daughter. They are the motivation for her efforts. At an early age she was left as an orphan without a mother. She was the oldest of four siblings, so she became responsible for them. She worked on the neighbor’s farm, and they paid her in products (potato and corn), which she shared with her siblings. In light of the fact that she did not have money, she set out to raise pigs. She later sold the meat to her neighbors. As the years passed, and after much work, she bought her own fields to cultivate. She planted potatoes and peas. Sometimes it was very profitable. There were also losses. But, she never stopped worked. That was how she was able to build her house and set up a store in it. As of nine months ago, she also has a small bookstore, which her daughter takes care of in her free time. Espirita takes care of her store while she chats with her customers. She treats them well, and she appreciates them. This allows her to accumulate money to cover her son’s high school expenses. The goal is for him to be a professional. Meanwhile, Espirita will continue working until she finishes educating her young daughter, who she also loves very much. This is her fourth loan with MFP. During the past loan cycles she has demonstrated punctuality in all of her payments. One time her brother did not have the money to cover his accounts (they both belong to the same community bank), and she paid the difference. This shows that she still watches over her younger siblings. The money that she is now asking for is to buy fertilizers for her crops. The larger part of the money is to buy notebooks and paper for her mini bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Ephraim Plus Group

texts.fr: Henriette B. est vendeuse des haricots, épices, et divers devant sa maison dans la partie nordique et la plus peuplée de Kinshasa. Son savoir faire et la bonne gestion ont fait prospérer son activité commencée avec un sac d’arachides comme capital initial. Aujourd’hui, Henriette est membre fidèle d’un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Ephraïm Plus ». Elle compte développer son affaire avec les prêts reçus de Hope RDC. Le prochain crédit lui permettra d’acheter des articles pour renforcer le stock. Actuellement, son activité lui génère un bénéfice de $50 par semaine. Son rêve est d’acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants. Henriette a 49 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont trois entre eux fréquentent l’école.
texts.en:
Henriette B. is a seller of beans, spices, and various other goods in front of her house in the northern and most populated area of Kinshasa. Her know-how and the right management practices are behind the prosperity of her business, which she started with a sack of peanuts as initial capital. Today, she is a loyal member of a Hope RDC group named "Ephraïm Plus". She intends to develop her business with the loans received from Hope RDC. The next loan will enable her to buy goods for bolstering her inventory. Currently her business generated a profit of $50 a week. Her dream is to buy a parcel of land for her children. Henriette is 49 years old, married, and the mother of six children. Three of them attend school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy items for bolstering her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina P. Chávez tiene la edad de 50 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo que dependen de ella. Rosa tiene la actividad económica de es la elaboración de cepillos, pastes de baño. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo e invertir en la compra de hilo, esponja, retazos, cloro entre otras cosas. Rosa es una excelente cliente ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar con Fundación León 2000. Es una mujer muy responsable porque en varias ocasiones siempre le ha gustado pagar con puntualidad. El sueño que siempre le gustaría cumplir es obtener su propia casa, para tener algo que sea realmente propio.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina P. Chávez is 50 years old. She is married, and has 3 dependent children. Rosa's economic activity is the manufacture of bath brushes and scrubbers. Rosa is requesting this loan for working capital to invest in the purchase of thread, sponges, fragments and chlorine among other things. Rosa is an excellent client since she has always enjoyed working with Fundación León 2000. She is a responsible woman who has always made her payments on time. Her dream is to obtain her own home, in order to have something that is really her own.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa is a member of the Salvadorean Mothers communal bank. She is 26-years-old, single, and does not have any children. She recently graduated from university where she studied nursing. She started working in a private laboratory part-time but left after a year to work in a hospital because she wanted to work in an area of medicine that could help her obtain the official title of nurse.

Due to the outbreak of AHN1 virus (swine flu), her hospital has required more uniforms for nurses and more face-covers. Rosa is able to make face-covers and uniforms and has been selling them to the hospital where she works. 

Rosa needs a loan of 1200 soles for the purchase of more fabric material to make more nursing uniforms. Her dream is to keep selling uniforms and save enough money to get her doctorate degree in emergency disaster relief.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Salvadorean Mothers communal bank. She is 26-years-old, single, and does not have any children. She recently graduated from a university where she studied nursing. She started working in a private laboratory part time but left after a year to work in a hospital because she wanted to work in an area of medicine that could help her obtain the official title of nurse. Due to the outbreak of H1N1 virus (swine flu), her hospital has required more uniforms for nurses and more face-covers. Rosa is able to make face-covers and uniforms and has been selling them to the hospital where she works. Rosa needs a loan of 1200 soles for the purchase of more fabric material to make more nursing uniforms. Her dream is to keep selling uniforms and save enough money to get her doctorate degree in emergency disaster relief.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more fabric material to make more nursing uniforms and face-covers

loans.name: Rita Maribel

texts.es: La señora Rita Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción - Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 37 años y es madre 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.Rita Maribel, se inicio con S/. 300.00 esto le sirvió para implementar su pequeño salón de belleza, ubicada en un local alquilado muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.Nos cuenta que hoy en día le va muy bien, ya que es conocida por sus amigos y vecinos, realiza diferentes tipos de tintes, peinados y cortes, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.En la actualidad ofrece el mismo servicio  y con el préstamo de  S/ 500.00, comprará sus materiales de trabajo como: laca en frascos, tintes de cabello en diferentes colores, oxigenta, talcos, shampos y cremas de pelo.Se siente una Mujer independiente, decidida y más segura, responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle el apoyo, para iniciarme con su actual negocio.
texts.en:
Rita Maribel belongs to the Mujeres en Acción – Picota Community Bank, Picota district, Picota province, San Martín department. She is 37, single, and has two children who are still dependent upon her and go to school. Rita Maribel started with a loan for 300 PEN, which she used to start her small beauty salon. It is in a rented location, which is well equpped to wait on her customers. It is going very well now. She is well known by her friends and neighbors. She does different types of dyes, hair styling, and cuts for women, men, and children. She currently does the same work. With this loan for 500 PEN she will buy work materials like bottles of hairspray, a variety of hair colorants, peroxide, talc, shampoos, and hair creams. She feels like an independent woman, determined, more secure, and responsible for making her payments. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for offering her the support to start up her current business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials she uses for hair styling

loans.name: Olexander

texts.en: Olexander is married with one child. He sells various electrical goods at the central market in Mukachevo town. Olexander has been in this business for 5 years. He tried selling several types of goods, but then stopped on the electrical goods. There is low competition because most entrepreneurs at the market sell clothing. Olexander offers good quality products at good price gaining good reputation among his clients. He would like to increase the assortment of his inventories. To do so Olexander needs 11,000 UAH. He has used microloans before and found them very helpful for his business development.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase items in bulk for her shop.

loans.name: Chizoron

texts.en: Chizoron sells foodstuffs in Lagos State, Nigeria.  She is determined to excel in her business and family life. She is 32 years old and married, with 2 children.  Her husband is very supportive of her business, and her children attend a private primary school. She is seeking a loan of N120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Dione Cecilia

texts.es: Dione Cecilia es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 28 años, es madre soltera de un niño, Diana se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, pues tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Flor de la Canela II” desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de telas. En la actualidad Diana necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra de una remalladora  con el fin de obtener buenos acabados de las prendas que confecciona. La meta de Diana es llegar a tener un taller de costura bien implementado.
texts.en:
Dione Cecilia is a hard working and dynamic woman. She lives in Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region, is 28 years old, and is a single mother of one child. Diana is a tailor and has a small workshop in her home. She has been a member of the Community Bank “Flor de la Canela II” for one year, and the first loan she took out was for 300 soles and was used for purchasing fabric. Currently, Diana needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to purchase a sewing machine so the garments she makes will be better produced. Diana’s goal is to have a well established tailor shop.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda G. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Linda is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Linda owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling hot cakes in the local community. Linda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Linda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Linda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan S. is from the village of Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 35 years old, married, and has one school-aged child.

Jonathan owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Jonathan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

Jonathan is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for the repair and maintenance of his transport vehicle to be able to have a good transportation services. This loan will be his third loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For the repair and maintenance of his transport vehicle

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe M. is from the village of Talairon. She is 47 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is thirty years old. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. Regina works very hard to help her husband provide for their family. 

Regina sells groceries by the roadside in her community. Regina buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy groceries in bulk to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Yameliz

texts.es: La Sra. Yameliz R. Z. solicito crédito para comprar y vender materiales de construcción en Managua a las fábricas de bloques, ladrillos, letrinas lavanderos y otros productos que ofrecen las empresas de construcción. Anteriormente era ama de casa y no contribuía a generar otras fuentes de ingreso en la familia, es el octavo crédito con Ceprodel, ella tiene 3 hijos en edades escolares y solicita este préstamo para generar más ingresos al núcleo familiar
texts.en:
Mrs. Yameliz R. Z. applied for credit to buy and sell construction materials in Managua at the factories that make cinder blocks, bricks, latrines, wash houses and other products that the construction companies offer. She was a housewife before and did not contribute generating other sources of income for the family. This is her eighth credit with Ceprodel. She has 3 school-aged children. She is applying for this loan to generate more income for her nuclear family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more Construction materials

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda S. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de oro City. She is 40 years old. Gilda is married and has ten adult-aged children. To make a living, Gilda owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Gilda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Gilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Gilda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in her business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Same

texts.en:
Mrs. Same V. (in the photo), 53, and her husband, Mr. Beun Brak, 54, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 km from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1980 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of the children are married and live in separate homes. The other two children work in a garment factory. One of them is disabled.  

Same has been a silk weaver since she was 16 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a farmer. 

Same is requesting her first loan of $150 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Adalayda Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Adaelayda B. es una dama muy trabajadora que se dedica a la actividad de venta de productos lácteos como queso y cuuajada que son elaborados por ella misma y ofreciéndolos en el mercado con la finalidad de obtener los ingresos propios para el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de su familia.

Actualmente ella está solicitando un crédito porque necesita la compra de la leche para realizar el queso y la cuajada y una vez realizados continuará comercializándolos en su propio local.
texts.en:
Adaelayda is a very hard working lady who makes and sells milk products such as cheese and milk curd. She sells them at the marketplace in order to create an income which she uses to improve her family's quality of life. She is asking for this loan because she needs to buy milk in order to make her products to sell in her stall at the marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Milk for cheese making

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama Francisco Javier C. Pérez, tiene 42 años de edad, casado, Obrero, él labora en la Alcaldía de su municipio, habita en una comunidad Rural que se llama Valle Las Mayorga, lugar de donde él también es originario al igual que su esposa, tiene tres hijos, dos mujeres y un varón, ellos están cursando la escuela secundaría y primaria.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de tres créditos, los que le han servido para realizar gastos personales y este último para mejorar su vivienda, vale mencionar que en los tres créditos otorgados anteriormente a este cliente ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Javier is 42 years old, married, and a worker. He works for the mayor's office of his municipality and lives in a rural community called Valle Las Mayorga. He and his wife are from there originally. They have 3 children, 2 girls and a boy, who are in secondary and primary school. He has had a total of 3 loans with our institution, which he has used for personal expenses, and the most recent, for making improvements on his house. It's worth mentioning that during these 3 previous loans, this client has been very responsible with his obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MATERIALS TO IMPROVE HIS HOUSE: BLOCKS, ZINC SHEETING, CEMENT, SAND AND NAILS

loans.name: Ayda Lina

texts.es: La señora Ayda Lina es casada con 4 hijos mayores de edad. La señora tiene una mini tienda ubicada en su casa de habitación, en la cual además de vender vestuario también vende zapatos, joyas y ropa de niño. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 12 años, primeramente su mama tenía una pulpería y fue la que la indujo a tener su negocio propio, ya que a través de ese negocio la señora mantenía a sus hijos. Allí fue que la señora  empezó a vender primeramente ropa al crédito, por encargo y poco a poco se fue haciendo de un inventario grande. Ella tiene bastante clientela ha logrado mantener el volumen de sus ventas. El crédito será invertido en la compra de  mayor cantidad de mercancías para surtir más el negocio. Su deseo siempre ha sido construir un local más grande y apropiado para su negocio, ya que actualmente utiliza la sala de su casa.
texts.en:
Ayda Lina is married and has four grown-up children. She runs a small store out of her home selling clothing as well as shoes, jewelry and children's clothes. She started this business 12 years ago. Her mother used to have a convenience store, and that is what led to her starting her own business. Despite working, Ayda still was able to care for her children. She started out just selling clothing on credit and little by little she has built up her inventory. Ayda has a good clinetele, which has helped her keep her sales steady. She plans to use the loan to purchase larger quantities of merchandise to better stock her store. Her dream has always been to build a larger place and set it up for her business since she currently uses her home's living room.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en: When she started her business last 2001, her goal was to make her business grow to support her family. Gilda A., 45 years old, tills a small rice field which is 1- hectare in size. She has 4 children. Her eldest child is 10 years old. She wanted to have an abundant harvest but lacks capital to buy the entire farm supplies. She would like to request a loan of PHP 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will really help her go on in her farming business and to have sustainable income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng V. L. is an old, married mother blessed with two kids, whom she cares for, as the children attend school. To help with the family’s living expenses, Seng V. L. is a professional teacher in the secondary school. She has been receiving a suitable salary to resolve the family's financial problems. Seng V. L.’s husband is a farmer. He grows different types of crops on their own farmland to earn for his responsibility for the family's daily living expenses. Seng V. L. has dug a medium pond where she wants to feed fish for extra income. Because Seng V. L. doesn’t have capital, she has decided to look for a loan to buy stock of small fish to raise.

loans.use: To buy small fish to raise.

loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa P. vive en el sector del Cruce, que es perteneciente a la Parroquia de Sinincay, esta parroquia se encuentra ubicada al noreste del cantón Cuenca. Limita al norte, con la parroquia Chiquintad, al este y al sur, con la ciudad de Cuenca, y al oeste, con la parroquia Sayausí. Dentro de Sinincay, sus artesanos se especializan en la producción marmolera, la fabricación de tejas, ladrillos, y algunas mujeres se dedican a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla. La iglesia parroquial tradicional por su belleza arquitectónica, la colonial imagen de la virgen de la Visitación que reposa en ella, es el atractivo más importante que ofrece la parroquia, muy visitado por los turistas.

Doña Rosa esta cerca de cumplir los 60 años tiene dos hijos, su primera hija es de profesión costurera y su segundo hijo albañil y son los que ayudan  a la economía del hogar, con mucho y orgullo de ello ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestras socia tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual vende bien ya que cuenta con su clientela, nos comenta que al principios le fue muy difícil ya que no tenia mucho dinero para incrementar su negocio pero poco a poco ha logrado superarse, se encuentra hace dos ciclos en el bankito y ha llegado a tener una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras; con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercadería y su meta es que su tienda crezca.
texts.en:
Rosa P. lives in the Cruce area, which is part of Sinincay parish. This parish is located to the northeast of the canton of Cuenca. Its border to the north is the Chiquintad Parish; to the east and south, the city of Cuenca; and to the west, the Sayausí Parish. Within Sinincay, artisans specialize in the production of marble, the production of tile, bricks, and some women make straw hats. The traditional parish church, with its beautiful architecture and colonial image of the Virgin of the Visitation, who is buried there, is the most important attraction offered by the parish and is visited by many tourists. Rosa is about to turn 60 years old. She has 2 children. Her eldest daughter is a dressmaker, and her son is a bricklayer, and they both help out with the household expenses. She takes great pride in having built her own home. Rosa has a small store which is selling well and has an established customer base. She tells us that at first it was very difficult because she didn't have much money to expand her business, but gradually she managed to overcome this problem. She has had two loan cycles with her communal bank, and has developed a great friendship with her fellow group members. With her new loan, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise, since her goal is to see her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, meat, eggs and vegetables

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen B. is from the town of Banga. She is 49 years old. Helen is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She also owns a rice farm that her husband manages. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Helen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & farm supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Helen from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & farm supplies

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Mrs. Hai C. (in the photo), is 40 years old and her husband, Mr. La Seang, is 38 years old They have been married for twenty years and have six children: one son and five daughters. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Hai has been selling vegetables in the local market for 3 years. Her husband has been a construction worker for 20 years. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $300 to help finance her husband's purchase of a motorbike to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa B. sells rice, vegetables, palm oil and other foodstuffs at Elmina. She has received junior high education. She is married to a mason and has three children.

Adjowa has been selling rice and other foodstuffs for seven years, supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

Adjowa hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to build a better shop for her goods.

loans.use: To buy more of foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Dante

texts.es:
Dante vive en la casa de su primo cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz, zona Achachicala. El trabaja en el sindicato de transporte Eduardo Avaroa como chofer socio propietario y esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención, tiene una hija.  
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de un motor para su vehiculo el cual le ayudara a trabajar mejorar.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Dante lives with his cousin and their home is located in the cit of La Paz, in the Achachicala district. He works for the transport company Eduardo Avaroa as a driver and part owner. This is his primary source of income. He has one daughter. This loan will be used to purchase a new engine for his car. This will improve the efficiency of his work. This is his first loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for his bus.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Maria Margarita tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es la venta de comida en donde ofrece diversos platillos esta no es la primera experiencia que tiene con créditos. Debido a que el sueldo de su esposo es muy poco, ella decidió hace ocho años iniciar su propio negocio, el cual le permitiera contribuir junto a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar, idea que nació con la iniciativa de tener una mejor estabilidad económica. Solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en granos básicos, verduras, frutas, gaseosas, jugos, bolsas y servilletas. Sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita is 52 years old. Her business is in the sale of food, where she offers a diverse variety of dishes. This is not the first time that she applies for a loan. Due to her husband's salary being small, eight year ago she decided to start her own business which would help her along with her husband to contribute to covering the home expenses. This notion was born from the desire to be more financially stable. She is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy basic grains, vegetables, fruit, sodas, juices, bags and napkins. She dreams of enlarging her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Asankadir

texts.en:
Asankadir K. is 53-year-old farmer who lives in At-Bashy village, in the north of Kyrgyzstan. He is married and has six children. His spouse is a housewife who keeps their hearth and home in harmony.  

Asankadir worked as a driver at the local combine complex and retired on a pension. But, his pension and his wife's pension, combined, doesn't meet their household expenses. They decided to engage in cattle breeding to make extra income. Asankadir used his initial capital of 10,000 KGS to buy livestock and managed to multiply its number. In order to broaden his business, he applied to Bai-Tushum and Partners for his first loan and repaid it without any delays.  

For the further enlargement of his business, Asankadir plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to buy one horse and sheep. With the revenues, he plans to renovate his barn in order to provide good conditions for cattle maintenance. Also, in the future, Asankadir dreams to buy a minivan and return to his favorite transportation work activity. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Fe Marie

texts.en:
Fe Marie M. is from the village of Cutar Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old. Fe Marie is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Fe Marie manages a business offering manicures and pedicures around their village. Fe Marie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fe Marie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe Marie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fe Marie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fe Marie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
This is Rosaline C., 35. She is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Arnel C., a driver, and is the mother of a college-aged young adult. By the grace of God, Rosaline has managed to support her child's schooling up to college level - a dream for most Filipino parents like Rosaline as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children. At this time, she is working hard to continue providing her child and her family enough to finance their everyday expenses. 

Rosaline operates an accessory business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then sells it piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 350 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php21,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Rosaline dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Apayi

texts.en: Apayi A.  is currently in the business of selling fish  and is requesting a loan to stock more fish and some tomatoes to sell.  Apayi is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more fish and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
Pastora es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 45 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, con un hijo y con grado D. instrucción D. primaria completa.
Pastora trabaja con artesanía, elaborando todo tipo D. tejidos en miniatura, además del engorD. D. ganado. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace cuatro años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Ahora  solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Su sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir la alegría.
texts.en:
Pastora is a member of the “Ciudad Nueva” community bank.  She is 45 years old and married with one child.  She completed her primary education.

Pastora is a craftswoman.  She makes all kinds of small knitted items.  She also fattens cattle.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and it enabled her to increase her business capital.

She is now requesting a new loan for 2,000 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to continue moving forward with her business.  What she likes about her community bank is sharing happiness.

loans.use: To increase the working capital of her craft business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Charán Coposo del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona ubicada en la región Piura que se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella realiza los pedidos de sus clientes a una empresa distribuidora, a más pedidos sus ganancias aumentan, por ello siempre se encuentra en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes. Adicionalmente cría ganado ovino para comercializarlo. Con los ingresos que ella obtiene de esta actividad ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía diaria de su familia.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio de venta de cosméticos instalando un pequeño establecimiento que cuente con un inventario fijo de productos, así sus vecinos no tendrán que esperar a que llegue el pedido sino que contarán con los productos que necesitan al alcance de la mano, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles..

María es una mujer responsable y hogareña, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old, has three children, and lives with her family in the village of Charán Coposo in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, located in the Piura region about four hours from the city of Chiclayo (capital of the Lambayeque region).

She sells beauty products from catalogs.  She places orders for her customers with a distribution business.  The more orders she places, the more income she earns, so she is always in search of new clients.  She also raises sheep to sell.  With the income she earns from these activities, she helps her husband with their family expenses.

She would like to expand her cosmetics sales business by opening a small establishment where she can have a set inventory of products.  This way, her neighbors won't have to wait for their orders to arrive, and they can count on having the products they need on hand.  In order to achieve this goal, she has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

María is a responsible woman.  Her dream is to continue growing her business to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to start a home business

loans.name: Solidario Esfuerzo Con Vición Group

texts.es:
solidario Esfuerzos con visión.
La señora Edilma  Isabel L.  García,  tiene cuatro años de iniciar su negocio de venta de papas y pollo frito, al principio solo vendía las papas con el pasar del tiempo los clientes le pedían pollo frito, su carreta era pequeña y ahora ya tiene una carreta mas grande.  Su sueño es tener un pequeño local con mesas  donde pueda atender al cliente y darles un mejor servicio,  Al lado de sus dos hijos y su esposo seguirá luchando para salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para compra de productos comestibles para elaborar comida  También se une al grupo la señorita Claudia Jeaneth  M. quien con 30 años de edad desea seguir creciendo en su negocio para poder realizar sus sueños como vendedora, desea el crédito para comprar productos comestibles  aun tiene muchas metas para su vida y desea realizarlos.   El señor Anselmo L. G. quien viene de un lugar muy lejos para superarse cada día, solicita la oportunidad del crédito y así seguir luchando al lado de su familia, su venta de ropa variada está creciendo y en estas fechas navideñas desea aprovechar la demanda de los clientes para poder tener buenas ganancias y así tener un local muy grande donde pueda exhibir la ropa y no estar en la calle. Con el  crédito desea comprar mas variedad de ropa.
texts.en:
Esfuerzos con Visión (Efforts with Vision) Communal Bank

Mrs. Edilma  Isabel L.  García stated her fried potatoes and fried chicken business four years ago.  She used to just sell the potatoes.  As time went by customers would request fried chicken too.  Her cart was small but now she has a bigger one.  Her dream is to have a small locale with tables where she can take care of customers providing better service.  She will continue to struggle to get ahead alongside her husband and two children.  She is asking for the loan to by ingredients to prepare her food.

Miss Claudia Jeaneth  M., 30, joins the group hoping to continue to grow in her business in order to reach her dreams as a merchant.  She wants the loan to buy foodstuffs; she still has many unmet goals in life that she wants to accomplish.

Mr. Anselmo L. García who comes from very far away every day to get ahead is asking for the loan to continue struggling alongside his family.   His assorted clothing sales business is growing and he wants to take advantage of the Christmas season’s increased customer demand in order to have large profits to have a large locale where he can display and sell his clothes and not be in the street any longer.  He wants to use the loan to buy more assorted clothes.

loans.use: To buy edible products and to buy clothes.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Santiago de 61 años de edad, casado con la Señora Myrian de 55 años  de edad, tienen  3 hijos, mayores que trabajan en el extranjero, el señor Santiago se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados, empezó realizando la venta llegando a entidades públicas y casas particulares, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación fue logrando salir adelante y gracias a la ayuda de su cónyuge ahora ya cuentan con un local en su casa y desde allí realiza su venta.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo y confianza, con este crédito otorgado realizara la compra de mas mercaderías de temporada como blusas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas y calzados, de esa forma seguir ofreciendo a toda su clientela prendas variadas y al mejor precio.
texts.en: Santiago is 61 years old and married to 55 year-old Myrian.  They have three grown-up children who live abroad.  Santiago sells clothes and footwear.  He started in this business going to sell his products in public companies and private homes.  Through a lot of hard work and commitment he has managed to get ahead and, thanks to his wife's help, he now has a sales location in his home and he sells his products there.  He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for their support and trust.  He will use this loan to buy more seasonal merchandise such as blouses, dresses, pants, shirts and footwear.  In this way he hopes to continue offering his customers a variety of garments at the best possible price.

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants and footwear

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANDENES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella tiene 58 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también se dedica a la agricultura, la socia siembra verduras como papa, maíz y habas y también siembra frutas como platano, naranjas, uvas y manzanas, la socia las frutas y verduras lo vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras y frutas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas y verduras al por mayor.  
         
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the "LOS ANDENES" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Marina is 58 years old, married and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  She also works as a farmer.  She grows vegetables such as potatoes, corn and beans.  She also grows fruit such as bananas, oranges, grapes and apples.  She sells her fruit and vegetables as an itinerant street vendor.  She would like to expand her fruit and vegetables business.

Marina is requesting her loan to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Don  Luis Enrique B. es un señor de 49 años de edad quien labora como Vigilante en una empresa de impresiones desde hace 7 años. 

Don Luis vive en Ticuantepe desde hace 47 años, el es casado con una persona que depende de el.
El también tiene otros ingresos como son los que le genera la pulpería.

Este crédito es el primero y lo solicita para invertirlos en la compra de productos básicos de la pulpería de tal forma que le permitan diversificar la mercadería y poder hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Don  Luis Enrique B. is a 49 year old gentleman who has been working as a guard for a printing business for 7 years now.  He has lived in Ticuantepe for 47 years.  He is married and his wife is dependent on him.  He also has other income such as the income generated by a small general store.  This is his first loan.  He will use it to buy basic products for his store that will allow him to diversify his merchandise and grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and other products for his general store.

loans.name: Mustopi

texts.en: Mustopi is a 35-year-old married man with six children, who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for the last three years, and the business is now at its boom stage. His vision is to become a wholesale businessman and educate the children. Mustopi needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, and posho to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and posho to sell

loans.name: Maria Claudia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Claudia Q. R. tiene la edad de 27 años, estudio hasta el  tercer grado de secundaria y esta casada con el señor Victor Fabian con el cual tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son mujeres y uno es hombre  a los cuales llamo Kenia y Kevin de 9 años que asisten a la primaria ellos son gemelos y Michelle de 2 años. Doña Claudia y su familia viven en a comunidad de  Mata Naranjo a treinta y cinco minutos del municipio de Tierra Blanca en el estado de Veracruz.

Doña Claudia nos platica que desde hace tres años decidio iniciar su propio negocio de venta de refrescos y tacos, los tacos los vende los fines de semana(viernes, sabado y domingo) en un pequeño corredor de palma que le construyo su esposo. Ella decidio iniciar su propio negocio porque desea ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la escuela de sus pequeños. 

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de carnes, chiles, tomates, cebolla, tortillas, aceite, gas, refrescos, rabanos, col, servilletas, cebollines y limones.

Ella desea en un futuro seguir trabajando para con sus ganancias darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños y contruir un pequeño local en la parte de enfrente de su casa que da a la carretera ya que piensa que en ese espacio veran mas su negocio, sus clientes y sus ganancias aumentaran.

Ella se encuentra agradecida con la fundacion por llevar este tipo de creditos hasta su cominidad los cuales ayudan a las familias a seguir invirtiendo en sus negosios y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Claudia Q. R. is 27 years old.  She studied up to the third year of high school and is married to Victor Fabian with whom she has three children: two daughters and one son.  Her sons are called Kenia and Kevin.  They are 9 year-old twins and attend elementary school.  Her daughter Michelle is 2 years old.  Claudia and her family live in the community of Mata Naranjo which is thirty-five minutes from the town of Tierra Blanca, in the State of Veracruz. 

Claudia tells us that three years ago she decided to set up her own business selling soft drinks and tacos.  She sells her tacos on weekends (Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays) under a little palm-leaf porch that her husband built for her.  She decided to set up her own business because she wanted to help her husband cover their household expenses and their children's education.

Claudia needs this loan to invest in buying meat, chili peppers, tomatoes, onion, tortillas, oil, gas, soft drinks, radishes, cabbage, napkins, scallions and lemons.  In the future, she would like to continue working so that she can use her profits to provide her children with a better quality of life and build her own premises in the front part of her house that faces onto the street since she thinks that her business will be more visible from this space which means that her customers and profits will increase.

Claudia is grateful to Fundación Realidad for bringing this type of loan to her community as they help families to continue investing in their businesses and to provide a better quality of life to their children.

loans.use: To sell soft drinks and tacos

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud Y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 54 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tenido dos hijos, los dos son mayores pero su hija  vive con ella, su marido es chofer.

Tiene un pequeño comedor en un local que es de su suegra que le dio para que instale su negocio sin cobrarle arriendo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 5am hasta las 14h00, solo preparar desayunos y almuerzos, su especialidad es el pescado apanado, nos cuenta que a sus clientes les encanta este plato tan delicioso, su hija le ayuda en su negocio, dice que ya son varios años y que le ha ido bien gracias a Dios.

Este crédito es para comprar productos que luego ella utiliza en la preparación de los alimentos. Como arroz, pescado, colas y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal hace 13 años y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho.  Sus sueños son tener su propio local y un restaurante más grande.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Salud Y Vida (Health and Life Communal Bank) meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto. This locality is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes from two of the province’s best beaches, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here, we become acquainted with señora Angela, age 54. She maintains a common law relationship in which she has had two children. Both are grown, but her daughter lives with her. Her husband works as a driver.

She has a small restaurant in a location belonging to her mother-in-law, who gave it to her without charging rent so that she could set up her business. She works every day from 5:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. preparing breakfasts and lunches only. Her specialty is fried fish. She tells us that her customers love this delicious dish. Her daughter helps her with the business. She says that they have been in business for several years and are doing well thanks to God.

This loan is for the purchase of products that she will use in the preparation of meals, such as rice, fish, colas and other ingredients. This member was one of the founders of the communal bank 13 years ago. She likes it because it has helped her a lot. Her dreams are to have her own place of business and a bigger restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase rice, fish, colas and more ingredients for the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Vilma, D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en Usulután, vive con su esposo, no tienen hijos, ella se dedica a la administración D. una tienda, donD. ofrece productos D. consumo, el cual lo tiene desD. hace 5 años.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería, ya que quiere reforzar el inventario comprando materiales que son demandados por los clientes y que espera le dé lo resultados el aumento del comercio.
Su objetivo es invertir en el negocio para fortalecerlo ya que D. él dependen económicamente ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Vilma, 43, lives in Usulután with her husband; she doesn’t have children.

She runs a grocery store selling consumables that she’s had for five years.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise because she wants to strengthen her inventory buying merchandise that’s requested by her customers hoping the result will be an increase in commerce.

Her goal is to invest in the business to strengthen it because she and her husband depend on it economically.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Nueva Semilla Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”NUEVA SEMILLA”, está iniciando su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de ocho  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Adela. 

Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos Tienda de barrio, macramé, costura, venta de frutas, taller de tejido de mantas y chalinas, venta de chuño, venta de verduras, repostería.

La presidenta, la señora Adela es una mujer de 40 años es soltera y tiene una hija. Este es su segundo año que trabaja con asociaciones comunales,  desarrollando un negocio sola. 

En la actualidad comercializa frutas, las que compra de la zona de El Tejar (de los carros); con el crédito que sacará pretende iniciar un negocio de tejido, los que venderá los días viernes en la ex tranca de 8:00 a 15:00..

Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella respondió que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The  ”NUEVA SEMILLA” [New Seed] Communal Association is in its second cycle in the Regional Office of the Andes. This community association has the participation of eight members. The board of directors has Adela as president. 

The women's business' are different. Among them are: neighborhood store, macramé, sewing, fruit selling, a blanket and shawl weaving workshop, selling potato flour, selling vegetables, and pastries.  

The president, Adela, is a 40 year old woman. She is single and has a daughter. This is her second year working with community associations, developing a business by herself. 

At present, she sells fruit. She buys them in the area of El Tejar (from the trucks); with the loan she will take out, she plans on starting a weaving business. She will sell her product on Fridays at Extranca from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

When we asked her what she likes the most about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the trainings.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia C. lives in Pta. Miray, Baliangao and has three grown children. For the last five years, she has made a living by running a general store and earns a monthly income of about PHP 2,800.

In 2004, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five previous loans and is applying for a new one, for PHP 30,000, to buy new items to sell to her customers. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 49 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like curtains, pants, shirts, etc.

Emelia has taken out and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ready-to-wear business for seven years and also earns income from transportation (tricycle--a three-wheeled transport vehicle).

Emelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
José es un cliente de 68 años de edad, que vive en casa propia con su esposa. La casa está ubicada en la parte rural del distrito Tambogrande  en Piura. 

La actividad que desarrolla José es la crianza de ganado ovino y agricultura, cuenta con una experiencia de 10 años en este rubro. José comercializa a los ovinos, una vez que han alcanzado  tamaño y peso ideal, en el mercado local. Además, cuenta con una pacerla  donde cosecha limón semanalmente.

José solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles  que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado.

José es un cliente conocido para nuestra entidad cancelo puntual y responsablemente su crédito anterior que también fue  un préstamo KIVA.

José es un señor trabajador que desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 68 years old and he lives in a house of his own together with his wife. The house is located in the rural region of the district of Tambogrande in Piura.

Jose's business activity to raise sheep and agriculture. He has 10 years' experience in the field. He sells his sheep once they have reached an ideal size and weight in the local market. Additionally, he also has a parcel of farm land where he harvests lemons weekly.

Jose requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

Jose is a known client to our organization and he has repaid his past loan, also acquired through Kiva, on time and in a responsible manner. 

Jose is a hardworking person who wants to improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his sheep.

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Sifa is 51 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 24 and 28 years old. She takes care of five children. Sifa sells sacks of charcoal and has 1 year of experience. She employs two people to help her. She runs her business from 7am to 9pm every day. 

Sifa has requested a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell. With the profits, she will be able to save money in order to expand her business and to pay children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio, de 56 años reside en el caserío de Antabamba, se caracteriza por ser un padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Julia de 57 años y sus 3 menores hijos, a quienes cuida con mucha dedicación. Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene Ignacio en su chacra, le han ayudado a mejorar la economía de su familia, ya que junto a su esposa son los encargados de velar por el bienestar de sus hijos, es por eso que trabaja todo lo que puede, sembrando papa, arvejas, habas, maíz y hortalizas, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos, ya que sabe que unos productos sanos se venden a mejor precio. Lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que subir los empinados cerros del poblado de Antabamba, que es donde tiene sus terrenos agrícolas. Además de recibir el apoyo de su esposa que se dedica a la compra y venta de reses, donde los enseba para luego venderlos a un mayor precio. Es por ello que para el futuro espera mejorar sus chacras y sembrar en totalidad todas sus tierras. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los pinos de Antabamba” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Ignacio de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja, 20 sacos de semilla de papa de la variedad “yungay”, abono orgánico y fertilizantes naturales.
texts.en:
Ignacio is 56 years old and lives in the small village of Antabamba.  He is noted for being a very simple and hard-working father.  He lives in his own home together with his wife, 57 year-old Julia, and his three dependent children who he looks after with a lot of dedication.

Ignacio's arduous workdays on his farm have helped him to improve his family's economic situation.  He and his wife are responsible for looking after their children's well-being and so they work as hard as they can, growing potatoes, peas, beans, corn and other vegetables.  They then take their produce to sell in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.

What Ignacio most enjoys about his work is caring for his crops since he knows that healthy produce fetches a better price.  He has been in this business for 12 years and he considers the hardest part of his work to be having to climb the steep hills of Antabamba which is where he has his farmland.

Ignacio has support from his wife who buys and sells cattle.  She fattens them up and then sells them on for a higher price.  In the future, Ignacio hopes to improve his farm and sow all of his land.

Ignacio is a member of the "Los Pinos de Antabamba" (The Pine Trees of Antabamba) community bank and this is his sixth loan from MFP.  He hopes for a small loan which will enable him to reach his goals.  For his part, he pledges once more to make his repayments on time, as he has done with his previous loans.  Ignacio enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Ignacio will invest the money he has requested in buying a bag of pea seeds, 20 sacks of Yungay potatoes, organic manure and natural fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds, 20 sacks of potato seeds, organic manure and natural fertilizers

loans.name: Cherel

texts.en: Cherel is 29 years old. She is married with three children. Cherel has a shop that sells rice, snacks, and some basic goods. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 5,000 to buy additional rice to sell and additional goods, like snacks, canned goods, oil, vinegar, and more. Cherel became a member of HSPFI this year, 2011. In the future, Cherel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and other stock to sell
